Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: New winemaker Andy McVay debuts with this vintage, showing a warm and generous style right off the bat with this lush and lovely Viognier. Citrus and peach fruit is accented with cucumber, jicama and green melon. It trails off gently into a fresh finish with a touch of wet stone.
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2017 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Light gold in color, this opens with an assertive toasted oak character, coupled with notes of grilled apple, peach pit, candied orange peel and pie crust. The palate is light in weight but soft in acidity, with round, mouthfilling flavors of wood-grilled apple, honeycomb and lightly toasted brioche. A honeyed nuttiness lingers on the enduring finish.
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Terres Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This highly aromatic wine smells fresh and herbal, with pronounced notes of sweet grass, orange blossom and touches of gingered pear and green fig. The palate is light and zippy, with good acidity and a pleasant freshness that's expressed in flavors of lime and orange zest. The finish is clean and bright, with a mouthwatering persistence.
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2017 Elisabeth Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of dried apricot, apple and spice. The fruit flavors are light, coming up short on the finish.
Name: Maison Bleue 2016 Votligeur Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This is a pretty representation of the variety's typical character, with notes of fresh peach, lychee and yellow melon on the nose and mouth, all hit by floral accents of crushed rose petal. Medium weight and smooth on the palate, it has a slick but not viscous texture and ample acidity to lift the ripe tropical-fruit tones.
Name: Les Tannes en Occitanie 2017 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a bulky, blocky wine, with chunky fruit flavors of peach and banana. It's 100% varietal, a forward fruit bomb of a wine that will be best over the next couple of years.
Name: Del Rio 2017 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A subtle note of lemon verbena is coupled with hints of crushed chalk, underripe guava, tart peach and melon rind on the delicate nose of this wine. The palate is surprisingly round and fleshy in feel, with notes of peach, fig and sweet orange. Acidity is soft and light, lending just enough lift to the ripe fruit tones to keep the wine from feeling flabby or flat.
Name: Les Jamelles 2017 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a slightly reductive tone to the nose of this wine, with a hint of struck match that blows off with air. Beyond that, notes of ripe pineapple, honeydew and a touch of honeysuckle unfold on the nose, while the medium-weight palate is enlivened by enduring flavors of pithy melon rind and orange acidity. A honeyed character lingers on the end.
Name: Domaine du Chateau d'Eau 2016 Organic Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply etched with strong botanical flavors, this young Viognier is dominated by acidity, herb, phenolics and a dominating flavor of lemon rind.
Name: Foon 2017 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Viognier, this opens with aromas of apricot, toast and an earthy note. The structured palate offers ripe yellow peach, lemon zest and vanilla while a hazelnut note wraps up the finish.
Name: Michele Satta 2016 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Hawke's Bay, New Zealand
Description: This Viognier avoids the overly fruity, flabby pitfalls that sometimes befall the variety. Instead, subtle aromas of peach pit, lemon, grapefruit and honeysuckle lead gently into a medium-bodied palate that is textural yet delicate, with honey and floral flavors at the fore. Pithy stone fruit at the finish is a refreshing close.
Name: Decibel 2016 Bridge PA Vineyard Viognier (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very pleasant and soft aromas of light honeysuckle, yellow melon and creamy peach show on the nose of this bottling from a clone imported by the Bonny Doon founder. Tangy and fresh apple-skin flavors meet with slightly sweet melon elements on the broad palate.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2017 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this typically Snake River Valley designated wine comes from Washington due to a 2017 Idaho freeze. Generous aromas of peach, orange essence and flower are followed by bone-dry fruit flavors, with peach notes lingering on the finish.
Name: Cinder 2017 Dry Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Chunky tropical aromas include notes of melon, banana and mango. A full-bodied palate is more broad and blocky than precise, while upfront papaya and quince flavors are short prior to a salty finish with almost no fruit character.
Name: Siegel 2017 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: An orange color and soft, quiet aromas of cantaloupe, peach and apricot are as good as this oddball Viognier gets. A flat palate holds oxidized flavors of caramel and bitter nuts but not much fruit, while a drying finish gets its texture from grape skins and tannins.
Name: Puente Austral 2017 Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded and plump aromas of lime blossom, sweet apple, oak and nuts are cut by a wet stone minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is much tighter than expected, with a zingy lemon quality that keeps the warmer apple, peach and sea salt flavors in check.
Name: Pelletiere 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Delicate floral and mineral aromas in this medium-bodied wine turn to rich white-peach flavors on the palate. It has very good balance, and tastes clean and refreshing while also revealing depth and a lingering finish. Barrel fermented, it offers subtlety and satisfaction at the same time.
Name: Starfield 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Made entirely from one variety in collaboration with winemaker Yves Gangloff, this imparts a subtle floral nose of jasmine and a fresh spritzy midpalate of juicy acidity. Well made and complex, it melds together bold layered flavors of lemon peel, melon and apricot into a cohesive, full-bodied and concentrated whole.
Name: Jeff Cohn 2016 2 Guys 2 Barrels Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Named after the Roman tiles (telhas) which are regularly found in the vineyard, this pure Viognier is grown at a high elevation. That gives it the essential coolness and acidity to balance its naturally rich yellow-fruit flavors. This nutmeg flavored,spicy wine is now fully balanced and ready to drink.
Name: Terras de Alter 2017 Terra d'Alter Telhas Branco Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is from certified-organic fruit that has been fermented in stainless steel, showing a fresh lively profile of textured peach, melon and coconut flavors. Steely and demure, it persists in jasmine aromas and a hint of honey.
Name: Ampelos 2017 Phi Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine was aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, the grapes from a famous corner of Saralee Kunde's sought-after vineyard. Peach and anise show on the nose and palate. It is velvety in texture, with notes of jasmine and crushed rock that offer brightness.
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2017 Benevolent Catie's Corner Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are expressive, with notes of white flower and ripe peach along with a kiss of vanilla and barrel spice. A full-bodied, dense palate follows, leading to a long, quite warm finish. There are good things going on, but they don't all come together, with the balance seeming a bit off.
Name: Force Majeure 2017 Estate Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With 6% Chardonnay and 1% Gewürztraminer, this is a well-made white that shows pretty aromas of honeysuckle on the nose. Viscous on the palate, with elements of apricot, lime and stone, it has a creamy lushness within a balanced frame of fresh acidity.
Name: Kunde 2017 Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This fruity and generous wine shows peach aromas, apricot flavors, good crisp acidity and enough body to balance it. The texture is tangy and edgy and keeps the taste buds alert.
Name: Steele 2017 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Previously marketed as Louloute, this new Viognier is unusually low in alcohol and features sharp herbal flavors of bitter grapefruit. It's far off the beaten path for this hot climate grape, yet potent and penetrating, with potential for distinctive food pairings. It was fermented in stainless and aged on the lees for about seven months.
Name: Lexème 2016 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this has an opening earthiness and jasmine profile that leads to structured, moderate acidity and plush viscous layers of baked apricot. It's hearty and full bodied.
Name: Pride Mountain 2017 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: This wine offers fresh aromas of apricots and peaches, with hints of lychee and honeysuckle on the nose. The palate is refreshing in flavors of ripe white peach, lemon juice, white flowers and crushed minerals. A steely, mineral finish carries swaths of lime zest and white pepper.
Name: Snowy Peaks 2017 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Aromas of apple and freesia prepare the palate for flavors of green apple, pear and sage. This wine is smooth in the mouth, with a soft floral finish.
Name: Dalton 2017 Reserve Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Antoine Creek Vineyard, north of the Lake Chelan appellation. Aromas of lemon balm, white peach and honeysuckle are followed by generous but still sleekly styled fruit flavors that show beautiful depth, balance and tension. Lemony acidity heightens the interest. The winery's best offering of this variety to date.
Name: Gramercy 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Pure varietal, this is as perfectly-ripened as Viognier can ever be. Rich, smooth flavors of melon and tangerine with zesty notes of Meyer lemon push the fruit forward, with underlying minerality keeping the lengthy finish fresh and invigorating. Drink now and over the next two or three years.
Name: Quady North 2017 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Guava and bubblegum aromas are very clean and cut by a steely edge on the nose. The palate tightens up considerably, offering tense lemon skin and chalky tones against rounded white-peach and guava flavors.
Name: Crū 2017 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from a vineyard at 1,300 feet of elevation—high for the state. All aged in neutral French oak, the wine has aromas that bring notes of ripe peach, apricot and flower. Full-bodied, well-structured stone fruit and creamsicle flavors follow. There's much to enjoy.
Name: K Vintners 2017 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the Riboli family's new vineyard named after the patriarch, this bottling offers tuberose and tropical aromas of mango and papaya cream on the nose, but with a chalky edge. The palate is clean and crisp in flavors of lemon curd and apple mousse.
Name: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Simonsberg-Paarl, South Africa
Description: There's a floral, spicy lift to the nose of this wine, with aromas of ginger-peach tea, honeysuckle, spiced pear and nectarine that fill the bouquet. The medium-weight palate shows a bit of heft on the midpalate, with waves of peach, nectarine, rose and honeysuckle flavors. There's just enough acidity to lift the sweet-flavor impressions, while the finish is all floral.
Name: Noble Hill 2016 Viognier (Simonsberg-Paarl)

Appellation: Similkameen Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: As the near 15% alcohol would suggest, this is a fully-ripened wine, pushing the grape's flavors into a rich, round, peachy realm. In so doing, it avoids the bitterness that can plague underripe Viognier, but feels just a little flabby in the mouth.
Name: Vanessa 2017 Viognier (Similkameen Valley)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: This is slightly warm on the nose, with spiced melon and citrus peel aromas that are coupled with grapefruit pith and green apple accents. The medium-weight palate offers just enough acidity to lift the ripe fruit flavors and sweet orange impression.
Name: Babylonstoren 2016 Viognier (Western Cape)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An uncommon offering of sweet Viognier, this bottling shows honeydew, crushed stone and orange peel on the nose. It's a tad oily on the palate with petrol-laced flavors of sour lime peel.
Name: Lion Ranch NV VP Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subdued aromas of peach and herb are followed by spritzy, full-bodied stone fruit flavors. The variety's intensity and joy seem to be missing
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Beautifully floral and inviting, this wine has a nice weight to it and a balanced approach to ripeness and acidity. Peach, lemon and wet stone carry through a midpalate of silky smoothness and peppery finish. This is an impressive version of the variety.
Name: Anaba 2017 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tightly wound and bursting with botanical highlights, there is a ginlike flavor to this pure varietal expression. Power and precision abound, and the long, phenolic finish, bone dry and detailed, defines this as a wine worth exploring and experimenting with as far as companion foods.
Name: Brooks 2017 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has light aromas of figs and crushed stone, followed by a creamy mouthfeel and subtle flavors of almond and white pepper. A couple of years in the cellar will bring out more complexity. Best after 2020.
Name: Lava Cap 2017 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of pomelo and lychee meet with peach and dried sour pear on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Tangy citrus and grapefruit flavors ride an energetic mouthfeel, with a long-lasting acid that takes a sour stretch into the finish.
Name: Jaffurs 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine begins with ripe bubblegum, peach, pear-syrup and Stargazer lily aromas, although those start to fade into more mineral tones as it sits open. The sip is quite tight, with lemony acidity and a chalky frame constraining the peachy flavors.
Name: Margerum 2017 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aged 10 months in neutral American oak, this wine has a thick gritty texture and a sweetness of peach, green apple and honey. The structure and acidity are moderate; the ripeness full bodied and intense.
Name: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Hoot Owl Creek Vineyard Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crushed sandstone and flinty mineral aromas meet with a slightly reductive nose on this bottling. The palate is very tightly wound with grassy lime-skin flavors.
Name: Black Ridge 2014 Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are generous, with notes of melon, white flower, pear and peach. The apricot and peach flavors are full bodied, sweet, ripe and nectarous with a warm finish. It delivers a lot of appeal, though the apparent residual sugar runs a bit high.
Name: Maryhill 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of honeydew and honey show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is all about a tight texture, with springtime flavors of white flowers and lime pith showing through.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Dos Vinas Vineyard Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean honeydew, lime balm and peach-orange aromas meet with vanilla and white-rock aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a flash of sweetness to the palate, where ripe apple and pear flavors combine with lemon syrup.
Name: Ferguson Crest 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a medium-weight wine that balances subtle floral and orange-zest characters against suggestions of vanilla and butter that build on the palate and add richness on the finish.
Name: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This dessert wine is quite sweet, with candied flavors of peach, apricot and papaya. It shows a decent balance between concentrated fruit tones and bright acidity.
Name: Apolloni 2014 Dolce Vino Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an oily viscous white, nutty with floral elements of jasmine and rose. A dense dry texture rides below lemon verbena and stone-fruit flavors.
Name: Domenica Amato 2017 Salomon Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Nicely crisp and dry, this medium-bodied wine smells floral and tastes a bit leesy like it just came out of a barrel. It has tangy lemon and green-apple flavors.
Name: Sera Fina 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lighter-styled aromas of herb and flower are followed by medium-sweet fruit flavors, with wilted flower notes on the finish. There's not enough acid to balance the sugar.
Name: Wilridge 2017 Broetje Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This charming wine offers richness backed by well-honed acidity, so it stays fresh on the palate through the finish. Light baking-spice and honeysuckle aromas lead to subtle vanilla and white-peach flavors that enhance the smooth mouthfeel.
Name: Le Casque 2017 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a smooth, balanced and lovely dessert wine, moderate in sweetness and heat, with lovely aromas and flavors of rose water, fresh and dried apricot and honeycomb. It will do well on its own, or as an accompaniment to a wide range of cheeses and spicy desserts.
Name: Belden Barns NV Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong stony aroma on the nose of this well-shaped bottling, along with Meyer lemon pith and dried nectarine elements. The palate is streamlined with yellow-peach and citrus-peel flavors, with a full mouthfeel that is leveled by balanced acidity and a firm texture.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and clean with even aromas of peach syrup, concentrated honeydew and a hint of wood, this fresh and bright bottling from a winery whose name means “gold” in Hawaiian includes 6% Picpoul Blanc. Citrusy flavors start the palate as the tropical touches linger in the background, wrapped in a racy texture with lots of zing into the finish.
Name: Kula 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very subtle on the nose, aromas of ripe pear and honeydew emerge with patience, as do mineral streaks of chalk and wet cement. There is abundant energy to the sip, where gravel and chalk flavors linger in the forefront and bright key lime and hints of mango and papaya show on the backdrop.
Name: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This ripe and rich wine has orange blossom and honey aromas that lead to a palate of vanilla, orange and peach flavors. It displays a smooth, thick texture, with soft acidity and a creamy presence.
Name: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This copper-colored wine, the result of eight days of skin-contact, opens with compelling aromas of wildflower, apricot and tilled red-earth. The earthy palate delivers orange zest, terracotta and rooibos tea. A tannic accent and zesty acidity lead into a long and layered finish.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Skin Contact Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This very flavorful wine has plenty of apricot and peach flavors and a saline accent that sets it apart. It smells like almonds and dried apricots, and tastes vividly fruity and nicely crisp.
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A broad lychee aroma meets with a touch of ginger powder on the nose. Apricot and orange peel show on the full-bodied palate. It shows a pleasant roundness and weight, with a long, layered finish.
Name: Veritas 2016 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Very ripe aromas of guava bubblegum and key-lime pie are leveled by crushed gravel on the nose of this solid white wine from Temecula. Lime leaf and lemongrass show on the sip, which is Sauvignon Blanc-like and finishes with a flash of sweetness.
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Chloe Vineyard Winemaker's Select Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of guava, bubblegum and pink-grapefruit rinds show on the nose of this bottling from a winery in Massachusetts. The texture is a crunchy on the palate, offering flavors of dried apples, lime extract, a pinch of herbs and, on the finish, a nutty character.
Name: Balderdash 2016 ‘Til Death Do Us Part Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of barrel spice, creamsicle and flower lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors and a warm finish. The oak influence seems a bit overweighted for the fruit in the bottle.
Name: Gård 2015 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is nutty on the nose. A hints of an underripe papaya aroma is followed by a tangy impression on the palate. Oily in feel and full in body, the finish is long and flabby.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Pear and apricot aromas are joined by a soapy gardenia note. The palate is ripe and loaded with peach, guava, lemon and rose. Blood orange acidity moves to a finish of apple and blossoms.
Name: Landon 2016 Bingham Family Vineyards Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Tight aromas of banana, white grape and juniper show on the nose of this Viognier. The ripe yet racy palate is framed by decent acidity, while delivering flavors of pastille candies and melon.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2017 Jefferson's Own Estate Reserve Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Aromas of warm sugar cookie and baked pear carry the nose. The palate offers a bit more freshness in flavors of apple, lemon and hints of creamed butter and vanilla. The finish brings Bosc pear and lemon pith.
Name: Pedernales 2016 Reserve Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Marigold flowers mingle with orange peel and white pepper on the nose. Naval orange and lemon flavors are muddle and tinged with a vegetal note on the palate. The finish offers pithy pink grapefruit and white pepper.
Name: Grape Creek Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, wilted flower and stone fruit are followed by full-bodied, dry, lightly creamy feeling peach flavors. The oak seems a bit heavy-handed.
Name: Waterbrook 2017 Icon Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite subdued for the variety, with light notes of flower and spice. The palate is medium bodied, focused down the middle with stone fruit flavors that taper at the edges.
Name: Dusty Cellars 2017 Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Quiet tones of white flowers and citrus carry the nose and palate. This is a simple, straightforward white that would appeal to those looking for a light, crisp refresher.
Name: Bedell 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full flavored and rather full bodied, too, this wine exudes vivid and spicy aromas of pears, browned butter and toasted almonds, feels broad and mouthfilling and has softly ripe flavors. Light baking spices add complexity and a nicely viscous texture combines with good acidity for a lingering finish.
Name: Terre Rouge 2016 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded honeysuckle, honey butter and seared white-peach aromas make for a fairly rich entry to this estate bottling. Yellow-peach and creamy mango flavors show on the sip, but the ripe fruit evolves into a savory sea salt and saffron side, finishing with a hint of pound cake.
Name: Roblar 2017 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fat in mouthfeel, waxy and earthy in aroma and rich, apricot-like and nutty in flavor, this wine emphasizes savory notes rather than fruity ones and richness in texture rather than crispness. Dried meats like prosciutto and salami could be great pairings.
Name: Terre Rouge 2015 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Maryland, Maryland, US
Description: This delightful Viognier offers aromas of ripe lemon, gooseberry, fresh cut grass and crushed white gravel on the nose. The palate is soft and caressing, but with plenty of mild mannered acidity to bolster flavors of peach, lemon-lime and rocks. It finishes on a white peach and lime juice note.
Name: Big Cork Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Maryland)

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lavish and perfumed, this full-bodied Viognier offers loads of musky floral, potpourri and grapefruit aromas. Dry in style, it's a plump, cream-textured wine balanced by soft citrus acidity and a flurry of tea-leaf bitters on the finish. Enjoy now–2022.
Name: Domaine de Montine 2017 Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very viscous and darkish yellow in the glass, this dessert wine offers fairly dainty aromas of smoke, oak and lemon sorbet. It's thick and sweet at first on the sip, but settles into honey and pleasant oak, with a savory roasted chicken finish.
Name: Alara 2016 Late Harvest Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: San Benito County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Refreshing aromas of key lime, pear flesh and the slightest hint of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and tight with Asian pear and lime-pith flavors, wrapped in a decent tannic tension.
Name: Alara 2017 Viognier (San Benito County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a tight weave on this bottling, which offers grapefruit rind and pear flesh on the nose alongside flint, steel and white-flower aromas. It's clean and crisp on the palate, with grassy flavors that are unusual for Viognier but quite welcome.
Name: Eberle 2017 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Description: Bright, grassy notes lead the nose with peach, lime juice and bell pepper. The round palate offers concentrated notes of beach grass, kumquat and more lime juice. Tingling acidity builds towards the zesty finish, loaded with yellow peach and white pepper.
Name: Jones von Drehle 2015 Estate Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this wine is a blend of fruit from Sawtooth, Martin and Williamson vineyards. Bright aromas of tangerine, mouthwatering ripe peach and honeysuckle lead to plentiful stone fruit flavors that glide on the apricot-filled finish.
Name: Cinder 2016 Dry Viognier

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A bright blend of honeysuckle and mango flavors give plenty of personality to this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lifts the mouthfeel for a refreshing, but still rich flavor profile.
Name: Cline 2017 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Yadkin Valley, North Carolina, US
Description: The nose displays aromas of orange blossoms, gardenias, peach fuzz and green pears. The slick palate is zippy in flavors of Mandarin and lime, joined by sweet grass, yellow pepper and a hint of lemon pith.
Name: Medaloni 2016 Viognier (Yadkin Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly cloudy in the glass, this bottling, featuring a great label by artist Ethan Stuart, starts with aromas of mashed-up lemons, crushed nuts, and oak. That smoky lemon tang shows strongly on the palate too, which verges on savory, with hints of roast chicken, sea salt and herbs.
Name: Dusty Nabor 2017 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of white flowers meet with an orange-banana smoothie and sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows the sweetness of apple flesh with a rounded woody character, making for solid flavors even if the acid is a tad weak.
Name: Falkner 2017 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach and ripe apples meet with a strong kick of honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling, one of the few Viogniers from the appellation. There is decent tension to the palate, where more white flowers and pome-fruit flavors approach tropicality but are wrapped in a compelling texture.
Name: Zotovich 2017 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is one of the few examples of the variety coming out of this region. Slightly cloudy in color, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of peach, whole lime, mineral and wet stone. The palate is light but flavorful, with the concentration waxing and waning throughout.
Designation: In the Rocks Vineyard Estate White
Name: Reynvaan Family Vineyards 2016 In the Rocks Vineyard Estate White Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Carolina, North Carolina, US
Description: This orange Viognier, fermented on the skins, is cloudy in appearance, offering aromas of Mandarins, lychees, yellow peaches and fresh lillies. Drying tannins and a dandelion note distract from candied orange peel, dried flower and dried apicot flavors on the palate. A good effort, there is plenty of acidity for balance but the moderate finish of tea tannins and persimmons is lacking in concentration.
Name: Sanctuary Vineyards 2016 Handcrafted Vin Orange Viognier (North Carolina)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: This is a ripe wine, offering aromas of blossoms, gooseberries and pears. The exuberant palate doles out juicy lemons, apricots and apples, with touches of blossoms, white pepper and grass. Delicately balanced, this is light footed but carries some weight from the alcohol. It stays ripe through the finish, with a final wave of white peaches and white pepper pleasantly lingering.
Name: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2017 Viognier (Colorado)
Winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: This herbaceous Viognier dispalys aromas of tangerine, dandelion, pear and kale. The weightier palate shows ripe tangerine and nectarine balanced by fresh greens and a good kick of acidity flowing into a white peach and white pepper finish.
Name: Grande River 2015 Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Cochise County, Arizona, US
Description: Shy notes of lemon peel, white flower, peach fuzz and clementine zest are slowly revealed on the nose. This has a round mouthfeel with gently tingling acidity. Flavors of nectarine and grapefruit are tinged with endives and are neutral in character, leading to a ripe lemon finish dusted with white pepper.
Name: Page Springs 2014 Pillsbury Vineyard Viognier (Cochise County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An assertive oaky streak covers ripe apple and caramel flavors in this full-bodied wine. It shows pronounced aromas of charred wood and smoke in the aroma that continue on the palate.
Name: Sobon Estate 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This is a soft-textured, medium-bodied wine with floral, earthy aromas and butterscotch flavors that come off as candied and a touch sweet. It's well made and should appeal to people who don't like their wines bone dry.
Name: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Viognier (California)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of flower, nectarine, lime and herb lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It's a well made example of the variety.
Name: TruthTeller 2017 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Forward scents of peach, passion fruit, rose and fresh ginger are coupled with a soft warmth on the nose of this bottling. It's medium in weight on the palate, with a round, mouth-filling texture that could use a bit more lift to counter the ripe fruit tones.
Name: Michel Gassier 2017 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Willcox, Arizona, US
Description: Aromas of gooseberry and white peach tinged with vanilla are joined by a whiff of spoiled tangerine. The palate is certainly round, with a pudding like weight highlighting the vanilla and creamy lemon cookie flavors, though there is enough acidity for balance.
Name: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Viognier (Willcox)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Very floral and aromatic from the start, this opens with enticing scents of ginger-peach tea, jasmine and rose water. It's medium in weight, with a slight viscosity that lends a slick texture to the palate and final notes of muddled peach flesh.
Name: Maison de la Villette 2017 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Colorado, Colorado, US
Description: A rich white apricot aroma wafts from the glass. The palate starts ripe, with juicy flavors of donut peach, but quickly rushes into a bitter, pithy finish with white pepper spice and spoiled clementine.
Name: Creekside Cellars 2016 Viognier (Colorado)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Flower, white peach and crystal-clear mineral and wet stone aromas lead to a full-bodied rounded palate that shows a beautiful sense of transparency and length. Minerality is much discussed and debated. This wine is a check mark in the column for its existence.
Name: Cayuse 2016 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This skin-fermented wine is terracotta in color, with elegant aromas of mango, marmalade, honeysuckle and dried apricot. A delicate tannic structure offers support to the concentrated fruit flavors on the palate, leading to the dry, lingering finish.
Name: King Family 2016 Small Batch Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Quady usually makes a pair of Viogniers, but this time they combined them. Sourced from the Ox Block and Steelhead Run vineyards (hence the name), this sports lush Meyer lemon, grapefruit and white-peach flavors. A light touch of fresh herb highlights sweet toasty barrel flavors through the finish. Some 30% was barrel fermented.
Name: Quady North 2016 Steel-Ox Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral in jasmine, this is a nicely put together wine, tight in firm integrated acidity. Light layers of apple and peach give it a bright succulence that belies the underlying ripeness and unctuous texture.
Name: Kobler 2017 Marsha's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Citrus-driven, this wine has great juicy acidity and midweight structure, plus a vibrancy that persists in the glass. Green apple and stone fruit complete the picture.
Name: McKahn 2017 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Honey, apple and pear along with a sweetness of white peach characterize the bold lush flavors in this full-bodied, voluptuously textured white. Hints of ginger and lemongrass tease in the background, adding an exotic element to the whole.
Name: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Cold Creek Vineyard Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a new, everyday-sipping label for Michael Larner, and this wine is extremely fresh on the nose, showing clean and crisp aromas of melon, Asian pear, apple flesh and chalk. There is great zip to the sip, with key lime at first and then more rounded flavors of orange cream and honeydew.
Name: Earthfluence 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, made from organic grapes by Brittany Rice-Claypool, whose family founded Sunstone Winery, starts with a nearly savory kick of aged goat cheese, saffron, nuts and dried orange peels. The palate is crisp with sunny flavors of lemon and pear, bolstered by well-integrated acid—an uncommon but intriguing Viognier.
Name: Millésimé 2015 Le Jardin Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of cantaloupe and daffodil approach a buttery element on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great grip and fresh acidity on the palate, where mango cream, smoke and crushed sandstone flavors arise.
Name: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Strong flavors of crunchy apple with hints of cured meat ride along an unctuous texture in this estate-grown wine that holds its acidity well.
Name: Hawley 2017 Hawley Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of passionfruit and overripe apples are offset by a grassy, fiddlehead fern note. On the palate, an acidic lift of lemon-lime and candied grapefruit mingle with ginger spices. This feels zesty for a Viognier and its bright nature gives it a long, refreshing finish.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of melon and pear are cut by a key-lime spritz and Meyer lemon pith, and a flash of tropical bubblegum comes out as well. The palate is pretty tight at first and then come the guava and banana flavors, all held up by racy acidity.
Name: Barton 2017 River Clare Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a bottling for oak lovers, starting with aromas of smoked cantaloupe and lemon peels. That smoke element envelops the palate, where acidity lifts the lemon-and-herb-roasted-chicken flavors, which finish on caramel and pound cake.
Designation: Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée
Name: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from a site along Petaluma Hill Road, this is an herbal, creamy and lush wine that was fermented in stainless steel and is now wrapped in good tight acidity. Lemon meringue and green-apple flavors balance each other and allow the wine to maintain lasting freshness.
Name: Ledson 2017 Grove Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas and flavors show notes of vanilla, pear tart, flower and spice, with fruit and barrel playing off each other. There's plenty of enjoyment to be had.
Name: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This wine displays aromas and flavors of peach, orange peel, pear drop and coconut. Round and fat in feel, this has a long, rich finish.
Name: Veritas 2017 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Yamhill-Carlton, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless fermented, this thin, green effort shows little fruit flavor apart from tart citrus. There's a bit of lemon rind along with the juice, and despite going through 100% malolactic it's still a tart acid-driven wine.
Name: Et Fille 2016 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Floral and tropical in aroma and flavor, this wine displays tones of elderflower, papaya and grass. It is round and mouthcoating, with a long, fruity finish.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine starts out quite reduced. Behind that are aromas of peach, apricot, Creamsicle and flower. There's a pleasing sense of weight and viscosity to the palate, without ever getting bogged down.
Name: K Vintners 2016 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of pear drop, limestone and ginger spice are medium in intensity. The palate follows suit, with a bit of grassiness coming through. It's fresh and vibrant in feel, with a creamy touch.
Name: Flying Fox 2017 Viognier (Shenandoah Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This carries aromas of lemon-lime, ripe yellow apple, apricot and lees. The flavors echo the nose, with a hint of button mushroom. Warm in feel with ample body, the finish is long and full.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Soft aromas of grilled peach, marzipan, ginger and acacia are pleasant on the nose and come through on the palate. Ginger and oak spice are major players for the flavors, carried by a creamy, plush feel.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This offers faint honeydew, chamomile and elderflower tones on the nose. The palate is similar, boasting more floral and melon flavors.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty, metallic and tropical, this estate-grown white takes on a voluptuous, unctuous texture and sweet ripeness.
Name: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral and brimming in green apple on entry, this wine takes on a confectionery air of candied ginger and tropical mango as it opens in the glass.
Name: MacLaren 2017 Aida Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is seriously tropical, with candied honeydew, coconut oil and guava paste. The palate is oily and also tropically heavy, with mango and banana flavors.
Name: Bellante 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Gorgeous white-blossom perfume and hints of sweet spice introduce this full-bodied Viognier. While rich and round on the palate, its pristine gooseberry and white-grapefruit flavors are fresh and invigorating. It's a juicy, vibrant wine to enjoy now–2022.
Name: Domaine de la Charité 2017 La Dame Blanche Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shaved apple and nectarine aromas meet with a white-flower touch on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a backyard vineyard in Solvang. There is lots of zip on the tightly wound sip, which is laser-focused from the front to midpalate but opens a bit toward riper pear and apple on the finish.
Name: Dovecote 2017 Quail Valley Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by freezing the grapes prior to extraction, this dessert wine shows candied red apple, dried honeydew and a hint of tuberose on the nose. The palate is viscous but balanced by zesty acidity that penetrates deep into the finish, offering flavors of lime spritz and apple syrup.
Name: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin de Glaciere Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling walks a fine line between ripe peach and more reserved elements of lemon and key lime. There is a strong stony and chalky kick to the palate, where tangy lemon-rind flavors meet with yellow apples.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeysuckle and white-grapefruit aromas perfume this fresh, aromatic sip. While dry and full in body, pristine citrus flavors lend refreshment and vibe. Enjoy this easygoing, juicy wine now–2020.
Name: Château du Trignon 2017 Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Exotic aromas of yuzu, quince sorbet, peach and mandarin orange show on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the region's Rhône pioneer. That quince flavors holds strong into the palate, where it's cut by lime juice.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a great deal of restraint leveled across this bottling, starting with the tightly wound nose of apple and pear. Similar flavors play into the palate, but the sip is all about racy acidity and chalky texture.
Name: Zinke 2016 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Israel, Israel
Description: This wine has a nose of clementine and vanilla bean. It offers good mouthfeel, with nectarine, honeydew melon, pineapple and almond blossom flavors that finish with a touch of iodine.
Name: Covenant Israel 2017 Blue C Viognier (Israel)

Appellation: Sicilia, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Viognier, this opens with aromas of citrus and yellow stone fruit. Mirroring the nose, the straightforward enjoyable palate offers juicy apricot and grapefruit. Enjoy soon.
Name: Fazio 2017 Viognier (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Somewhat exotic aromas of wild lime and Anjou pear show on the nose of this bottling. Pink Lady apple and riper pear flavors show on the palate, which shows decent restraint for this grape, especially in a warmer region.
Name: MCV 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple skins, dried white flowers and Asian pear flesh aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers ripe apples, pears and dried orange peels.
Name: Barton 2017 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: Medium yellow in color, this has white melon and guava aromas. Although it is a still wine, it has a slightly effervescent feel on the tongue, with lemon, white peach and passion fruit flavors and a note of bitter almond on the finish.
Name: Yatir 2016 Viognier (Judean Hills)

Appellation: La Mancha, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This wine's tan color and soapy pear and red apple aromas make for a confounding start. Its soapy, yeasty pink grapefruit and grape skin flavors finish with tropical notes. While not bad, it's odd and disjointed.
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2017 Viento Aliseo Biodynamic Viognier (La Mancha)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Part of the winery's reserve tier, this was barrel-fermented, offering a totally different set of flavors from the stainless steel-fermented Viognier. It is lush on the palate, with concentrated apple, grapefruit and papaya flavors and a buttery, toasty finish.
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Darow Series Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery's best white, this decadently rich wine is packed with ripe honeysuckle, Meyer lemon, orange, tangerine, peach and apricot flavors. It's a totally delicious fruit bomb to be enjoyed now–2022.
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: 2Hawk does exceptionally well with its Viogniers. This one is bright and spicy, its flavors jumping agilely from citrus to apple to pineapple to mango. This is well balanced and lingering.
Name: 2Hawk 2017 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine wraps subtle fruity and floral flavors in a rich mouthfilling texture that feels sweet even though it's a dry wine. It has layers of light honeysuckle, vanilla and apricot that persist from the aroma through a lingering finish.
Name: Naggiar 2017 Estate Grown Root 49 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and well-rounded on the nose, this bottling shows ripe pear, tight banana, white flowers and a toasty warmth. There's a hint of mango tropicality on the sip, but the bright citrusy edge of lime juice and flashes of toast and wood provide balance.
Name: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lightly honeyed aromas as well as honeydew meet with crushed chalk and hot sand on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows strong and fresh lemon flavors alongside a touch of cantaloupe, but remains expertly restrained throughout.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2016 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This rather hefty and powerful white wine has plenty to explore. It offers aromas of smoke, roses and flint, flavors that are ripe like pears with a savory aspect like sliced fennel bulb and a big rounded texture.
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This take on skin-contact Viognier works, but won't be for everyone. Murky in the glass, it shows aromas of smashed honeydew, melon rind and Meyer lemon on the edges. The palate is where things get interesting, with a creamy mouthfeel delivering flavors of orange bitters, lemon rind and honeydew candies. It's a great conversation starter.
Name: Ruby Cellars 2016 Orange Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle and pleasant aromas of lemon rind, nectarine, key lime and the hint of toast show on the nose of this well restrained Viognier. There are tropical touches of guava on the sip, but the lime flavors, strong acidity and grippy texture keep it in line.
Name: Wilson Creek 2016 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Enticing scents of rose, lychee, lilac and ginger-peach tea lead the nose of this pretty and highly aromatic white. The medium-weight palate is slightly slick in feel, but balanced by ample acidity and spiced orange and peach tones that remain through the close. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de la Baume 2016 Elisabeth Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of pound cake, apple galette and plumeria are bound together in a tight steely frame on the nose of this bottling. There's a bright and sharp grapefruit edge to the palate but also a pastry-like warmth, but it's the high-acid that takes center stage, arising on the front of the sip and carrying deep into the finish.
Name: Thacher 2016 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an austere wine with a waxy element to its texture, highlighted in fennel and grass. Fresh and high in acidity, it's flinty on the finish.
Name: People's Wine Revolution 2015 Salem Ranch Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Honeycomb, apple skin and light sweet-spice aromas set the scene for the nose and mouth of this medium-weight wine. The palate offers additional flavors of ripe melon flesh, while a peach-pit accent unfolds on the close. Drink now.
Name: La Forge Estate 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aged in concrete and hailing from three different vineyards, this is an extremely ripe and unctuous bottling, starting with aromas of banana Jolly Rancher with a hint of grapefruit juice. The palate is extremely tropical, blending papaya, guava and banana flavors as well as a dominating coconut-oil element.
Name: Pulchella 2017 Drifter Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is the current release, though well past its vintage. It seems flat on first sip but recoups itself with a lingering finish that reflects well-aged Viognier. Drink up.
Name: Simple Machine 2013 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Red Willow vineyards, this offers aromas of orange blossom, ripe peach, toast and spice. The medium-bodied palate brings stone-fruit flavors that dip slightly in the middle, finishing bitter. This variety can be a difficult needle to thread, with this one not quite pulling it off.
Name: Mark Ryan 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: There is a lot going on in this wine, from the depth of flavors and aromas to the compelling mouthfeel. Aromas of honeydew, juniper, white peach meld with coconut, ground ginger and butter. Smooth and creamy in the mouth, this could stand up to a hearty meal. The finish is long and evolving.
Name: Stone Tower 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very intriguing and unique on the nose, this richer yet not tropical take on Viognier shows banana flambé, meringue, spun sugar and peach blossom on the nose. The soft supple palate combines baked pastries, custard, cherimoya, pear and nectarine sorbet flavors, leading toward marshmallow. It is both fascinating and delicious.
Name: Site 2015 Larner Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This biodynamic producer excels at Viognier, and this vintage is especially succulent, with a juicy and compelling mix of stone fruit, Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors. Impeccably balanced, textured and long, with citrus rind highlights, it spent just four months in 30% new oak. Its flavors remain clean and clear all the way through a delicious finish.
Name: Cowhorn 2016 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: Lightly wood aged but with its fruitiness intact, this ripe wine conveys yellow-fruit flavors. Acidity and minerality dominate the touches of toast and the creamy, vanilla texture. This rich, intense wine needs to develop. Drink from 2019.
Name: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2016 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe tropical fruit in the aroma, fresh clean flavors and a rich texture buoyed by good acidity make this medium-bodied wine easy to like. Barrel-fermented in mostly neutral oak, it's smooth and fairly broad on the palate, and stays nice and dry and firm on the finish.
Name: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though light on the nose, there is a distinctive toasted hazelnut aromas on this bottling along with nectarine cream, brioche and citrus rind. The palate is a fuller expression yet without becoming tropical, offering toast with marmalade flavors, a lively acidity and a grippy texture.
Name: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The winery lists this as a reserve, though there doesn't appear to be any such indication on the label. The flavors are robust, penetrating and succulent, suggesting Meyer lemon, lime and pineapple.
Name: Dominio IV 2015 Glass House Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This barrel-fermented wine is fruity, full bodied and loaded with apple, peach and snappy grapefruit flavors. It's well balanced, ripe while keeping its alcohol in check, and framed with well-managed fruit skin flavors.
Name: Agate Ridge 2015 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Tropical fruits come through in abundance here, from mango and guava to peach and citrus. It's all about fresh, forward fruit and best enjoyed while it's still in the first blush of youth.
Name: Season 2016 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant Asian pear, apple blossoms and wet stone make for a restrained take on Viognier by young winemaker Natalie Darr. It's a tad riper on the palate, with poached pear and hints of tropical fruit, but also a zesty acidity and firm chalky texture throughout.
Name: Rococo 2017 Alta Colina Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Nagambie Lakes, Victoria, Australia
Description: A charming wine from a historic Victorian winery, the nose is perfumed in tones of ripe stone fruits, florals and sun-kissed grapes. The grape's characteristic oiliness is out in full force on the palate, but there's a good deal of acidity to cope with the weight and fruit bowl flavors. Tones of ginger and white pepper ring on the finish.
Name: Tahbilk 2017 Estate Grown and Bottled Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: From one of the Yarra Valley's most historic wineries, this wine brings appealing floral and savory characters on the nose. The palate is this wine's savior: tangy, salty, nutty and oily-textured, with beautifully balanced acidity.
Name: Yeringberg 2015 Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A tad reductive at first, this bottling shows dried lemon skins and pink grapefruit rinds, and slowly opens into a more floral experience. The palate offers warm white peach and guava notes, nicely restrained for the grape.
Name: Le P'tit Paysan 2015 L'Apiculteur Cedar Lane Vineyard Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Floral and citrus aromas meet almond and honeysuckle flavors in this medium-bodied, full-flavored and unoaked wine. It has the palate impact of a big Chardonnay but a different array of flavors to explore.
Name: Suveg 2016 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This heady wine offers aromas of lychee, stone fruit and rose water, with a lovely saltiness at its core. The palate shows the variety's characteristic oily texture, with some apparent oak spice leading to a ginger and white pepper finish.
Name: Yalumba 2016 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the winery's bottlings that form an ode to the farm crews, this wine starts with hints of honey, lemon syrup and pear skins on the nose. There is a strong vibrancy to the sip, where lime juice cuts through the ripe pear flavors.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Aromas of nuts, smoke, and bread combine on the nose over tones of peach and flowers. While the palate's richness and oak flavors are on the clunky side, nevertheless, lovers of full-bodied whites will enjoy this barrel-chested style.
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of Bosc pear, fresh citrus and a pinch of chalk show on the nose of this bottling. The wine hits the palate with a riper sweetness that washes into zesty wild lime rind flavors.
Name: Sculpterra 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: A ripe take on an already unctuous grape, this bottling shows tuberose, lily, ripe white peach and fresh nectarine on the rich nose. The palate is also very ripe with flavors of Bosc and Anjour pear, baked apple and strong honeysuckle.
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Viognier (South Coast)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rarely does a sparkling Viognier hit the market, and it's doubtful that any could be as good as this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher. Extremely effervescent bubbles shoot out aromas of Asian pear, lemon zest, gardenia and the slighest hint of guava tropicality. The bubbles are soft on the sip, carrying honeydew and sharp lime flavors.
Designation: Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc
Name: Thacher 2013 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a 100% varietal wine fermented and aged in neutral French oak, the vines grown at 2,100-feet elevation. Viscous and floral, it's deliciously balanced, with well-defined layers of apricot, white pepper, honey and vanilla wafer.
Name: Pride Mountain 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of yellow flowers, lemon wedges, pear flesh, beeswax and a kiss of oak show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard formerly known as Verna's. There is great grip to the palate, with lemon oil, sandalwood and chamomile flavors, framed by a chalky structure. It offers good cellaring potential.
Name: Bonny Doon 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Red pear skins, poached pear flesh, white peach and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a winery that makes a lot of Viognier. More peach, mango, tropical fruits and pencil shavings show on the sip, which is woven together by tight tannins and a pithy grip.
Name: Bellante 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This full-bodied white opens with aromas of ripe apricot, butterscotch and a touch of cedar. The rich palate offers yellow peach, ripe lime and vanilla while a hazelnut note graces the finish.
Name: Michele Satta 2015 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Grignan-les-Adhémar, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Exuberant notes of honeysuckle, apricot and tangerine perfume this rich, voluminous dry white. Fresh pink grapefruit and lemon flavors are concentrated and bright, enriched by silky skeins of caramel and honey that linger warmly on the finish. It's a remarkable value for a balanced, lovely Viognier.
Name: Domaine de Montine 2016 Viognier (Grignan-les-Adhémar)

Appellation: Mediterranée, France Other, France
Description: Fresh apricot, tangerine and yellow-apple notes abound in this silk-textured wine. Dry in style with soft, yielding acidity, it's an appealing Viognier at an irresistible price.
Name: Marrenon 2016 Les Grains Viognier (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of honeysuckle, lily and Key lime pie are fresh and crisp on the nose of this bottling by pop star Fergie and her father. The racy palate sizzles with acidity, offering bright flavors of tart lime skin and chilled apple flesh.
Name: Ferguson Crest 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: France, France Other, France
Description: Crisp and restrained, this unusually demure Viognier offers all of the variety's fragrant tangerine and blossom notes in a package that's taut and spry. Dry and intensely mineral, it finishes with just a kiss of warmth and a lingering swirl of orange cream.
Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2015 Viognier (France)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong honeydew aromas meet with plumeria and cold steel on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by a small family winery that's been producing since 2000. The rounded soft palate shows white-peach and poached-pear flavors.
Name: Bellante 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, candied lemon, woody earth and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. There is good energy to the sip, where flavors of lemon rind, toasted brioche, sea salt and woodsmoke show. It is a somewhat savory expression.
Name: Bellante 2015 Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Delicate notes of apricot and tangerine extend from nose to finish in this dense, richly textured Viognier. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but silky and mouthfilling. The finish is just a touch nutty and warming.
Name: Domaine La Tour de Gâtigne 2015 Viognier (Cévennes)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a strong sense of restraint on this cleanly made, fresh bottling, which is better than overripe and yet leaves a bit to be desired. The faintest of peach aromas on the nose lead into light flavors of nectarine and coconut on the palate, which offers decent textural grip.
Name: Boekenoogen 2016 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)

Appellation: Rhône Valley, France
Description: Perfumed notes of potpourri, dried lavender and spice accent this soft, full-bodied dry white. It's a touch muted and earthy on the palate but silky and smooth in mouthfeel. The finish is long, accented by savory tones of nut and dried citrus peel.
Name: Clos du Père Clément 2015 Viognier

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A whiff of white flowers, then a crush of ripe fruit, and the wine opens with tangy lemon, grapefruit and peach flavors. Notes of citrus rind add depth and the acids strike just the right chord.
Name: Amalie Robert 2016 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Far from simply fruity, this is a complex and sophisticated wine that shows how distinctive the grape variety can be. It relies on savory, minerally flavors that have wonderful subtlety and reserve. With each sip it settles a little deeper on the palate, lingering for a long finish buoyed by underlying acidity.
Name: Lava Cap 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: In the opulent, concentrated school of thought this wonderful luxurious-tasting wine is shaped by very ripe fruit flavors and generous helpings of suave oak. Flavors run from marzipan to honeysuckle and poached pears, and a nicely viscous texture fills the mouth and helps the finish linger.
Name: Cedarville 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Greyton, South Africa
Description: Soft, toasty notes of apple skin, creamed melon and orange peel greet the nose and carry through to the medium-weight palate, where they're met with additional hints of melon rind and baking spice. A pithy texture lends length to the close. Drink now.
Name: Lismore 2015 Viognier (Greyton)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a light, appetizing style of a sometimes heavy varietal. Unique citrus and pine aromas lead to juicy, fresh and tangy flavors that range from lemon to honeysuckle. On the palate it's crisp and clean, lightly fruity and refreshing.
Name: Steele 2016 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine oozes fresh fruity, floral aromas and has light bright flavors to match. Touches of honey and orange come out on the palate, where the texture feels just right between a touch of richness and liveliness.
Name: Mount Aukum 2015 Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: The nose offers intense aromas of orange peel, dried apricot, marmalade and ginger, which carries to the palate along with fresh brioche. It feels creamy and round, with a supple body lending itself to a long, opulent finish.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2015 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, ripe apricot and butterscotch while the textured palate offers cedar, vanilla and lemon drop. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Villa Pinciana 2015 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Maremma Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow peach, citrus and a whiff of almond carry over to the medium-bodied palate. Fresh acidity gives it a bright finish.
Name: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unusual aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, lime zest and white flower are followed by light flower and peach flavors that finish tart. It doesn't all come together.
Name: Eternal 2016 Eternal Sunshine Morrison Lane Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Aromas of clementine and juniper berry set the scene for flavors of apricot, white peach, and almond. Offering nice mouthfeel, this wine has a touch of almond blossom on the short finish.
Name: Dalton 2016 Reserve Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, peach and flower are followed by broad honeysuckle and stone-fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.
Name: Watermill 2015 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is bursting with passion fruit, honeydew, peach and elderflower aromas that carry right through to the palate. The mouthfeel is a little flimsy but there are great flavors here.
Name: Sunset Hills 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: This wine shows mealy apple, margarine and nut aromas on the nose. The flavors are similar yet the mouthfeel is easy-going and pleasing.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier above 16% alcohol is really pushing the boundaries of ripeness, and it results in a rather flat-tasting wine with one-dimensional fruit flavors and nothing else. Peaches and melon, with a hint of citrus rind come through, but how do you match this to food?
Name: Schmidt 2016 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier can turn sharp and bitter, as it hints at here. The flavors emphasize green botanicals, lime skin and pith. It's definitely on the less-than-optimal side of ripe for this difficult grape.
Name: Whitetail Ridge 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Layers of spice, vanilla and toast are integrated from nose to palate in this elegant Condrieu. It's an unctuous, textured sip marked by silken waves of orange water, blossom and cream. The acidity is soft but lemony, lending freshness to a salty, savory hazelnut finish.
Name: Delas Frères 2016 Clos Boucher  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Invigorating freshness sets this impeccably balanced Viognier apart in a flight of peers. Crisp yellow peach, mango and orange flavors are pristine and cutting, accented by subtle vanilla, spice and marshmallow. It's primary and fruity without restraint, yet elegantly composed in heft and body.
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Pronounced earth tones on the first whiff dissipate with aeration to reveal a complex array of tropical fruit and floral aromas. Rich and broad on the palate, this wine offers a lavish concoction of sun-kissed tangerine, pineapple and peach flavors kissed with vanilla and spice. The finish is a touch warming but silken and expansive.
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2014 La Combe de Malleval  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeycomb and marzipan accent bright tangerine and peach flavors in this delectably silken sip. It's unctuous and plush in mouthfeel but balanced firmly with sunny citrus acidity and airy plumes of violet and honeysuckle florals.
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Fresh, primary notes of peach and pear are lifted by lavish orange blossom and honeysuckle perfume. This warming, plush wine is full of vanilla, cream and custard but lemony acidity and delicate spice and smoke tones maintain the finesse.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Whiffs of orange blossom, vanilla and toast mingle enticingly on this plump but elegantly balanced Viognier. Crisp tangerine and white-peach flavors lend freshness to the midpalate. The finish is long, marked by a swirl of vanilla cream that lingers richly.
Name: Delas Frères 2016 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Vanilla, honeysuckle and grapefruit are shaded in savory shades of earth, pollen and nuts in this creamy, full-bodied Viognier. It's a hefty, concentrated wine with soft acidity but hints of lemon and orange peel brighten a lingering finish.
Name: Rémi Niero 2014 Chéry  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are subdued for the variety but intriguing, with notes of pear, ginger, wet rock and peach, along with cinnamon and light barrel spices. The palate is considerably more forward, with abundant stone-fruit flavors that show concentration and richness along with a sense of restraint.
Name: Charles Smith 2014 Lawrence Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas explode with notes of honeysuckle, ripe peach, apricot and creamsicle. The flavors are supremely rich but also show a beautiful sense of delicacy along with a pronounced finish. It's full bore but delicious.
Name: K Vintners 2015 Powerline Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Veins of waxy orange and lemon peels freshen this full-bodied but lively Viognier. Vanilla bean and tangerine flavors are rich and silky on the palate accented by fragrant swirls of honeysuckle. The finish is a tad warming but lingers pleasantly.
Name: Maison Denuzière 2014 Aphrodite  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Four years after bottling, the vibrance of Viognier's characteristic honeysuckle and tropical fruit are waning here, but a fascinating transformation of earth, nut and spice is taking place. Full bodied and concentrated, the palate offers muted, dustier flavors of dried orange peel and apple shaded with hints of dried herb and bramble.
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2013 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of crisp Asian pear, pomelo pith and talcum show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely grippy, fresh and texturally compelling, with racy flavors of grapefruit pith, Key lime rind and a hint of melon.
Name: Lion Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright aromas of melon, strawberry guava, lemon blossom, tuberose and ripe apples show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines citrusy energy and decent tension with ripe pear and guava-cream flavors.
Name: Barton 2016 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Broad aromas of honeydew, tuberose and guava prove quite floral and tropical, and there is a chalky backbone providing aromatic structure. Crisp, clean flavors of Juicy Fruit gum show on the palate.
Name: D'Alfonso-Curran 2016 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
