Description: Very chalky, tightly wound and mineral-driven on the nose, this expertly restrained bottling also shows Key lime, slight white peach and a whiff of daffodil on the nose. Zippy as can be on the sip, flavors of lime and pink lemon are overshadowed by chalky tensions and limestone flavors, much like licking a white rock.
Name: Jaffurs 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Deftly handled, this wine sidesteps the variety's characteristic heat and bitterness. Instead, it's loaded with spicy, gin-like botanical highlights and juicy, fresh lime and citrus fruit.
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2016 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: El Pomar District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly reserved on the nose, this bottling offers Condrieu-esque aromas of honeydew candy and creamy tropical fruits without going overripe. There's a citrusy, Key lime freshness at the tip of the sip, and then come more plush flavors of nectarine in the midpalate, finishing with a creamy texture.
Name: Pomar Junction 2016 Viognier (El Pomar District)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This cool, aromatic, low-alcohol Viognier shows citrus rind and botanical scents. Lime flesh and skin flavors come through, with a core of green apple fruit. It's just underripe but well made and drinking nicely.
Name: Iris Vineyards 2016 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier has a real chance to shine in southern Oregon, and this is proof positive. Citrus zest and lemon oil notes accent its lush orange fruit, with a hint of baby aspirin. The finish keeps the grape's propensity to turn hot and bitter in check.
Name: Weisinger 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aroma brings light notes of honey, brown sugar and herb. The flavors are sweet and elegant. It's a light, pleasing affair.
Name: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Brown sugar, flower, pineapple and sugared peach aromas lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors in this wine. There's some intrigue, but it doesn't all come together.
Designation: The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut
Name: Owen Roe 2015 The Parting Glass Outlook Vineyard Cordon Cut Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Clean if rather ripe aromas of peach, bubblegum and banana show on the nose of this bottling, which displays expert restraint from a warm region for an often blousy variety. There's a rich custardy touch at first on the sip, with plumeria and guava flavors, but then the chalky texture reins it back.
Name: Falkner 2016 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Relatively light and delicate on the nose, this bottling shows chalk, ripe pear and the unmistakable aroma of banana-flavored Now & Laters candy. The palate is tightly wound yet tropical, with papaya, mango and ripe peach flavors, each more expressive as the wine warms.
Name: LXV 2016 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This was harvested at low brix and fermented principally in French oak. It's a soft, floral take on Viognier, with scents and flavors that suggest baby powder. Because of its Meyer lemon and other candied citrus notes, odds are either a small amount of Gewürztraminer was blended in or some residual sugar remains, though neither is indicated. Drink now and over the next two to three years.
Name: Reustle 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's peach Jolly Rancher and white flower aromas lead to lightly sprizty, off-dry stone fruit flavors. It shows a good bit of heat on the finish, throwing the balance out of whack.
Name: Maryhill 2016 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Bennett Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fragrant, floral and pretty in every way, this wine is also meaty in intense texture and beauty, with a bold beguiling entry that mellows on the midpalate. Balanced acidity supports notes of honey, honeysuckle and pear, with a bite of green apple on the finish.
Name: Flanagan 2016 Viognier (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Aromatic fruit and floral notes join delicious honeydew melon flavors as this full-bodied wine wraps around the tongue, leaving a soft smooth impression and lingering on the finish. Very good concentration, layers of flavor and that lasting finish lift this wine above the ordinary.
Name: Workman Ayer 2015 Abroachment Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich but not overly tropical on the nose, this bottling shows buttered nectarine and a touch of honeydew on the nose. The palate is expertly wound up, with bright tangerine, ripe melon and creamy cherimoya, all reined in by a wet cement-like texture.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2015 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in color, this bottling offers tight, bright and plump aromas of peach and lime pith. Lime candy and citrus pop on the palate, giving life to ripe Asian pear flavors that ride a grippy texture all the way into the finish.
Name: Workman Ayer 2016 Ipso Facto Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of earth, roasted almonds, beeswax and ghee prove almost mead-like on the nose of this twist-top single-vineyard bottling by Larry Schaffer. The tightly wound palate is more restrained and familiar for the variety, offering honeyed pear and citrus peel flavors.
Name: Tercero 2014 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: The wine is soft, rich, and full of generous yellow fruits that are layered with wood. It is spicy and ripe, with acidity to match the generous opulent fruits. Delicious, rich and full bodied, the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: White blossoms and wet stone softly caress on the nose. The flavors are layered and compelling, starting on crisp green apple, honeydew melon and peach, folding into complexities of crushed stone, fennel and pollen. Well-balanced, fresh acidity and ample body lend to a long, evolving finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From one of the Riboli family's new estate vineyards, this bottling is a clean but quite ripe style of Viognier, with blousy aromas of tuberose, coconut and guava. It's tighter on the palate, with honeydew, key lime and guava sorbet flavors.
Name: San Simeon 2016 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A hint of pink in the color and effusive floral and honey flavors make this richly textured and unbaked wine stand out. It has ripe pear, jasmine and melon nuances and an almost thick mouth feel.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Kristen's Viognier (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: A pronounced herb and spice aroma continues in the flavors of this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. It has a soothing viscosity that carries the spicy grassy notes in a harmonious way.
Name: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: This wine offers clean aromas of freshly-peeled clementine. Flavors of white peach, apricot, quince and a pleasing bouquet of flowers offer a nice interplay on the tongue, with smooth tannins that continue into the slightly chalky finish.
Name: Galil Mountain 2014 Yiron Vineyard Viognier (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Varietally correct aromas of cured ham, honeysuckle blossom and orange peel are fair and solid. This is a bit flat in feel, without much zest or snap. Flavors of green banana and lightly bitter green fruits fall off quickly on the finish.
Name: Siegel 2016 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: These biodynamic grapes, fermented with native yeasts, spent three months in 40% new French oak. It's built like a precision watch, ticking off complete and balanced varietal flavors of citrus rind and juice, with light touches of fresh herb, lemon verbena and a delicate hint of vanilla.
Name: Cowhorn 2015 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated and rich in flavor and creamy in texture, this wine has a big profile without seeming overtly fruity or oaky. The mouthfeel is lush, broad and quietly powerful, while subtle pear and marzipan flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. It makes a grand impression and is “meaty” enough to serve with poultry or even beef. Winemaker Tracy Hart used no oak or stainless steel, fermenting and aging the wine in food-grade polyethylene FlexTanks.
Name: Le Mulet Rouge 2016 Estate Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Apricot, peach, orange blossom and honey flavors all come together in this ultrasmooth, ripe but well-balanced wine. Zingy acidity blends with the rich fruitiness to keep it lively and refreshing, even while the viscosity coats the palate.
Name: Paskett 2016 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a luscious wine with a smooth and hearty mouthfeel, ample ripe fruit reminiscent of pears and white peaches, and vanilla and honey accents on both the nose and palate. Fermented in neutral barrels, it doesn't have oaky flavors but feels soft in acidity and seems to melt in the mouth.
Name: Cedarville 2015 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's clean lines of honey, chamomile, Gala apple and ripe Asian pear grow more tropical the longer it breathes. Its medley of flavors includes candied lemon, white peach syrup and melon, but a honey-laced chamomile tea note comes out strongest.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2016 Concrete Blanc Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lighter and livelier than typical California Viognier, this has crisp apple and citrus aromas, nicely tangy fruit flavors and relatively light body. It feels juicy but lean rather than rich, in a refreshing alternative style.
Name: Feist 2016 Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of butterscotch, pear, peach, flowers and spice are followed by full-bodied stone-fruit flavors. It brings a fair amount of heat along with it but is certainly varietally correct.
Name: Waterbrook 2016 ICON Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: While very fruity, fresh and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine also has good acidity for balance. Light touches of vanilla, butter and nutmeg add welcome complexity.
Name: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas seem a bit off, with volatile notes along with lees, orange peel and peach. The palate is lightly creamy but still somewhat lean in style, not able to hold all of the flavors together.
Name: Bontzu 2016 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light honeydew and gardenia aromas show on the pleasant and clean nose of this well-restrained Viognier. The sip is as zippy and persistent with acidity as can be without losing the varietal character, allowing the ripe Gala apple and Anjou pear to show through the racy frame.
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, this is dry and in balance, made in a bigger fuller style that presents as lush and plush on the palate. Apricot and peach offer a ripe succulence of fruit as a touch of oak integrates well into the background.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2016 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Golden in the glass, this bottling shows intriguing aromas of dried lemon peels, scratched grapefruit, blood orange rinds, crushed chalk, sea salt and a touch of peach custard. The palate offers a touch of limestone minerality with seared orange, warm chamomile and vanilla toward the finish.
Name: Black Ridge 2013 Estate Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows peach, melon, apple and key lime pith, which cuts through the riper elements. A simmering acidity is ever present on the sip, hewing the tropical guava flavors and providing a refreshing tension.
Name: Rideau 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Yellow peach, lemon, Asian pear and citrus peels show on the nose of this bottling by Matt Villard. It's very light and reserved on the palate, which is what makes it refreshing, with flavors of ripe nectarine, pan-seared apple and cider. A sizzle of acidity runs through it.
Name: MCV 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Honeysuckle, lemongrass and wheat ride a robust wave of ripeness and bold texture in this white wine, which is exuberant in bright lemon-laced acidity.
Name: Hawley 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is lovely in aromatics of honeysuckle, as dense compact layers of ripe apricot highlight a full-bodied profile of concentrated flavor.
Name: McKahn 2016 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright melon and lime zest aromas lead to lightly sweet, broad, fleshy fruit flavors in this wine. It's not entirely representative of the variety but still brings a lot of freshness and appeal.
Name: Kestrel 2016 Falcon Series Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermented, this wine is made from grapes grown in Paso Robles and Lodi and is intensely concentrated. Pretty aromatics of honeysuckle open up before thick rich layers of lushly ripe peach flavor ride in.
Name: Miner 2016 Viognier (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Faint white flower, orange peel, spice and citrus aromas are followed by broad fruit flavors in this wine, which lacks concentration.
Name: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and clean yet very tropical and ripe on the nose, this bottling shows strong guava and mango perfume notes. The palate also rides the guava wave, with touches of bubblegum, coconut and white-flower syrup.
Name: Eberle 2016 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Light scents of fresh grass, white flowers, waxy melon and sweet orange dance in the bouquet of this easy-drinking white. Those notes continue through to the fruity palate, with a pleasant roundness to the midpalate. Drink now.
Name: Wild Pig 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Saddle Rock-Malibu, South Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light on the nose, there are faint whiffs of yellow pear and lemon on this bottling from the Los Angeles coast. Yellow-apple skins, dried apple flesh and lime peels show on the sip, which is cut by a decent acidity and proves a straightforward take on the grape.
Name: Cielo 2016 Estate Viognier (Saddle Rock-Malibu)

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of honeydew sorbet, white peach and guava syrup are extremely strong on the nose of this bottling from San Diego County. There is racy acidity that cuts through the extremely ripe peach, guava and tuberose flavors, which are almost too much to handle, but perfect for those seeking a powerfully tropical expression.
Name: Two Dogs Barking 2016 Viognier (Ramona Valley)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This wine is fairly soft and muted, with delicate aromas of straw, apple and underripe white melon. The palate is similarly light in feel and intensity, with low acidity and a short finish.
Name: Les Jamelles 2016 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Cloudy in appearance, but super rich in aromas and flavors, this is a concentrated, fruity and richly textured wine. Toasted almonds and marzipan meet honeydew melon, pineapple and peach flavors that expand with each sip and coat the palate. But it's not unctuous, due to great underlying acidity that keeps it lively.
Name: Sol Rouge 2015 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Always a strength in the winery's white wine lineup, this is sourced from both Columbia Valley and Rogue Valley vineyards. It's aged entirely in stainless steel and walks a tight rope between citrus zest and honeysuckle, botanical herb and leafy green flavors. It's all in perfect proportion, and absolutely delicious lightly chilled.
Name: Penner-Ash 2016 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Winemaker Matthieu Finot deftly transforms this wine by keeping it on the skins for three weeks with a daily punch-downs, then allowing 100% malolactic fermentation during aging in neutral oak. This orange wine boasts a gorgeous bouquet of fresh apricot, orange blossom and rooibos tea. These aromas transition onto the palate where they taste concentrated and fresh. It's dry, with delicate tannins and a clean finish that lingers and evolves.
Name: King Family 2015 Orange Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in a mixture of concrete and stainless steel, this wine brings perfumed aromas of crushed stone, flowers and peach. The flavors are mineral laden, broad and silky in feel, showing an impeccable texture and sense of balance. This shows a beautiful sense of freshness.
Name: Cayuse 2015 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Stainless steel fermented and bone-dry, this leesy, creamy wine balances lime, lemon and grapefruit flavors. Those citrus notes roll through richer dried apricot tones and into a balanced, persistent finish. Drink now and over the next two years.
Name: Abacela 2016 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Abundantly floral, this is a 100% varietal wine. Juicy acidity supports a medium-bodied lushness of honeyed pear and spicy nutmeg complemented by oak.
Name: Pech Merle 2016 Salem Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This medium to full-bodied wine has vanilla and butterscotch aromas and very ripe unctuous fruit flavors. It feels soft in texture and very mouthfilling. This is full-bodied and tastes warm and creamy on the finish.
Name: Cedar View Winery 2015 Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Base notes of vanilla, peach and honeysuckle linger on the nose as honeydew and chamomile show in the background. Tangerine, honeysuckle, peach, honeydew and ginger show on the rich palate, with a zip of acidity o the long, tingly finish.
Name: Trump 2015 Estate Bottled Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A light-straw color and aromas like magnolia and white roses lead into tastes of oranges and honeysuckle with a sour-orange note in the flavors. Full bodied and certainly aromatic, it tastes dry but leaves a slightly sweet impression on the finish.
Name: Cline 2016 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Beautiful aromas of apricot, geranium and honey unfold upon first whiff. Similar notes are displayed on the palate along with peach and lavender. Given the plush mouthfeel, fresh acidity, full body and good structure, this well-balanced wine would excel alongside food.
Name: Horton 2016 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Middleburg, Virginia, US
Description: A high-toned array of peach, rosewater, mango and banana show on the nose and palate. The palate is mouth coating, with a pleasant roundness and a long and warming finish.
Name: Blue Valley 2016 Viognier (Middleburg)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This high-toned wine's sharp, gin botanical-like aromas carry over into its flavors. Lime and other citrus notes are accented with a touch of talcum powder and some residual sweetness. Though a bit unusual, it's certainly flavorful.
Name: Kriselle 2016 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Classic Viognier apricot flavors are prominent in this ripe, full wine. It's as poised as it is rich—full of fruit, with a warm, rounded aftertaste.
Name: Maison de la Villette 2016 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Good ripe-pear and apple notes and touches of vanilla and almond lend a lot of flavor to this full-bodied wine. The texture is pleasantly soft, so it's easy to drink, and the price is hard to beat.
Name: McManis 2016 Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Fragrant peach, tangerine, white blossom and ginger are prevalent on the nose of this Viognier. The flavors are similar, although the fruit is pithier and there is a touch of honeydew. Round in feel, with delicate acidity and a rich full body, this is a big wine with a lush, warm finish. Enjoy with green curry salmon.
Name: James Charles 2015 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: This wine is soft and creamy, with the apricot flavor that is characteristic of Viognier. It is a ripe wine, although with a light and spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Senses Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This Viognier is alive with aromas of honeysuckle, chamomile and white peach. The flavors are tart and upfront, showing tangy peach and passion fruit.
Name: Bogati 2015 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a soft, gentle wine, with hints of peaches and apricots and a tangy aftertaste.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2016 Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Honeysuckle, peach and ginger are prominent with each whiff of this wine. Unfortunately these notes do not carry to the palate, which is thin and slightly hot. The finish takes a plesant turn with short flash of ginger.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Guigal's flagship Condrieu is always flashy, fleshy and opulent, and the 2015 is no slouch in those areas. Hints of toast and vanilla accent apricot-laden fruit, while subtle spice shadings linger on the long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: E. Guigal 2015 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lush and generous, this is textbook Condrieu from the appellation's largest producer. Subtle ginger notes add an exotic edge to the ripe apricot, mango and lychee flavors, then persist on the long finish. Drink now–2018.
Name: E. Guigal 2015  Condrieu

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This refreshing and crisply designed Viognier conveys restrained aromas of white peach and vanilla. The palate shows yellow melon and creamy peach, but with a razor-sharp edge of acidity and a compelling chalky texture. The acid sizzles into the finish.
Name: Fess Parker 2015 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is a lush, elegant example of Condrieu. It's broad, but with bright, balanced acids that point up notes of honeyed peaches, apricots and pineapple. Drink now–2018.
Name: Roland Grangier 2015 Les Terrasses  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honeysuckle, orange blossoms, lemongrass and the twinge of melon show on the complex but not overly ripe nose of this bottling from the Parker family's estate vineyard. The high-acid palate offers lemon peel and wild-lime flavors that make it the perfect pairing for Thai food.
Name: Fess Parker 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied honeydew, lime, bubblegum and crushed chalk show on the nose of this bottling. The acidity is razor-sharp and the palate's squeaky-clean texture is compelling, with flavors of lemon-lime soda and grapefruit pith to round it out.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Blossomy and perfumed, this exuberant Viognier offers loads of juicy cantaloupe and tangerine flavors. It's uncharacteristically light in body, lacking the variety's typical heft and unctuousness, but its crisp refreshing style makes it quite quaffable.
Name: Bedell 2015 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Collines Rhôdaniennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is almost as impressive as Gerin's La Champine Syrah, which is a tremendous achievement as Viognier seems much harder to do well. Hints of crushed stone and struck flint add nuance to the ripe apricot aromas, while the exotic, tropical fruit flavors of mango and pineapple are reined in by a touch of citrus-pith bitterness. Drink now–2018.
Name: Domaine Jean-Michel Gerin 2015 La Champine Viognier (Collines Rhôdaniennes)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: David Finlayson. The nose of this Viognier is fresh at the start, with vibrant notes of quince, melon and fynbos. The palate offers more weight and concentration, round and a bit flat in texture, with lush flavors of rich lemon, citrus peel and honeydew. It's an opulent style, ultimately, and is best enjoyed over the short term.
Name: Edgebaston 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Rooi Trekker Viognier (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: White-peach aromas meet with vanilla butter and honeysuckle on the nose, yet there is a tension apparent amid the ripeness. The sip starts with an edgy texture and crisp acidity that cut across flavors of nectarine and apple.
Name: Boekenoogen 2015 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Savory whiffs of pressed apple and pear open to brighter, juicier flavors of yellow peach, watermelon and berry in this unusually rose-tinted Viognier. It's quite fruity on the palate with sunny acidity and a brisk citrusy finish.
Name: Sannino 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine seems to show a bit of oxygen exposure, which distracts from its aromas of orange peel and flower. It's a shame as it is flavorful and varietal, with floral notes persisting on the finish.
Name: Stevens 2016 StevensDivio Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeydew, crushed stone and hints of ground cinnamon and clove are appetizing upfront. This Viognier from the Southern Rhône is full and round on the palate, with ample weight and a trace of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Blanc de Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of peach, pear and nectarine are followed by lightly sweet fruit flavors. It brings some appeal but the apparent residual sugar gets in the way.
Name: Coyote Canyon 2016 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Creamy yet not overly viscous, this wine finds a nice balance between fruit and juicy acidity, showing off well-crafted apricot, green apple and nut notes. Light bodied and totally fresh, it gains layers of citrus as it evolves in the glass.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2015 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Far from simply fruity, this is a complex and sophisticated wine that shows how distinctive the grape variety can be. It relies on savory, minerally flavors that have a wonderful subtlety and reserve. With each sip it settles a littlle deeper on the palate, lingering for a long finish buoyed by underlying acidity.
Name: Miraflores 2015 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel, this is a subtly floral wine that flirts with apple blossom and jasmine scents on the nose. On the palate, expect creamy apricot, orange, lime and vanilla cookie flavors in a complex and layered way.
Name: Ampelos 2016 Ampelos Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine pairs toasty, buttery, fresh bread aromas with ripe fig, cream and almond flavors. It's medium to full bodied, rich and viscous, keeping the luxurious flavors flowing over the palate and the toasted bread and almond notes echoing on the finish.
Name: 1850 2015 Viognier (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty almond aromas open this wine, along with a wave of white flower and herb scents. Light in color, it's exuberant with crisp acidity and delicate apricot and peach flavors, finishing clean and focused.
Name: Anaba 2015 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This golden hay-colored wine opens in a complex floral arrangement of honeysuckle and apple blossom before unleashing a weave of apricot and lychee fruit. The acidity is tart and high-toned.
Name: Tessier Winery 2016 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Light in color with beautiful aromas, this wine offers green apple, squeezed citrus, creamy peach and vanilla notes. Moderate acidity complements its voluptuous texture and length.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This well-balanced wine has light floral, appley aromas, good acidity to drive its mouth-filling fruit flavors along, and just enough body to contribute a smooth mouthfeel. Hints of white pepper and lemon zest give it an attractive savory edge.
Name: Naggiar 2016 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This blend holds fruit from Olsen and Red Willow vineyards. Aromas start out lightly reduced, followed by notes of stone fruit, spice and mineral. The peach flavors are full bodied, bringing generosity and appeal.
Name: Mark Ryan 2015 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine's prominent buttery aromas grab one's attention right away, and that same buttery element runs through the flavors and lingers on the finish. The fruit components are mild and melon-like, the body is medium and the texture reveals good acidity.
Name: Skinner 2015 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A great effort for the estate's inaugural white, this expertly restrained Viognier hails from a region where the grape tends toward overripeness. Crisp apple blossoms, daffodil, white peach and chalk aromas give way to a mellow palate of pear, apple, nectarine and jasmine-like flavors.
Name: Record Family Wines 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This unusually lively and vivid wine offers a nice twist on the variety, offering fresh pineapple, herb and lemon flavors, dazzling acidity and great balance despite its relatively high level of alcohol. Grown on the winery property, it's another good example of Holly's Hill's emphasis on purity of flavor.
Name: Holly's Hill 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are somewhat light considering the variety and style, with notes of orange peel and flower. It drinks sweet, finishing with orange flavors. It's enjoyable but the concentration doesn't seem all there.
Name: 14 Hands 2015 Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A relatively light-tasting wine from a sometimes heavy grape variety, this shows a mix of savory and fruit flavors, including cucumber, celery and white pepper. It tastes dry and almost austere, which is appealing in the right pairing, such as with goat cheese on toast.
Name: Acquiesce 2015 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Vivid herb and mineral aromas and equally vibrant citrus and herb flavors give this wine a bright personality. It has enough body and near-sweetness to match all that energy and find balance.
Name: The White Knight 2015 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This light, fruity and refreshing wine is made from organic grapes and pairs nicely with linguine and clams or pizza bianca. Although matured in French oak barrels, it's more delicate than usual, tasting of apples, baking spice and fresh lemon.
Name: Bonterra 2015 Viognier (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blended with a splash of Grenache Blanc, this white is floral, viscous and full of a nutty character. It's the first vintage in which the producer has included grapes from Catie's Corner.
Name: Crux 2015 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: The wine comes from a single, high-elevation vineyard owned by Château Lagrézette. Wood aged, it smooths out the naturally creamy Viognier to give a broad generous wine. Spice and apricot fruits are balanced by green-fruit acidity. The opulent wine is just about ready to drink although it will be better from 2018.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2015 Le Pigeonnier White Vision Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Intense and loaded with scents and flavors of fully ripe fruit, this parades down the tree fruit and tropical fruit avenues, with peach, apricot, papaya and mango in the lead. It's a delicious bottle, with just enough acidity to keep it bright and lively.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Done in a ripe fruity style, this offers fresh Meyer lemon and grapefruit flavors. Both flesh and rind come into play, with a nice balance as it moves into the finish. It concludes with a touch of phenolic bitterness.
Name: Season 2015 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Whiffs of vanilla bean and caramel accent this peachy blossomy aromatic white. Bold texture and slightly warming alcohol are offset by delicate but fresh peach and apricot flavors. The finish is long and pleasantly spicy.
Name: Kontokosta 2015 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A difficult vintage across the state, 2015 was especially tough in remote and dry places like Mt. Harlan. Despite that hurdle, Josh Jensen pulled off a delicate winner with this bottling, which shows white peach, honeydew and Meyer lemon scents on the nose. The flavors are also light, with nectarine and Asian pear most prominent, all enwrapped in nervy tension.
Name: Calera 2015 Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Viognier (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 25% Roussanne and fermented and aged in French oak, the aromas are light but intriguing, with slightly reduced notes of peach, cream, flowers and spice. The poached pear and stone-fruit flavors are delicate but accented by tart focused acidity that keeps the interest up.
Name: Tertulia 2016 Whistling Hills Estate Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This region is known for producing lean whites from grapes that tend to be blousy in warmer zones, and this bottling is no exception. It shows crushed chalk, pomelo and gardenia aromas on the nose and is tense on the palate, its grippy white rock flavors accented with Granny Smith apple notes.
Name: Tangent 2014 Paragon Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of tangerine zest, peach and flower are followed by dry clean fruit flavors that show no apparent oak influence, with citrus notes lingering on the finish.
Name: Airfield Estates 2015 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Apple blossom, pear, honeysuckle and gin botanical aromas show on the nose of this bottling from eastern Paso Robles. The flavors are very floral and ripe, evoking honeydew melon, candied pear and vanilla.
Name: Cass 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of mandarin orange, peach and herb are followed by lightly styled, off-dry drinking but still well-balanced fruit flavors. It goes down easy.
Name: Hogue 2015 Terroir Fries Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Easygoing lemon pudding and peach scents show on the nose of this bottling, which is a blend from four vineyards. Ripe stone fruit flavors mark the palate, further enriched with tropical coconut touches.
Name: Sculpterra 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and focused, with fine-tuned varietal expression, this is flat out loaded with rich fruit flavors. Orange, lime, pineapple and pear can be found, all beautifully polished. It's ripe and precise without being bitter or hot, and a fine value as well.
Name: Quady North 2015 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is textbook New World Viognier—bright, focused and balanced, with sassy fruit flavors of citrus and apricot. The aromatics conjure up subtle notes of citrus rind and jasmine flowers, and the overall length and concentration are as good as it gets.
Name: Cristom 2015 Estate Viognier (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Fresh wheat finds its way on the nose of this nicely made wine, followed by a depth of lemon and quince. Medium-bodied and weighty, it's also bright in acidity and succulent, with another dose of floral beauty on the finish.
Name: Spoto 2015 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Thick and lemony, this is a juicy fruit-powered style. It places its power squarely on plush fruit flavors of Meyer lemon, candied orange peel and candied pineapple. It saw no oak and needed none. Drink while it's at its freshest.
Name: Emerson 2015 Estate Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated aromas of honey, golden raisin, date, jasmine and fig are lifted by a nutty walnut component that adds intrigue on the late harvest bottling. The viscous sip grabs hold of attention immediately, with buoyant and bright acidity holding up the honey and raisin flavors.
Name: Jaffurs 2014 Late Harvest Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely light in color, this age-worthy bottling offers very light, clean and delicate aromas of crisp Asian pear and Gravenstein apple. The sip is quite high-toned, with the slightest touches of melon, pear and citrus peels, showing deft restraint for an often unctuous grape. A hint of white peach arises on the finish.
Name: Qupé 2015 Sawyer Lindquist Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale straw in color, this white has aromas of toast and cream that lead to a full-feeling palate backed by a lick of lemony acidity and barrel flavors. It brings enjoyment but it's hard to discern the variety.
Name: Eight Bells 2014 Red Willow Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tropicality rules the roost on this wine, which offers peach, papaya, apricot, mango, coconut and even banana aromas on the nose. Ripe apples, cherimoya and poached peach show on the palate. It's all a little bit much, but not overdone, with enough restraint to achieve balance.
Name: Le Mistral 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Given the paucity of quality Viognier (or any Viognier) for under $15, this is a notable achievement. Musky, melony and spicy, it marries ample weight and breadth with just enough life-giving acidity. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Buttercup and white-flower aromas are true to Viognier. This feels a bit thick and viscous, while ripe melony flavors come with powdered sugar and pastry notes. This is plump, easygoing and tastes tropical and sweet on the finish.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2015 Pedregoso Gran Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Perfumed aromas of flowers, peach and hard candy lead to dry stone-fruit flavors. Its variety is unmistakable.
Name: TruthTeller 2015 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lees, peach and cream aromas are followed by dry stone-fruit flavors. It runs a little hot.
Name: Armstrong Family 2015 Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Muskmelon and sage notes impart an elegant edge to this wine's aromas, while on the palate, this is fairly big and broad, tinged with gingery spice. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Elqui Valley, Chile
Description: Melon and tropical fruit aromas are restrained. This Elqui Viognier feels plump but also a bit dilute in the middle, with a mildly tannic sense of grape skins. Melon and citrus flavors are good, while this feels a bit yeasty and plump on the finish.
Name: Falernia 2015 Reserva Viognier (Elqui Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: On the nose, this gold-colored Viognier is gritty and burnt smelling, like a field or haystack on fire. Flavors of pithy citrus peel and oak resin include tropical notes as well as mild bitterness. On the finish, this tastes of nectarine, the skins and pit included.
Name: Siegel 2015 Special Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba's efforts with Viognier have trickled all the way down into a $10 version under the Oxford Landing label. Fresh herbs, apple and citrus mark the nose, while the palate delivers mandarin and melon fruit along with Viognier's hallmark oily texture. Drink now.
Name: Oxford Landing 2015 Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Walnut oil, orange rinds and burned caramel converge for a Scotch-like aroma on the nose of this late harvest wine. Sour orange and bitter walnut flavors show on the sip.
Name: Sevtap 2013 Ayla Late Harvest Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vibrant aromas of white flowers, ripe peach, fresh herb, cocoa butter and hard candy lead to nuanced, well-balanced fruit flavors that show just a touch of lees influence. It offers an exquisite sense of balance and depth along with an extended finish.
Name: Eternal 2015 Eternal Sunshine Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There is a pleasant and mellow peach quality to the balanced nose of this bottling, with touches of melted marshmallow and white chocolate, cut by squeezed lime and melon. Vibrant acidity slices through the palate, where round yellow apple and Asian pear flavors are bound by grippy tension.
Name: Four Lanterns 2015 Lamplight Viognier (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Danube River Plains, Bulgaria
Description: This Viognier from the Danube Plain has aromas of yellow peach, freshly sliced apricot and jasmine flowers. In the mouth it is balanced with flavors of apricot and peach. The finish is pleasantly acidic and slightly perfumed.
Name: Chateau Burgozone 2015 Côte de Danube Viognier (Danube River Plains)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Relatively restrained for Viognier, with attractive fruit notes of muskmelon, apricot and pineapple, but not much more in the way of complexity. It's medium bodied, with a long, refreshing finish that hints at white pepper. Drink now.
Name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2015 Domiane Grand Veneur Blanc de Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: This shows the subtlest hints of the apricot character so often found in Viognier. That gives richness to contrast its crisp acidity and apple and pear flavors. The finish is long and perfumed. Drink now.
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2015 Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Saddle Rock-Malibu, South Coast, California, US
Description: Toasted nut, yellow melon, pear and struck match scents show on the nose of this bottling from a steep, rocky vineyard in the mountains between Malibu and the Conejo Valley. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a core of pear, apple and nectarine flesh, accented with sea salt and oak smoke flavors.
Name: Cielo 2015 Three Sixty-Five Viognier (Saddle Rock-Malibu)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Round and ripe frangipani, jasmine, honeysuckle and white peach aromas contribute to the pretty nose of this bottling, even though they feel as confected as bubblegum. There is a vibrant energy to the palate, which is rich in poached pear, baked apple, dried ginger and caramel flavors. Over the top but pleasant.
Name: J. Lohr 2015 Gesture Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Golden honey and banana flambée aromas make for an inviting if quite rich introduction to this wine from Kamasutra-themed LXV. Baked apple and poached peach flavors meet with vanilla dust and salted caramel on the palate, which is rich and creamy with a balance of tension.
Name: LXV 2015 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright and generous, with notes of honeysuckle and canned peach. The fruit is so sweet on the palate, it drinks almost off dry, with abundant stone-fruit and floral flavors that linger.
Name: Martinez & Martinez 2015 Tudor Hills Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of flowers, green herb, pear and peach lead to silky sleek stone-fruit flavors. There's some interesting things going on but the fruit doesn't quite seem to have fully ripened.
Name: Seven Falls 2015 GPS Jones Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Concentrated orange blossom, bubblegum and a touch of minerality show on the nose of this bottling, suggesting sweetness. The palate is dry, if a tad syrupy, revealing warm climate flavors like poached apple, pear and lemon curd, tasting a bit like cough syrup.
Name: Cass 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Juicy kiwi, lime blossom and sour apple candy aromas show on the nose of this ripe white—the first 2016 submitted from the region. The palate is oily in texture, with honeydew and more lime-kiwi-bubblegum flavors.
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2016 Viognier (South Coast)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine has gorgeous aromas of honeysuckle and anise that make it undeniably heady on the nose. What follows are full and creamy peach-like flavors, with a pleasing lushness and measured acidity.
Name: Darioush 2015 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a pretty honeysuckle aroma that invites from beginning to end, its silky texture met with moderate acidity along the way. Medium bodied and creamy, it offers additional layers of white peach and almond.
Name: Novy 2015 Saralee's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This new micro-boutique impresses with graceful wines at affordable prices. The Viognier is a tasty compendium of floral and citrus flesh and skin scents and flavors. It's sharp and sophisticated, inviting experimentation with a variety of seafood and poultry (think lemon chicken!).
Name: Louloute 2015 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown, pure varietal effort is exceptionally rich and succulent. The flavors of sugared grapefruit, lemon pulp and rind and sweet tea are concentrated and lingering. Despite the impression of sweetness, it's not a dessert wine, just an especially ripe and rich one.
Name: 2Hawk 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This all-Viognier wine opens with apricot, butterscotch, toast and vanilla notes. On the creamy, full-bodied palate, lime and hazelnut flavors accent a core of juicy yellow peach. Enjoy through 2019.
Name: Michele Satta 2014 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A firm, young, compact, nicely sculpted wine, this shows pinpoint fruit flavors of quince and pear. There are subtle highlights of gin-like botanicals, and the flavors penetrate clean and clear all the way through a lingering finish.
Name: Cowhorn 2015 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an intriguing herb butter scent on the nose of this wine, its canteloupe and lime fruit laced with hop-like aromas. On the palate, it shows impressive texture, while the flavors are clean and easy: Gravenstein apple, jasmine tea, fresh herbs and a candied pear finish.
Name: Jaffurs 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made from the producer's organically grown grapes, this white is nutty and lemony, with a light-bodied, creamy and unctuous burst of white peach.
Name: Hawley 2015 Hawley Vineyard Estate Grown Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh and zesty on the nose, this bottling offers lemongrass, lime peel and kiwi scents, with floral jasmine undertones. The palate delivers loads of zing—an almost effervescent energy and verve—with Bosc pear, apple and honeysuckle flavors.
Name: Robert Hall 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Nutty with baked peach and pineapple notes, this wine is medium-bodied but surprisingly restrained on the palate, nearly unresolved. It grows more citrusy in the glass, with a spark of lemon zest on the finish.
Name: Mounts 2015 Estate Grown Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This lush, concentrated Viognier combines cool-weather weight with summertime echoes of apricots and honey. Hints of toasty oak provide an ample frame for this full-bodied wine that avoids any sense of oiliness or heaviness while remaining bold, rich and long. Drink now–2020.
Name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2014 Domaine des Grands Amandiers  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is aged in barrel, but the power of the source's granitic soils is such that the oak is barely noticeable. Nasturtium blossom and apricot mark the nose, while the palate adds pineapple, cinnamon and clove. The wine is a bit oily in texture, but with a long, tropical-fruit-laced finish that brings admirable freshness, focus and energy.
Name: Gilles Flacher 2013 Les Rouelles  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Full-bodied, concentrated and richly textured, this is a succulent wine with refreshingly balanced oak. A floral note on the nose gives way to apricot and ginger-like spice, then finishes with a flourish of mouthwatering acidity. Drink now.
Name: Tardieu-Laurent 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: By the sheer size of its production and ubiquity of distribution, Guigal's bottling has become the de facto standard of the appellation. The 2014 is full-bodied and silky in texture, with gorgeous gingery-peppery spice and plenty of apricot-like fruit. Drink it over the rest of 2017.
Name: E. Guigal 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This bracing, precisely crafted wine emphasizes crispness and attractively lean fruit flavors over richness, and it will be great with appetizers and seafood, even raw oysters. It's fresh, clean and inviting.
Name: Liana Estates 2015 Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This lively white is floral in honeysuckle aromas, while creamy, rounded layers of apricot play on the full-bodied palate. A spicy nutmeg chaser closes things out. Well balanced and accessible, this is ready to drink now.
Name: Lawer 2015 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine seems broad across the palate, but not quite as deep as some Condrieus. The fruit is understated, resembling gently toasted marshmallow and maybe a touch of baked pineapple, rather than flamboyant apricot and spice. Plan on serving it with fish or chicken rather than something rich or extravagant.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2013 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine is pretty retrained on the nose for Condrieu, but still offers aromas of spring blossoms and white pepper. Fruit takes hold on the palate, suggesting apricot, peach and pineapple. Those flavors continue through the finish, which is silky in texture but only medium in length.
Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2014  Condrieu

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is full bodied but not heavy. Light floral and citrus aromas lead to ripe fruit, spice and butter flavors. A generous, smooth texture coats the palate and helps the mélange of flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Blend Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of spice, apricot and lime zest. The peach flavors feel broad while still retaining a sense of balance.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2014 Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The flower and peach aromas are quite subdued for the variety. The stone-fruit flavors provide more generosity while still displaying elegance.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2015 Barrel Select Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes are prominent, with aromas of Creamsicle and baking spice. The palate is broad and dry with stone-fruit and barrel flavors. It provides intrigue but the wood seems to get in the way at times.
Name: Gård 2014 Grand Klasse Reserve Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made entirely with Viognier, this has delicate aromas of white grapefruit and orchard fruit, while the straightforward palate delivers apricot and citrus. Enjoy soon.
Name: Tenuta Poggio Rosso 2015 Feronia Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe yellow apples and touches of banana and pineapple show on the nose of this bottling. It also has a restrained, steely frame to the aromas, along with some flint. Honeysuckle, jasmine and apple-blossom flavors show on the sip, which is quite floral, and also offers white peach and salt.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: The nose is rather shy while the round palate offers suggestions of yellow stone fruit and a candied citrus note. It closes on a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Terre di Talamo 2015 Vento Teso Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba's Eden Valley Viognier bottling rivals the brand's Virgilius bottling in varietal expression, even if it's not as ripe or rich. Gingery spice and floral notes bring a dimension of complexity without oak, and the wine's fruit remains citrusy, fresh and focused through the long finish.
Name: Yalumba 2015 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: This producer focuses on Rhône Valley varietals, and this wine continues the theme. Its apricot and very fine mineral texture are impressive and rich. Touched by spice from wood aging, the wine is generous, with the potential of a creamy, smooth texture as it ages. For now, it is fruity and rich. Drink from 2018.
Name: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2015 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is Yalumba's flagship Viognier, barrel-fermented for an extra layer of richness. Fig, melon and apricot notes mark the nose and palate, and while it is fully ripe and weighty, it carries its alcohol well. Fruit intensity easily balances the oak, which remains almost invisible.
Name: Yalumba 2015 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied and opulent in texture, this wine was grown at high elevation and relies more on its luscious mouthfeel than its subdued fruit flavors for appeal. While dry, the wine has attractive viscosity and a lingering finish.
Name: M2 2015 Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: A terrific value, this offers a surprising amount of varietal character for the price. Ripe apricot and nectarine elements give a weighty impression on the palate, while grapefruit prolongs the warm, round finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2015 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Warm yellow apple, light custard and white peach combine for a creamy nose on this bottling from the Riboli family's new estate vineyard. The sip starts with a sizzle of acidity and then shows flavors of caramelized green apples and a touch of banana, proving both a tad tart and a tad rich.
Name: San Simeon 2015 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming off the winery's estate vineyard, this wine displays vibrant aromas of toast, honeysuckle and orange peel. The palate is rich and oily in feel, showing a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter not quite seeming to have fully integrated.
Name: K Vintners 2014 Powerline Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Simple sweet apple and poached pear notes meet with a slight tonic and guava nectar on the nose of this bottling that blends the Four Lanterns and Mill Road vineyards. Yellow apple and Anjou pear pop on the palate that ends on a yellow-grapefruit-peel finish, altogether clean and crisp.
Name: Eberle 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Wrattonbully, South Australia, Australia
Description: While some previous vintages have shown more richness and complexity, this is still commendable. A hint of nail polish is a bit distracting, but the toasted coconut aromas and candied pineapple flavors offer plenty to like. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2014 FSW 8B Botrytis Viognier (Wrattonbully)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The flower and peach aromas are light but provide plenty of intrigue. It drinks dry with light ale and stone-fruit flavors, showing persistence on the finish.
Name: College Cellars 2015 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Nagambie Lakes, Victoria, Australia
Description: Despite ample alcohol, this Viognier comes across as less than fully ripe, offering up spicy, herb-inflected notes of nectarine and grapefruit. It fits the house style of restrained fruit and should prove more ageworthy and versatile with food than many Viogniers.
Name: Tahbilk 2015 Estate Grown and Bottled Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This pure varietal wine exhibits good Viognier character, with plenty of interesting botanical highlights in nose and mouth. Citrus flavors dominate, with a medium-weight midpalate and moderately long finish.
Name: Del Rio 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This wine has a creamy texture on the palate, but the flavors don't match that level of ripeness. Pink grapefruit, nettles and cut grass are more Sauvignon Blanc-like than Viognier. There's even a hint of garden pea on the warm finish.
Name: Yeringberg 2014 Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Vista Flores, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Lime and tangerine aromas are light and dusty, with a yeasty note. This feels mostly sound but basic, with leesy, melony flavors. On the finish, this loses intensity and turns bready in flavor and soft in feel.
Name: Benvenuto de la Serna 2015 Mil Piedras Viognier (Vista Flores)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: This is a wood-fermented wine, spicy and lightly perfumed. The wood aging does dominate the yellow fruits and acidity that still need time. Drink this wine from late 2017.
Name: Adega Mãe 2014 Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of white flowers, green herbs and peach. The flavors are tart and elegant in style, seeming quite watery in concentration.
Name: Kestrel 2015 Falcon Series Estate Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: Briny, cidery aromas are a touch stale. This has a basic citrusy mouthfeel along with flavors of orange and tangerine that turn mildly bitter and pithy on the finish.
Name: Casa Montes 2015 Ampakama Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an aromatic wine, with vibrant yet still subtle notes of flowers, peach, citrus, lemon curd and wet stone. The fruit and savory flavors dance lightly on the palate, showing a lovely sense of finesse and grace. The balance is impeccable.
Name: Cayuse 2014 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Chalk Hill, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This robust white wine, 100% varietal, spent time only in stainless steel, allowing the pretty honeysuckle aromas to lift effortlessly to the nose. White fig, peach and a lick of salty stone are supported by crisp, bright acidity.
Name: Vellichor 2015 Mvua Viognier (Chalk Hill)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Moderate acidity and a low imprint of oak allow the voluptuous fruit to speak in this vineyard-designated white, a show of pretty aromatics and ripe, succulent peach. Along the streaks of more fulsome vanilla appear brighter, crisper hints of lime zest and lemon meringue.
Name: Black Stallion 2015 Limited Release Stagecoach Vineyard Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: A viscous, floral explosion of beautiful fruit, this wine is bright in acidity, with concentrated flavor. Textured, it's meant for the table, where it will play well with a range of rich foods.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 Viognier (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deep gold-orange color and floral aromas lead to rich, broad peach and apricot flavors that are moderately sweet and nicely concentrated. Lighter than some late-harvest wines, it has more vivid fruit and better balance than others.
Name: 2Plank 2013 Solstice Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this 100% varietal white is voluptuous and viscous, quite full-bodied in style and statement. Spicy acidity helps keep it fresh in the glass, showcasing a wealth of honeyed peach and lemon meringue.
Name: Pride Mountain 2015 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier is a particular strength at Penner-Ash, and here, once again, the challenge of balancing the grape's high-wire sensibility is met with ease. Firm and compact initially, it blooms with delicious flavors of lemon pastry, hints of mint, and lemongrass. It's full bodied, poised and steers clear of both bitterness and burn.
Name: Penner-Ash 2015 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has the complete butter and baking-spice treatment from barrel fermentation to make it rich in aromatics and full and creamy in texture. It has a light tangerine and cream aroma, rich fruit and baking-spice flavors and a lingering finish.
Name: Cedarville 2014 Estate Bottled Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Beautiful fruit flavors and a lively texture make a memorable impression in this medium-bodied, richly layered but also crisp and balanced wine. It tastes like sliced Pippin apples and Bosc pears, with pinches of vanilla and nutmeg.
Name: Helwig 2015 Viognier (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Savory, almost salty accents add a fascinating extra dimension to this full-bodied wine. It smells like fresh herbs, white pepper and orange blossoms, and tastes almost meaty, but with a lively citrus backdrop.
Name: Holly's Hill 2015 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the late harvest label, this is not a dessert wine. It's been fermented to near-dryness, and the late-picked fruit has resulted in quite high alcohol. It's an odd duck, but tasty with an appealing lemon-drop candy flavor.
Name: Amalie Robert 2015 Our Muse Late Harvest Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and lively, this brings apple and pear fruit, touched lightly with a splash of lime. There's a pleasing creaminess to the mouthfeel, and it's happily free of the burning sensation that can impact the finish of many domestic Viogniers.
Name: King Estate 2014 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Light fig and pear flavors on a rich texture make this wine a sleeper. Quiet on the first sip it gains ripeness and interest with subsequent tastes. It's very smooth and full in the mouth.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Kristen's Cuvee Viognier (California)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Classic Viognier with its apricot aromas and flavors, this wine is ripe, smoothly textured and with pear as well as yellow fruits. It is soft, rich and ready to drink.
Name: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply defined, this has piercing, penetrating high notes that are both floral and fruity. Its lemon and tangerine fruit is amped up with some alcoholic burn. Aerating it helps to smooth it out.
Name: Folin Cellars 2015 Estate Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Earthy, savory, seaside flavors dominate the mild fruit component of this rich-feeling but light-tasting wine.
Name: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deftly showing restraint with this grape that can easily be made into overripe wine, this bottling offers clean aromas of nectarine, apple blossom, bubblegum and tropical guava cream. A mouthwatering acidity hits the palate first, followed by a line of tense chalkiness, then comes the stonefruit, lime juice and a tactile sizzle into the finish.
Name: Left Bend 2014 Black Ridge Vineyards Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Beguiling aromas of honeysuckle, lime, peach and baking spices are followed by palate-coating stone-fruit flavors. It shows an impeccable sense of balance.
Name: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: In this well-made white, half of the wine was stainless-steel fermented, the other half barrel-fermented. Honeyed aromas of almond and a viscous, medium-bodied texture build weight toward the finish, while never becoming cloying. Vanilla and apricot round out the profile, buoyed by crisp acidity.
Name: Pech Merle 2015 Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fragrant with notes of pear, white peach, herb and honeysuckle. The flavors dance lightly, showing a pretty sense of precision along with a lengthy finish.
Name: William Church 2015 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick, honeyed apple wraps around aromas of Nilla Wafer in this full-bodied expression of the variety, perfumed with elements of peach and pear. Underlying acidity helps buoy the weight of the wine.
Name: Imagery 2015 Pratt Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of vanilla, custard, flowers and peach lead to a creamy palate, filled with vanilla notes. The oak plays a bit too prominent of a fiddle but there are lots of good things going on.
Name: Milbrandt 2014 The Estates Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: With an aroma like prosciutto and melon, a soft texture, and attractive floral and ripe peach flavors, this is a fun and affordable wine to drink at lunch or before dinner.
Name: McManis 2015 Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Golden in color, this honeyed wine offers full-bodied flavors of graham cracker and apple skin that maintain an intensity on the palate, fruity and thick.
Name: Terra Valentine 2014 Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Var, Provence, France
Description: Although labeled as Viognier, the wine also has a small amount of Chardonnay. But it is the perfumed Viognier, with its yellow-fruit flavor, that dominates and gives a rich, spicy and generous texture. Drink now.
Name: Château Routas 2015 Viognier (Var)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made in a rather ripe style, this bottling hits the nose with yellow-apple custard, banana chips, bubblegum and mango-candy flavors. The palate is also quite ripe and a tad sweet, with apple blossoms, tropical candy and apple-soda flavors.
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mt. Harlan, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is one of the harder grapes to tame in California, yet those wanting to walk the razor blade balance between ripeness and freshness should copy this Josh Jensen version. Candied nectarine, white peach, cherimoya and jasmine show on the ripe, honeyed nose, but then the palate restrains that exuberance with chamomile, sour pear peels and sea salt flavors.
Name: Calera 2014 Viognier (Mt. Harlan)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This bracing, tangy wine bursts forth with citrus flesh and rind, especially oranges, and a flash of pineapple. Zippy and mouth-puckering acidity make it a fun pairing with a wide variety of river fish and shellfish. A whiff of pine needle accents the finish.
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe Anjou pear, crisp lime, lemongrass, squeezed tangerine and apple blossom aromas show on this quite delicious and bright wine. There is a sizzling level of acidity throughout the sip, which offers lime, scratched grapefruit skin and tart apple flavors. A racy style done well.
Name: Shale Oak 2014 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Zesty Gala apple and squeezed tangerine aromas come through on this wine's citrusy nose, though it also shows riper nectarine, honeysuckle and chalky depth. The mineral flair continues onto the palate, where mandarin orange flavors meet with apple in the midpalate, bound together by a grapefruit pith texture.
Name: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: For some tasters this will seem too ripe, with its liquorous aromatics and burn in the back of the throat. That said, it's loaded with dense fruit flavors of peach and pear, and buoyed with sufficient acidty to keep from feeling at all flabby or fat.
Name: Abacela 2015 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this bottling is rather ripe but ever so inviting, with aromas of apple syrup, cantaloupe and caramelized white peach. The flavors are well-rounded and intriguing, with banana, apple pie, clove spice and vanilla cookie. A riper style done in a balanced way, which is hard to do on this grape.
Name: Felten Cellars 2014 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coming entirely from Gimelli Vineyard in San Benito County, this bottling, which is aged in neutral oak and concrete, shows squeezed Meyer lemon, Gravenstein apple, rain on slate minerality and key lime pie on the nose, which balances citrus with minerality. The palate is rather light and fresh, with cement, squeezed lime and yellow apple skin flavors.
Name: Calera 2014 Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is leveled by 10% Roussanne, and shows ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon, honeyed toast, pear custard and a slight cashew-like marzipan on the fairly dense nose. Rounded flavors of pear, melon, mango and honey dust comprise the palate.
Name: Alta Colina 2014 12 O'Clock High Viognier (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: A bit of skin contact gives this Viognier some extra character and texture. Quite aromatic on the nose, peach and pineapple juice aromas are shot through with pink peppercorns and grapefruit spray. The rich palate shows good acidic verve, however it feels slightly hot. Notes of jasmine show up on the midpalate leading to a slight astringent bitterness. In the end, fruit tones prevail and linger on a moderate finish.
Name: Brennan 2015 Cellar Select Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas High Plains, Texas, US
Description: Canned peach, banana and lilting white-flower aromas show some good concentration on the nose. The palate is playful and textured, with a pop of tropical fruit on the entry and more florals on the midpalate. A peach-fuzz texture tingles on the close.
Name: Spicewood 2014 Viognier (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: A pleasant concentration of tropical-fruit cocktail carries the nose, with a fresh grassy-green note popping up—out of character, yet enjoyable. The medium-bodied palate is juicy, fruity and textured in pineapple rind and Juicy Fruit gum. A peach fuzz texture lingers on the tongue.
Name: Veritas 2014 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: A delicate balance of geranium, peach blossom and ginger cookie shows on the nose and palate, with an additional herbal hop notes chiming in for the flavors. There's good acidic verve to counterattack the broad palate, making this rich white a solid choice for cedar-plank grilled fish.
Name: Brennan 2015 Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Muddled peach, apricot and vanilla cream carry the nose, while the palate is a bit more savory in character, with almond notes pervading over lilting flowers and tart apricot. There's a nice roundness to the palate and proper acidity to match. A Fuzzy white-tea tannin texture carries the nutty finish.
Name: Pedernales 2015 Reserve Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling still shows a vast array of tropical-leaning aromas, from jasmine and honeysuckle to ripe Gala apples, orange juice and key lime pie. Crisp stonefruit shows on the sip, as do more powerful white flowers, like tuberose.
Name: Falkner 2015 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
