Description: While jasmine and tropical fruit aromas show nice concentration on the nose, there's a bit of a chemical undertone. The weighty palate in punchy in character, with Juicy Fruit gum, banana and canned peach flavors.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Wessex Hundred Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Texas High Plains, Texas, US
Description: Mild tones of pollen, lemon, vanilla cream and sawdust carry the aromas and flavors. The palate is round and juicy, with appropriate balance of weight and acidity, yet the finish comes short. Perfectly enjoyable as an apéritif.
Name: Becker 2014 Reserve Viognier (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Peach, banana peel and a slight petrol note show mildly on the nose. The round palate boasts tart peach, pineapple rind and bitter lemon zest.
Name: Mont Sec 2015 Mont Sec Vineyards Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Succinct and to-the-point, this Viognier is bight in pineapple, citron and peach on the nose and palate. There's a decent weight and texture, however the flavors don't carry too long. Drink now.
Name: Brennan 2015 Reserve Newburg Vineyard Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas Hill Country, Texas, US
Description: Waxy crayon, petrol and steely lemon aromas mark the closed bouquet. The palate shows some decent weight, yet disparate acids give a sharp feeling. Citrus races from start to finish, with a slight char marking the close.
Name: Bending Branch 2014 Riven Rock Vineyard Viognier (Texas Hill Country)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Charred caramel drizzled over pineapple rind show mildly on the nose. The palate is medium in weight, with a muddling of lemon and tart peach. This Viognier is crisp and to the point.
Name: Pedernales 2015 Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas High Plains, Texas, US
Description: Heady floral aromas of rose and lychee overtake the nose and palate. It's rich in weight, with very little acid to maintain balance.
Name: Los Pinos Ranch 2015 Diamante Doble Vineyards Viognier (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Juicy Fruit gum and citrus blossom meet a chemical plastic note on the nose. The palate is light in weight, with sharp acids carrying along the peach juice and lemon flavors.
Name: Llano Estacado 2015 Mont Sec Vineyard Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: A layer of oak dust rides over sharp lemon and pineapple on the nose and palate. This is sharp, citric and zippy.
Name: Messina Hof 2015 Private Reserve Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Texas High Plains, Texas, US
Description: Bland citrus and a yeasty note seem out of character for a normally very aromatic varietal. This wine is light, supersimple and drinks like water.
Name: Lost Oak 2015 Bingham Family Vineyard Viognier (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This beautiful, aromatic wine smells like orange blossoms, tastes rich and fruity, and feels luxuriously smooth and layered. It has a winning combination of ripeness and depth but still has good acidity for balance.
Name: Lava Cap 2014 Vinehill Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A bright ripe fruit aroma like pineapple and ripe, luxurious fig, vanilla and almond flavors combine for an explosion of delicious power on the palate. This full-bodied wine has lots of depth and breadth in texture, plus a long, lingering finish.
Name: Skinner 2014 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of peach, flowers, lemon, lees and barrel spices are alluring and nuanced. The medium-weight flavors are tart and spritely, with a citrus and lees streak running throughout.
Name: Mark Ryan 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are bright, with notes of peach and flowers that display a sense of delicacy. The flavors are light but nuanced, displaying a fine sense of balance.
Name: Brian Carter 2014 One Olsen Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of lees and spice edge out peach and pear notes. The palate is dry and creamy in feel, with the fruit flavors light and elegant. The lees influence dominates.
Name: Nefarious 2014 Estate Grown Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, concentrated pear juice, candied tangerine rind and a light botanical aroma show on this dynamic dessert wine. The palate is expectedly sweet but cut by a driving, mouth-searing acidity, showing flavors of pear and apple skins, ripe stone fruit, golden raisins and lemon rinds.
Name: Timbre 2013 The Encore Riverbench Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tight honey, Asian pear, honeysuckle and light custard aromas show on the delicate nose of this restrained wine. But the restraint fades a bit on the palate, where apple blossoms, pear ice cream, vanilla bean and meringue flavors start light, then grow richer toward near-sweetness.
Name: South Coast 2014 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of apricot, honeysuckle and jasmine are light and elegant. The flavors show restraint but the concentration doesn't all seem there.
Name: Mercer 2015 Culloden Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: All biodynamically raised estate fruit comprises this marvelous Viognier, which spent four months in 40% new French oak. The full-bodied, perfect ripeness mixes apple, pear and apricot, with a gentle kiss of caramel from the short-term barrel aging. The length and balance set the standard for top-flight domestic Viognier.
Name: Cowhorn 2014 Reserve Estate Grown Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A clean and crisp style of Viognier, which comes in all forms these days, this bottling is light yet expressive on the nose with yellow grapefruit, lemon ice and a touch of chamomile tea. The palate is very grippy with crushed rocks, and also rich with buttered pear in the creamy, almost buttery midpalate, yet somehow remains lean and laser-focused.
Name: Sanford 2013 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This bright and spicy wine is packed with botanical flavors. The aromatics are pungent and intense, pushing sharp notes of lime, Meyer lemon and orange soda deep into the palate. In some ways this has the penetrating density of Gewürztraminer. It's bold and distinctive, though clearly different from other domestic Viogniers.
Name: Spangler 2015 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's never more than a barrel of this outstanding wine to go around, but it's well worth hunting down. Powerful and lush, it's got a silky, voluptuously fruity mouthfeel. Candied citrus and apple pie come to mind, as the flavors continue rushing through, finishing with a spicy lift and a whiff of menthol.
Name: Amalie Robert 2014 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Monterey, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of honey, yellow peach, brown pear and a nearly marshmallow character show on the nose of this bottling from the Carmel Valley. It's surprisingly very dry on the palate, where mouth-watering acidity offers plush nectarine and browned apple fruit flavors.
Name: Boekenoogen 2014 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pungent orange blossom and jasmine aromas show on the extremely floral nose of this bottling, which almost smells sweet. But the palate is dry with very vibrant acidity and a lot of interesting texture, showing ripe apple and pear flavors.
Name: Robert Hall 2015 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Intensely floral aromatics distinguish this pure varietal wine. Those body powder scents linger in a soft, lightly floral palate, along with flavors of citrus flesh and rind.
Name: Melrose 2013 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rather ripe style of the variable grape, this bottling shows honey, mango and caramelized banana on the nose, proving approachable although very buttery. The palate is a bit flat in acidity and texture, but offers white peach and dried apple flavors.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A puzzling wine, which bears no resemblance to other examples of this variety. Scents and flavors of vanilla dominate, around flavors of bruised melon, bubble gum and a bit of plastic. Two bottles tasted with similar notes.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2014 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An exotic, inviting aroma like apricot and sliced almonds leads to complex and compelling flavors that seem European as they layer peach skin on pastry shell on something almost briny. It is a flavorful, dry, rich, but almost astringent wine with great energy.
Name: Terre Rouge 2014 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a simply delicious and assertive wine that smells like roses and lemon zest, tastes like fresh apricots and biscotti and has a tangy, appetizing balance. It will be super as an apéritif for a summer time outdoor dinner.
Name: Rivino 2014 Estate Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sonoma Coast, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Whistler Vineyard is an extreme site on the coast above Annapolis, and a source of Pinot Noir for other producers. Here, it is working with a suitcase clone from Condrieu, fermenting the grapes in entirely new French oak. Honey, clove and apricot jump from the glass, with a blithe spirit of minerality and light body that provides plenty of refreshment. Made in tiny amounts.
Name: Whistler 2013 V Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly squeezed peaches, peach custard and ripe melon make for a rich nose on this bottling, but they remain balanced and light rather than treacly. Yellow peach, apple custard and cherimoya fruit show on the palate, where a lime peel edge cuts through the touch of browned marshmallow.
Name: Barton 2014 The Broken Road Clare Ranch Viognier (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine's lively bouquet leads with pretty aromas of peach, nectarine, orange blossom and ginger. The fruity palate is supported by pineapple-tinged acidity and a refreshing orange-spiked spice that lingers through the close. Easy drinking and well balanced, enjoy this white now.
Name: Michel Gassier 2015 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hints of lime skin, squeezed pink grapefruit and touches of petrol and quinine hit on the nose of this wine from a newish regional producer. There's a strong pithy character to the palate, where apple skins and a nearly white pepper sensation trend toward a botanical profile. It's intriguingly racy.
Name: McKinney 2014 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Intense vanilla and spice tones accentuate the abundance of white blossom and citrus-peel perfume on this heady Viognier. It's richly textured, dense like cream on the midpalate, but elegantly balanced in acidity, finishing with a touch of astringency on the finish.
Name: Anthony Nappa 2014 Fruition Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Mount Veeder, Napa, California, US
Description: This wine is quite clear and a touch austere on the entry. It follows through with a sharpness of lemon and fuzzy apricot and peach, touched on the finish by oak.
Name: Yates Family Vineyard 2014 Viognier (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This full-flavored and full-bodied wine is certainly a change of pace. It smells almost like eucalyptus, tastes powerfully fruity and floral, has a slight sweetness balanced by good acidity, and finishes with an intriguing mineral quality.
Name: The White Knight 2014 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The clonal selection related to the regional pioneer is the most interesting thing about this bottling, which is incredibly light and delicate, so much so that there is not tons of flavor. The nose shows very faint apple skins and key lime, and the palate barely offers pear skins and slate, though there is an intriguing texture.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Sharp acidity leads to defined flavors of green apple and lemon, maybe even as tart as grapefruit, within this medium-bodied wine with a richness of texture.
Name: Kunde 2014 Destination Series Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Subtle peach, apricot and yellow melon dance in the bouquet of this medium-bodied wine. The palate is pithy and tart, leaner than the nose suggests, with nice vibrancy and a subtle spicy accent on the close. Enjoy now.
Name: Michel Gassier 2014 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The lees and peach aromas are quite light considering the variety. The stone-fruit flavors are reserved and pleasant, but the variety seems to get lost.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2013 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine, on the nose this suggests a pungency of French bread, which doesn't open up for much else aromatically. On the medium-bodied palate, expect a mix of viscous honey and baked peach.
Name: Rally Point Wines 2013 Limited Production Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This light-footed Viognier has a touch of the blossomy perfume and waxiness expected in the grape variety. Unusually zesty, however, it lacks the characteristic oiliness and denseness of palate. It's delicate in concentration but an easy, breezy sip. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Bedell 2014 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This is the high-elevation Kimmeridgian soil interpretation of Viognier at the Lagrézette estate from enologist Claude Boudamani with consultant Michel Rolland. Despite its high alcohol, it is restrained and serious with structured fruits and a sense of balanced power. The fruits, apricots and white peach sing harmoniously with the pepper and spice from wood aging. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2014 Le Pigeonnier White Vision Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Rocamadour has been one of France's top pilgrimage sites since the Middle Ages but the vines only returned a decade ago. So Lagrézette's director-enologist, Claude Boudamani, went to the rock. The result is a pure Viognier, ripe and impressively rich. Classic apricot flavors come through strongly long with spice from wood aging. The wine pushes forward with its powerful fruitiness and intense flavors. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2014 Mas de Merveilles Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Quite pretty and true to its best varietal characteristics, this opens with aromas of white flowers, tangerine and lime, with flavors to follow. It's beautifully proportioned, lingering and full, without a hint of either heat or bitterness.
Name: Season 2014 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Stiff and tight at first, this punches through with skin flavors of citrus, flesh of grapefruit and a push into light tropical. You're left with a touch of papaya in a finish with excellent length.
Name: Kriselle 2014 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An expertly balanced take on this variable grape, this bottling shows tight aromas of wet concrete, scratched Meyer-lemon skin, yellow melon, poached peach, almond and a touch of salted lime. The palate is high and tight, bound by citrusy acidity, slowly revealing sunflower-seed warmth and ripe nectarine flavors.
Name: Rideau 2014 Daliet Reserve Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Soft white peach, chamomile, lemon rind and citrus blossoms show on the nose of this well-balanced bottling. The palate begins with a racy lemon-oil acidity, sours up a tad on apple skins and grapefruit, and then expresses a richer pear-extract component toward the finish.
Name: Four Lanterns 2014 Lamplight Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sprightly lime and peach aromas mix with seared orange rind and hints of white flowers on the nose of this bottling. The riper aromas tighten up on the sip, where tart green apples cut the suave nectarine-flesh flavors as white peach slowly emerges.
Name: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange, nectarine, canned pear and honeysuckle show on the nose of this quaffable bottling. The palate is nicely creamy but not overly thick, with banana cream and pear-mousse flavors that grow increasingly tropical as the sip lingers.
Name: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Shy aromas of white peach and wet concrete show on this nicely restrained version of Viognier. There is extreme minerality on the palate, much like licking concrete, with touches of lemon and stone fruit and a dollop of bright acidity.
Name: Rideau 2014 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An intriguing waxy character shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, with ripe lime and green-apple aromas as well. The flavors are light and delicate, with a touch of pomelo that grows with patience into more tropical yet still restrained papaya and bubblegum elements.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2014 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel fermented and ripened to exceptionally high alcohol, this dark, soapy wine is over the top in flavor. Not a trace of varietal character is left, just barrel and burn, plus intense perfume that dominates the nose. Drink up; it's already going over the hill.
Name: Agate Ridge 2012 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Full-bodied and opulent, this wine boasts a smoky-toasty layer of oak over all the standard Condrieu goodness—honeysuckle, apricot and tropical fruit. Toasted coconut lingers on the long, plush finish.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2012 Les Archevêques  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is less flamboyant than some Condrieus, but it still shows characteristic honeyed, floral notes. It's also one of the less expensive wines from the appellation and the most widely available. Apricot joins the party on the balanced palate and lingers through the finish. Drink now–2020.
Name: E. Guigal 2012  Condrieu

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% varietal wine that's barrel fermented in neutral French oak, this wine is creamy and lightly tropical in guava and tangy mandarin orange. Balanced acidity and integrated oak provide buoyancy against a natural ripeness and power, finishing delightfully floral.
Name: Alysian 2014 Grist Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Toasted coconut accents the honey and tropical fruit aromas of this wine, which is aged in oak (40%) and stainless steel (60%). It's medium to full in body, with a lively, balanced feel that makes it very drinkable and harmonious.
Name: Domaine Jean-Michel Gerin 2012 La Loye  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is an exceptionally well-crafted version of the variety from a tremendous site for the grape. Whole-cluster pressed and fermented in stainless steel, it retains fresh acidity that gives it lively tension on the palate, a foundation for briny lemon zest and classic floral notes.
Name: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2014 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine has typical Condrieu aromas and flavors of honey, apricot and white pepper, all carried by a fairly full-bodied, slightly oily palate. It's a rich wine, with lingering spice on the finish.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2012  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine boasts a vibrant nose of apricot, honeysuckle and tropical fruit notes resembling mango, lychee and banana. Those layers of fruit persist on the palate, which also features some slightly drying tannins. This is one Condrieu that demands food to show its best.
Name: Tardieu-Laurent 2013  Condrieu

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This wine is aromatically reserved for the variety, with notes of flowers, white peach and pear. The palate has sweet stone-fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Cinder 2014 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tight lemon peels and a restrained, almost chalky minerality greet the nose on this single-vineyard expression of Viognier, which also shows Gala apple, a shred of nectarine and a pinch of baking spice. A clean and pithy palate packs lemon custard, tangerine zest and grapefruit flavors.
Name: Fess Parker 2014 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From White Hawk Vineyard near Los Alamos, this wine has a nose that is both edgy with tangerine rind and ripe with warmer crème brûlée notes. The palate plays the same trick, welcoming with broad white peach, Japanese pear and vanilla-cream flavors, yet clinging to a zesty line of lime pith throughout.
Name: Nagy 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Mendocino-Lake, North Coast, California, US
Description: Lively aromas, an appetizing balance and just-rich-enough fruit flavors make a good combo in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It has subtle herb and kiwi aromas, crisp apple flavors, and a texture poised between supple and tangy.
Name: Bonterra 2014 Made with Organic Grapes Viognier (Mendocino-Lake)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Salted stonefruit, Key-lime pie and eggy brioche notes show on the nose of this entry-level Viognier from the longtime producer. The palate offers lime blossoms, white peach, slight quinine and a touch of caramel in the midpalate, presented with a grippy texture.
Name: Fess Parker 2014 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pleasant nose of peach, vanilla and pineapple custard grows quite boisterous and banana-like as this wine opens up. Peachy flavors show on the palate, where the vanilla and cake flavors are cut by a tight line of lime skin.
Name: Coruce 2012 Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This wine has a rounded texture, with fresh, clean fruit flavors that recall crisp apple and lemon. It delivers an energized mouthfeel and finish due to good acidity and a rather light body.
Name: Oak Grove 2014 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is an assertive wine with an herbal personality. Aromas resemble citrus and fresh herbs, the flavors are citrusy and savory, and the mouthfeel is rather generous.
Name: Ironstone 2012 Reserve Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A fairly action-packed nose combines yellow grapefruit, lemon blossoms, nectarine flesh and yellow melon with slate and a shred of bubblegum on the finish. The palate starts quite tight with pear rinds, and then gets riper with shaved apples, bubblegum and tropical elements.
Name: Robert Hall 2014 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of herbs are surprisingly light. The stone fruit flavors are broad, with tart, lemony acids. The variety seems impossible for find.
Name: Hawkins Cellars 2014 Barrel Select Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine starts out quite reductive, with sulfurous aromas that provide significant distraction. The flavors are light and show a pleasing elegance but can't make up the difference.
Name: Plumb Cellars 2014 Afternoon Delight Estate Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine just bowls you over from the first sniff, a lush mix of white flower and citrus-rind aromatics. It's precise and penetrating, leading into a thoroughly captivating palate of sharply defined grapefruit, peach and papaya, underscored by racy minerality.
Name: Penner-Ash 2014 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Another very successful Virgilius, the 2013 comes across as slightly more restrained on the nose, but explodes on the palate with bold flavors of apricot, floral notes and layers of gingery spice. It's a big, rich wine, with a slightly warm but elegant finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2013 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Nagambie Lakes, Victoria, Australia
Description: This winery is better known for its Marsanne, but this Viognier is an excellent value. It exudes hints of apricot, pineapple, ginger and honey, coming across rich and creamy on the palate. Despite the heft, it finishes long, framed by mouthwatering acidity.
Name: Tahbilk 2014 Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: This full-bodied wine is rich without ever seeming overdone. Subtle smoke notes frame bold fruit—tangerine, pineapple and apricot—and gingery spice, while the finish is long, peppery and refreshing. Drink now–2020.
Name: Yeringberg 2013 Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel-fermented in stainless steel and neutral oak, this aromatic wine rolls into a gorgeous palate loaded with rich fruit flavors of pineapple, grapefruit and Meyer lemon. There's a suggestion of softness to the acids, and a lick of butterscotch runs through the finish. It's a totally engaging wine.
Name: Cristom 2014 Estate Viognier (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: On top of being made from organically grown grapes, this wine is vegan friendly. Of course, that means nothing unless the wine is good. Thankfully, this wine is excellent. Apricot, honey and ginger notes mingle easily on the palate. Drink this full-bodied, slightly open-knit wine over through 2017.
Name: Yalumba 2014 Made with Organic Grapes Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba pioneered Viognier in Australia and the current crop of wines testifies to the company's efforts. This bottling is full bodied and rich to the point of being slightly oily on the palate, where it delivers bold flavors of honey, apricot and grilled pineapple. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2013 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Adelaide, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is less opulent and full bodied than most Australian Viogniers, but it still delivers an attractive blend of white peaches, citrus and baking spices. It's crisp and bright enough on the finish to handle a wide range of seafood dishes. Drink now.
Name: Mr. Riggs 2013 Generation Series Mrs. Viognier (Adelaide)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: A terrific deal, this is as varietally correct and rich a Viognier as you'll find for the price. Honeysuckle and apricot notes are carried by a slightly oily texture, yet the wine finishes long and elegantly. Vegan. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2014 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Coastal Region, South Africa
Description: This wine opens with an assertively spiced bouquet of gingered white-peach tea, orange blossom, honeysuckle and toasted almond. The palate offers more fruity character in flavors of ripe stone fruit and citrus, but it's still dominated by spicy notes of ginger, clove, anise and honeycomb. Drink now.
Name: Noble Hill 2013 Harvested by Hand Viognier (Coastal Region)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: This wine may not be quite as rich or expressive as the other Viogniers in the Yalumba stable, but it's still an attractive effort. Pineapple and apricot flavors pick up hints of gingery spice on the vibrant finish. Drink now.
Name: Oxford Landing 2014 Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Wellington, South Africa
Description: Bright, lively notes of yellow peach, apricot and melon adorn the bouquet of this attractive white, while hints of spiced orange, ginger and fresh herbs mingle in the background. It's medium weight and well balanced, with ample acidity and final touches of rosewater and sweet spice that grace the finish. Drink now.
Name: Diemersfontein 2014 Reserve Viognier (Wellington)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: With apricot and floral perfumes, this is a ripe wine, full in the mouth and with a subtle mix of fresh acidity and rich yellow fruits. It is still a little young and will be better from late 2016.
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2014 Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Full and round, this accessible wine features fruit flavors of peach and apricot, wrapped in a caramel cloak. It's soft, open and fleshy.
Name: Griffin Creek 2013 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Full and fruity, this has the ripeness to feel fleshy and lush, with a pleasant mix of pear, apple and peach flavors. Light touches of brioche and cinnamon add interest to the finish.
Name: Del Rio 2014 Estate Grown Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paarl, South Africa
Description: Dainty scents of fresh hay, pressed yellow flower, orange rind and ginger frame the stone-fruit core of this wine. Flavors of white tea, spiced orange and peach flood the palate, and while the texture is somewhat round and plush, ample acidity keeps the finish fresh and clean. Drink now.
Name: Fairview 2014 Viognier (Paarl)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Wood-aging, toasty aromas give this wine a ripe, creamy character that probably has too much wood and not enough fruit. There are spices, flavors of croissants and just a hint of yellow fruits. Drink now.
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2013 Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Lake Michigan Shore, Michigan, US
Description: Docile aromas of apricot and peach linger under an oaky blanket of toasted coconut praline. Full and silky on the palate, the fruit tones remain quiet, taking on a lightly brûléed character. Texture wins over flavor intensity in this Viognier that has seen 18 months in French oak.
Designation: Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien
Name: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Single Barrel Thomas Vineyard Domaine Barrien Viognier (Lake Michigan Shore)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Not as varietally expressive as the 2013, this is nonetheless a solid, well-made white wine. A hint of gingery spice frames yellow plum fruit, which then comes to a dry, dusty close on the finish.
Name: Mr. Riggs 2014 Generation Series Mrs. Viognier (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: Aromas of candle wax, corn and sweat are funky and oily. Speaking of oily, the texture on this Viognier is just that, while sharp acidity and heavily extracted pyrazines make this fiery. A mash-up of citrus and nectarine flavors turn slightly bitter in front of a monotonous finish.
Name: Casa Montes 2014 Ampakama Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral French oak, this 100% varietal wine lets the fruit take center stage, offering up white peach and apricot in a succulent package. Floral and flinty, it's balanced, with just the slightest notion of vanilla and brioche popping up on the finish.
Name: Pride Mountain 2014 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Sonoma Mountain, Sonoma, California, US
Description: With a residual sugar percentage of 13.6% and modest alcohol, this dark golden-brown honey of a dessert wine is balanced, light and yet rich, a touch oxidized on the nose. Offset by a bite of caramel apple, this would be tremendously good over ice cream.
Name: Belden Barns 2012 Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Mountain)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, peach, mineral and barrel spice are expressive and provide detail. This wine is full bodied and rich, yet exceptionally well balanced, with a finish that lingers.
Name: Force Majeure 2014 Estate Grown Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Steely on the nose, this Amy Butler bottling shows lemon blossoms, dried apples, ripe pear, lime juice and a touch of peach. The palate is high-toned and tight with citrus zest and lemon-verbena notes, dancing across the tongue on acidic tippy toes.
Name: Ranchero Cellars 2014 La Vista Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Temecula, South Coast, California, US
Description: Quite light in the glass, this wine offers crisp and tight aromas of Japanese pear, peach blossom and custard torte. It's light and easy on the palate, with honeysuckle and cooked-apple flavors cut by lemon juice.
Name: South Coast 2014 Winemaker's Signature Selection Viognier (Temecula)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peach blossoms, seared orange, jasmine and other white flowers show very strongly on the nose of this wine by veteran Gary Eberle. The palate is ripe with honeysuckle, pears and cooked apples. It's a bit fat in the middle, but texturally focused on the edges with pinpoint acidity.
Name: Eberle 2014 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The pear, nectarine and floral aromas seem to lack clarity. This wine is full of stone-fruit flavors that bring a touch of sweetness and lead to a warm finish.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety seems to get lost in the aromas, with light notes of lees, stone fruit and almond. This wine is full in feel, with elegant peach flavors.
Name: Gamache 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Knights Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a pretty wine, resplendent in jasmine and honeysuckle, with a light-bodied, integrated approach to highlighting fresh layers of apricot and peach. The viscosity is just right, focused and restrained, while the finish puts an exclamation point to the freshness of fruit.
Name: Lawer 2014 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Full bodied, buttery and spicy in aroma and oaky in flavor, this wine has a big, bold personality from the first whiff through the lingering finish. Complexity and body are its strong suits rather than fruitiness.
Name: Perry Creek 2012 Altitude 2401 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: Subtle honeysuckle, orange and apricot aromas lead to nicely tangy fruit flavors, medium body and good crisp acidity. This is a well-balanced, vibrant and refreshing wine.
Name: Kendric Vineyards 2014 Proprietor Grown Viognier (Marin County)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Named Telhas (tiles) from the Roman tiles that are still found occasionally in this vineyard, this is a rich spicy wine that comes mainly from Viognier. That gives the wine a perfumed character with touches of ginger, along with ripe apricots and a fine fresh aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2017.
Name: Terras de Alter 2013 Telhas Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Woody in aroma, this is an exceptionally light-bodied, floral and herbal white, marked most by its high-pitched acidity that threatens to veer into extreme territory. Instead, beeswax and white peach figure into the mix, finishing in a refreshing twist of lemon.
Name: Kobler 2014 Kobler Family Vineyards Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Placer County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine smells ripe and buttery, like a pear tart, and has similar tasty flavors like ripe apple, vanilla and cream. Though it's not technically sweet, the personality is generous and the texture soft and rich.
Name: Carol Shelton 2014 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright floralilty greets the nose on this bottling, which shows lime and grapefruit blossom as well as a lighter nectarine flesh. The palate is restrained and grippy, a tart take on the varietal, with lime sorbet, lemon peel and yellow-grapefruit flavors.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This yellow-gold wine is packed with bright floral and citrus scents and flavors. It's a mouthful of lemon-drop goodness, with the rough edges smoothed by a percentage aged in neutral oak. The finish features light honey, with a slight burn.
Name: Folin Cellars 2014 Estate Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honeysuckle and white peach show on the nose of this bottling from the region's longtime Rhône producer. It's a simple and straightforward take on the grape, with dried white peach, lemon-lime candy and apple-peel flavors, wrapped up with buzzing acidity and grippy texture.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2014 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Golden honey in color and tone, this white is nonetheless crisp, adorned in orange blossom and a taste of white peach, the minerality never in question. Half of the fruit is estate grown, with 8% Marsanne blended in.
Name: Mounts 2013 Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a light, crisp white from a tremendous vineyard source. A mix of cucumber and white peach at the heart of this wine makes it seem lighter than it is. Oaky caramel vanilla closes out the finish.
Name: Foundry 2013 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Clements Hills, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh pear, white peach and fig aromas, a rich texture, and generous vanilla and layered almond flavors describe this tasty wine that stays fresh and fruity through the finish. It offers a medium body and nice balance.
Name: Von Holt 2014 Terra Alta Vineyard Viognier (Clements Hills)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fresh cantaloupe aromas, mouth-filling pear and peach flavors and a generous texture make this an extroverted wine that could make a great pairing with salty cheeses. It is full bodied, very smooth-textured and long on the finish, where honey and vanilla flavors echo.
Name: McManis 2014 Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: This is a light, crisp, simple 100% expression of the variety. It shines best in its aromas of honeysuckle and peach.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Viognier (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this densely layered wine show both the richness of caramelized citrus and the freshness of apple blossoms, with a touch of iodine tossed in for intrigue. There's a nice lime-like liveliness on the palate, though it is quite sour, with tart stone fruit flavors.
Name: Lion Ranch 2013 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite shy in aromas at first, the nose on this wine focuses on apple candies, lime blossoms and Anjou pear juice. The palate shows slightly sour apples and tangy lime juice, with a crisp pear backbone.
Name: Inception 2012 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As with most Del Rio wines, this is 100% varietal. Fruity and forward, it's a bowl full of peaches and apples. Flavors are light and fresh, without much substance. Drink up.
Name: Del Rio 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Beeswax, lemon-laced sour cream and a peach-blossom ripeness combine on the nose of this excellently restrained wine from a highly variable, often overripe grape. There is great energy and balance on the palate, with a light nuttiness and a touch of honey that will drink well for a few years.
Name: Stolpman 2014 Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas pop, with notes of white flowers, pear and ripe peach. It's full bodied in feel, drinking dry with a textured feel and a drawn-out finish—a very pleasing example of the variety.
Name: Airfield Estates 2014 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's a vague honey character on the nose of this wine from the historic vineyard, followed by a fresh lemon, lime-chiffon and white-flower character. The palate is clean and crisp with minerally flavors, offering Gala apple skins and tangy lime juice, but right down the middle and never overdone.
Name: Carucci 2013 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Danube River Plains, Bulgaria
Description: An engaging bouquet of green apple, peach and white flowers brace the palate for flavors of white peach and apricot with a hint of rose petal. This wine is clean in the mouth with an invigorating finish.
Name: Chateau Burgozone 2014 Viognier (Danube River Plains)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is tropical, boisterous rendition of the grape, with heavy tuberose, white lily, peach and apple-blossom aromas. The palate combines honeysuckle, ripe apple flesh and pineapple-guava flavors.
Name: Zinke 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Oxidative aromas of macadamia nuts, walnut oil, marzipan and dried lemon are happily cut by a soda character on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers preserved lemons, seared marshmallow and nut oils, proving fairly fat on the sip.
Name: Standing Sun 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: White blossoms and peaches perfume this unusually zesty Viognier. Dry and delicately framed, it's balances crisp, cutting acidity against sunny citrus flavors. It's an easy, refreshing wine with a moderately long finish.
Name: Bedell 2013 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: The nose screams Viognier, with aromas of Juicy Fruit gum, white flowers and powdered candy necklace. A peaches-and-cream palate feels lush and viscous, yet the acid manages to keep things lively through the fuzzy-textured finish.
Name: Trump 2014 Estate Bottled Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is warm and tropical on the nose, with banana, papaya, honeysuckle and tuberose aromas proving a bit overpowering. The palate offers smoked apple flavors.
Name: MCV 2013 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Elqui Valley, Chile
Description: This Viognier from the outlands region of Elqui is minerally but low on fruit aromas. A fresh, linear palate offers lettuce, lime and other limited green-leaning flavors, while the finish is lasting and firm, with zesty acidity.
Name: Falernia 2014 Reserva Viognier (Elqui Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely showy white tuberose flowers and tropical candied guava fruit combine into a bubblegum-like nose on this wine. The palate is overwhelmingly tropical, bordering on treacly in presentation.
Name: Ascension Cellars 2014 Halo Cass Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Medium gold in color, with a slight pink hue, this carries the aroma of canned tropical-fruit cocktail—tin and all. The peach-juice palate is viscous and round, almost oily, while the tart, tropical acidity struggles to bring balance.
Name: James Charles 2014 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey is the dominant star in this bottling, drizzled all over yellow apples on the nose. The golden liquid also shows strong on the palate, with flavors of pears and apples soaked in honey water.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2013 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Texas, Texas, US
Description: Vanilla candle wax, pollen and peaches-and-cream aromas are inviting and warm. The luscious body of juicy stone fruit is overcome by soapy floral notes on the midpalate, yet the persistent acid manages to clean up the flavors on the finish.
Name: Brennan 2014 Reserve Viognier (Texas)

Appellation: Casablanca Valley, Chile
Description: Aromas of waxy stone fruits and gasoline announce a wine with issues. This Viognier feels citric and racy, with little body given the grape type. Flavors of lemon, lime and pickle brine finish with sour grapefruit notes.
Name: Mancura 2013 Reserva Guardián Viognier (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine makes the case for Viognier in this appellation, expressing Golden Delicious apple and pear around a fresh, medium build of viscous texture, lemon and wild honey. Pretty and aromatic, it's a classically fine-formed white, made in small quantities.
Name: Meadowcroft 2014 Louvau Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From an area better known for red wines, this bottling by Paso Robles-based Jeremy Weintraub shows the strong white wine potential of this new Santa Barbara County appellation. Aromas of peach, cherimoya and white truffle cream lead into a waxy, restrained palate that shows golden flesh fruit, beeswax, a bit of yogurt and a minerally snap.
Name: Site 2013 Larner Vineyard Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a complex and lively dessert wine, with concentrated quince and honeysuckle on the nose, as well as tangerine skin and the slightest touch of white rock minerality. It's soft on the palate, with a bitter grapefruit-pith twist, showing flavors of golden honey, lemon balm, chamomile and chive.
Name: Mattina Fiore 2013 Fiorellino Murmur Vineyard Late Harvest Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: In perfect proportion, this estate-grown, biodynamically farmed wine brings a sweet-tart fruit intensity to bear. Citrusy flavors of pith and skin are skillfully wedded to ripe, substantial apricot and melon fruit, with none of the bitterness this grape can sometimes display. The purity is impressive.
Name: Cowhorn 2014 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied white is grand but not showy, dry but not austere. It combines intriguing and subtle aromas and flavors resembling grilled baguette, toasted almonds, vanilla, fig and white peach. It should pair well with mushrooms, poultry and veal.
Name: Sol Rouge 2013 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Named after the fourth art of Kama Sutra, this wine shows Juicy Fruit gum aromas as well as banana candies and a squeeze of lemon. There is a lime-pith tension to the powerful bubblegum ripeness alongside papaya, banana and yellow melon.
Name: LXV 2014 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vista Flores, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gritty, waxy aromas of pithy citrus and vanilla feed into a fleshy palate with bracing acidity. Light, mild flavors of papaya and pear finish simple and short, with stone-fruit notes along with cantaloupe and peach flavors.
Name: Mil Piedras 2014 Viognier (Vista Flores)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of honeysuckle, pear and white peach are bright and fresh on this stainless-steel-fermented blend of Conner Lee and Gamache vineyard fruit. There's plenty of richness and weight to the sweet stone-fruit flavors, although the wine retains a pleasing sense of balance.
Name: William Church 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of peach, nectarine and pear lead to dry, fleshy stone-fruit flavors that decline toward the finish.
Name: Mercer 2014 Culloden Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of pear, apricot and stemmy herbs lead to full-feeling pear and stone -ruit flavors that pull up short on the back nine, seeming a bit underripe.
Name: Tertulia 2014 Whistling Hills Estate Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deep yellow-gold color and rich aromas of fig, marzipan and pear indicate this will be a concentrated, full-bodied wine, which it is. Flavors layer peach, pear and toasted almond. The texture is very creamy and smooth, and the finish lingers a long time. It's a great example in the full-bore mode.
Name: Baiocchi Wines 2013 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine spent three months in 38% new French oak, which softens and adds a bit of barrel-induced richness to the mouthfeel. It remains a fascinating mix of flower and citrus, with lightly-buttered toast and a lush, lemon-custard flavor.
Name: Cowhorn 2013 Reserve Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A deep gold color and rich, tangerine and almond aromas meet pear-tart flavors and a creamy texture in this full-bodied but not over-the-top wine. The flavors and texture are pleasantly dense yet the wine is dry. This should age well, gaining complexity and interest through 2002.
Name: Terre Rouge 2013 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: Named after a mistress of King João V of Portugal, this beautiful, ripe wine is packed with apricot and juicy mango flavors as well as just the right amount of acidity. It's a rich wine, full in the mouth and generous. The finish has some freshness, although it is the broad flavors that stand out. Drink from 2016.
Name: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2012 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This nose from the actor-turned-vintner's family vineyard shows tight aromas of chalk, rain on cement and lime pith and blossoms. The laser-focused palate holds to the lime-pith lead, also showing ruby-red grapefruit juice, but exercising a lot of clean restraint.
Name: Fess Parker 2013 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Made in a deliciously oaky style, this smells like melted butter and toasted baguette, tastes like ripe pears drizzled with crème anglaise and feels almost sweet. The toasted oak component adds a touch of bitterness to balance the richness, and it all works beautifully for this approach.
Name: Cedarville 2013 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Made in a complex style rather than simply fruity, this smells like toasted almonds and vanilla bean. Tastes suggest not-quite-sweet Bosc pears, butter and walnuts. While the texture is luxurious the body is actually light, and the wine is not at all cloying.
Name: Naggiar 2014 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Inviting aromas of buttered vanilla bean, caramelized apples, honey and yellow cake introduce this single-vineyard wine from one of the region's most reliable producers. This is a great way for Chard lovers to break out into new territory, with flavors of buttered apples and almond oil.
Name: Adelaida 2013 Anna's Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: The subdued aromas might indicate a bland wine, but this turns out to be a rich and fairly full-bodied one. Flavors come on strong with vanilla, butter, fig and marzipan. The texture feels nicely thick, carrying along all those flavors to a lingering finish.
Name: Orpheus 2013 Nelson Vineyards Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A touch of vanilla, butter and seared lemons characterize the nose of this wine that also shows pears and apples, making it a solid Chardonnay alternative. The palate offers a hint of marzipan along with juicy lemon pulp and zest as well as richer stone-fruit elements in the midpalate.
Name: Fess Parker 2013 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Round fruit flavors meld melon, pears and apricots. Partial barrel fermentation smoothes it all out and adds just a touch of vanilla spice. It's a lovely choice for a Chardonnay alternative that will match appropriately with a variety of food.
Name: Quady North 2014 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of lemon-lime soda, ripe nectarine, honeydew and kiwi paint a tropicality that is strong but not overdone. Citrus-driven acidity drives the sharp palate, which also shows flavors of green apple and steel.
Name: Pugilist 2013 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a flavorful, easy-drinking wine with plenty of fruit aromas, a soft texture, ripeness on the palate, and medium body. It has the pastry shop suite of flavors, like vanilla, cream and even coconut, and seems a bit sweet on the finish.
Name: Rivino 2013 Estate Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of grapefruit and honeysuckle get the attention right away. Flavors of peach and honey, a soft and smooth texture, good acidity, full body and a touch of sweetness finish the picture. This certainly gives maximum fruitiness.
Name: Holly's Hill 2014 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is a bit reluctant on the nose at first, eventually showing focused notes of honeysuckle, fresh-squeezed lime and kiwi. The palate is delicate and light, with apple cider and cut-pear flavors.
Name: Workman Ayer 2014 Ipso Facto Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier has a rather narrow ripening range, and this wine is right at or just past the extreme. Leesy peach and melon fruit veers into bitter, gin-like phenolics, which put some bite into the finish. Chilling it down will help to mitigate that bitterness.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, and 10% was barrel fermented. That seems to have put a light layer of toast over lemon-drop fruit. There's a touch of grapefruit and some aromatic notes of candied orange peel.
Name: Weisinger 2013 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Walla Walla Valley-designated whites are a rarity. Here aromas of vanilla, toast, honeysuckle and peach show nuance and detail and lead to sweet, light bodied, lightly spritzy stone-fruit flavors with a long finish that commands attention.
Name: Abeja 2014 Estate Grown Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of wet stone, smoke, stone fruit and white flowers lead to ethereally light yet sweet and flavorful peach notes. It's a very pretty and compelling expression of the variety.
Name: Cayuse 2013 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pale yellow in color, this five-plus-year-old white has aromas of lees, dried apricot and flowers. The palate feels full bodied, but with lighter-styled flavors and a zing of acid on the finish.
Name: McCrea 2010 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of pear, honeysuckle, cream and peach rise up from the glass. This is lightly creamy in feel, with elegantly styled but well-balanced fruit flavors that linger.
Name: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: Soft gold in color, this wine offers fragrances of apple tart and vanilla. Flavors of pear, apple, lemon curd and eucalyptus come on strong but mellow as it moves into the pear and lemon peel finish.
Name: Galil Mountain 2012 Yiron Viognier (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine offers bright aromas of watermelon and cherry Jolly Ranger. It drinks dry with candied fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of texture and richness.
Name: Gramercy 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's difficult to find the aromas of stone fruit and herbs in the glass. The flavors show a lot of lightness and elegance but also a sense of balance.
Name: Watermill 2014 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of pear, stone fruit and lees lead to peach and floral flavors. The concentration is light and elegant.
Name: Telaya 2013 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of lees, apricot, vanilla and wheat lead to full-bodied fruit and cinnamon flavors. It's fleshy in feel but the flavor concentration isn't all there.
Name: Hudson Shah 2012 Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes take the lead with aromas of char, butterscotch and spice overrunning the fruit. There's a pleasing creamy feel to the sweet fruit flavors but the variety is near impossible to find.
Name: Wedge Mountain 2014 Evergreen Vineyard Viognier (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Rich, full and opulent, this is a honeyed, lush Condrieu probably best consumed by the end of 2015. Apricot and dried pineapple notes come across almost like a dry Sauternes, accented by lingering caramel and spice on the long finish.
Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2012  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This seems a tad more restrained than usual for La Doriane, which has typically been extremely lush and exotic in the past. The 2012 isn't as over the top, but still shows plenty of ripe apricot and tropical fruit framed by smoky oak and baking spices. The finish is long and mouthwatering, suggesting at least a few years of longevity.
Name: E. Guigal 2012 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This luxury bottling spends nine months in barrel, yet shows little overt oak. It's full, ripe and opulent without going over the top, boasting aromas and upfront flavors of honeydew, apricot and bergamot. Then the long, mouthwatering finish folds in hints of honey and pineapple without any hint of bitterness.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2012 La Chambée  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Like the rest of the 2012 Condrieus recently tasted, this is full-bodied and rich without being overdone. Apricot and ginger aromas lead into flavors reminiscent of honeycomb, white pepper and apricot. The texture is slightly oily, but that's balanced on the finish by peppery spice.
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2012 La Combe de Malleval  (Condrieu)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A luxurious texture, with generous fig, vanilla and almond flavors make this reminiscent of a Danish pastry, though not as sweet. It smells subtle but ripe and opulent. Figgy and buttery flavors are broad and mouthfilling, yet a backbone of acidity lends freshness.
Name: Miraflores 2013 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Based in nearby Cornas, Colombo has fashioned a medium-bodied Condrieu that's a bit oily in texture while remaining very drinkable. Mint, melon and apricot notes mark the aromas and flavors, while the finish is clean and refreshing.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2012 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The grape's usual peachy aromas show on this wine from regional pioneer Gary Eberle, along with lemon juice, honey and a touch of minerality. There is a nice mineral-driven tension on the palate, with flavors of apple and pear cider. It's a solid, down-the-middle take on the grape—not too ripe, not too thin.
Name: Eberle 2013 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An oxidized style of the grape, this shows dried apricot, marzipan and macadamia nuts on the nose, all cut with a lemon juice freshness. Once sipped, there are roasted nuts, dried peaches, figs and even dates on the palate, with an iodine character through the center and a lively acidity. The exotically honeyed finish is reminiscent of baklava.
Name: Martin Ranch 2012 Thérèse Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and forward, this has a plush mouthfeel, a mix of banana marshmallows and lemon meringue pie. It's quite tasty and easy-drinking, so give it a light chill and drink up while it remains young and fresh.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2013 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Floral aromas of buttercup and peach blossom are true to the variety. This is also correct in its full, round, peach-driven palate. Apricot and mango flavors creep toward an astringent and salty finish.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2014 La Joya Gran Reserva Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Tejo, Portugal
Description: The naturally ripe, yellow fruits and perfumed character of Viognier is well expressed here. It is smooth, bringing out ripe fruitiness that is lightly cut with acidity. Drink now.
Name: Casal do Conde 2014 Viognier (Tejo)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This 100% Viognier from Cairanne is broad and rich, showing proper varietal notes of apricot and ginger. It seems a bit warm and soft on the finish.
Name: Domaine Brusset 2013 Les Clavelles Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Seductive aromas of caramel, fresh-crushed soda rock and squeezed lemon introduce this Viognier from a historic vineyard by winemaker Steve Fennel. The palate releases flavors steadily, from tight lime juice and citrus pith in the midpalate to round nectarine and ripe apple flesh on the edges.
Name: Sanford 2012 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This variety is a consistent strength for this winery. A warm vintage wine, it offers aromatic notes of freshly cut flowers, peach, creamsicle, pear and tangerine. It's textured in feel with abundant stone fruit and vanilla flavors that lead to a tart, apricot filled finish that lingers. The barrel influences play a big part but it works.
Name: àMaurice 2013 Sparrow Estate Viognier Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of golden honey and concentrated white flowers entertain the nose on this dessert offering from the urban winery on Santa Barbara's Eastside. Quite delicious and balanced once sipped, the viscous flavors blend honey, lemonade reduction and guava, with bright acidity keeping it nicely alive on the palate.
Name: Jaffurs 2012 Late Harvest Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Lifted aromas of jasmine, apricot and guava entice from the glass. Medium to full bodied on the palate, this Viognier shows no sense of sloth. Lively acids keep everything in check, while tart tropical fruits meld into juicy stone fruits. Enjoy this alluring sipper with mango-glazed grilled salmon.
Name: Michael Shaps 2014 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This full-bodied Viognier opens with aromas of toasted oak, butterscotch, vanilla and mature apricot. On the richly textured palate, notes of vanilla, nut and toast precede creamy white peach and lemon drop.
Name: Michele Satta 2013 Giovin Re Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brie rinds and grapefruit peels show their pithy aromas on this wine from a heritage clone cultivated by the California Rhône pioneer. It's lean, grippy and minerally on the palate, like licking gray rocks and cold steel, and comes across as enjoyable and memorable.
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2013 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Fresh peach and apple aromas are rounded out by white jasmine notes. Silky on the palate, with well-integrated acids, peach and melon flavors focus around a lemon backbone.
Name: Trump 2013 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Grilled peach meets exotic yuzu citrus on the nose. Lively yet rich, the palate houses bright notes of white cherry alongside buttered popcorn. The lightly textured finish is reminiscent of supple white tea.
Name: Jefferson Vineyards 2013 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Typical aromas of ripe peach, melon and white flowers are elevated on the nose. A slightly oily palate houses floral tones up front, leading to juicy nectarine on the midpalate. A playful, fuzzy feeling round out the finish.
Name: Pearmund 2013 Vinecroft Vineyard Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes of toast and vanilla get out of front of the aromas and flavors of almond and peach. The feel is full bodied and lightly oily, showing some warmth on the finish.
Name: Stottle 2013 Elerding Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Aromas of rose and orange oil dominate the nose, while the palate brings more tart nectarine and blossom notes. Medium bodied, with balanced acidity, this wine finishes with a slightly fuzzy texture.
Name: DuCard 2013 Signature Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Lively and aromatic, this shows aromas of candied peach, Juicy Fruit gum and white flower. The palate shows pleasant weight, texture and more tart flavors. The addition of 6% Petit Manseng brings acidic lift that lasts through the finish.
Name: Rappahannock Cellars 2014 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Muddled stone fruit aromas meld with overripe floral tones on the nose. There's a pop of pineapple and mango fruits on the front, with tangerine leading to a short finish. This is a straightforward but enjoyable fruit-bomb.
Name: Horton 2013 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Slightly unusual for a Viognier, this offers notes of lychee, rose and citrusy hops on the nose. Grapefruit pith leads to round nectarine and peach, offering ample weight for this exotic sipper.
Name: Pollak 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this wine is very peachy, boosted in the ripe department by banana, honeysuckle and tuberose. The palate is also rich and forward, with dried apricots and buttered peaches. It's well made, just quite tropical, and would complement roasted chicken.
Name: Pear Valley 2013 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Middleburg, Virginia, US
Description: Notes of canned peach, guava and a slight banana kick are restrained on the nose. The lithe palate is citrus-driven, with tart nectarine adding a bit of additional fruit.
Name: Three Fox 2014 La Boheme Viognier (Middleburg)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: The nose is a bit one-note, showing a generic Juicy Fruit gum aroma. Sharp acids frame a palate of canned fruit cocktail, leading to an astringent finish.
Name: Ingleside 2014 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: White flower and bubble gum notes show little depth on the nose. A briny, sharp palate overpowers generic fruit-cocktail tones.
Name: White Hall 2014 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Muddled citrus notes are the highlight of a somewhat lacking nose. The oily palate is more fruit-driven, with overripe peach showing full force.
Name: Sunset Hills 2013 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Minute quantities of these rare Viogniers are produced, which is a shame, because they are distinctive and enlightening. Deep gold and intensely aromatic with brilliant floral notes, this is a beautifully balanced wine, with the acidity and skin flavors to put a crisp frame around the ripe peach and apricot fruit.
Name: Amalie Robert 2012 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy, punchy and pungent, this bright and crisply defined effort displays a riot of orange and apricot fruit flavors, morphing into a Grand Marnier finish. It's deep and persistent, fully ripe but neither hot nor bitter.
Name: WildAire 2013 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: Viognier in Portugal brings out the grape's ripe side along with layers of rich spice. This wine is full, layered with toast and almonds as well as superripe intense fruit. Powerful, complex and dense, the wine is still very young and should be aged. Drink from 2017.
Name: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2013 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Santa Clara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very light shade of straw in the glass, this shows distinct honey, beeswax and mead notes on the delicate nose. The flavors float on a cloud of more honey, drizzled atop Key lime pie, with vanilla syrup popping up on the finish.
Name: Sarah's Vineyard 2012 Estate Viognier (Santa Clara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine shows quite a bit of tropicality on the nose, with lychee and kiwi fruits, yet manages to remain restrained at the same time. It's soft on the palate, with white peach flesh, and shows a very intriguing herbal side, with tarragon and mint flavors, but not in a green pepper way at all.
Name: Consilience 2012 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Chalk and peach blossoms swirl into an alluring nose on this wine from a biodynamic-minded estate. It's light and airy on the palate, showing flavors of grapefruit and light honey, with brisk acidity and a chalky minerality making for a good, clean, fun wine.
Name: Demetria 2013 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: This smells like butterscotch and ripe pear, tastes floral like honeysuckle and has an almost sweet feeling on the tongue. It's smooth, medium-bodied, soft in texture and easy to swallow, while delivering lots of clean, fresh fruit flavor.
Name: Helwig 2013 Viognier (California)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Ripe and generous in aroma and flavor, this full-bodied wine tastes like fresh peaches, pears and apples subtly accented by vanilla and nutmeg. The texture is very smooth, almost soft, with a hint of citrus to brighten the finish.
Name: The Crusher 2013 Viognier (California)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Restrained yet ripe peach and nectarine aromas show themselves slowly in a very demure manner on this wine. The palate is more about sensation than flavors, with bitter-sour elements and a bit of grit more prominent than the nectarine flesh and green apple flavors.
Name: Rideau 2013 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From pop music star Fergie, this wine shows dainty aromas of lemon-lime soda, red apple and honey. The palate is bright, with lemon custard and poached pears, proving sweet and sour notes simultaneously.
Name: Ferguson Crest 2013 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Here's a no-nonsense wine with fresh fruit aromas, ripe but not overripe flavors, good acidity to keep it tangy and a smooth but firm texture that is appetizing. It tastes like white peaches with a splash of orange, then brings in toasted almonds on the finish.
Name: Drytown 2013 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The steel processing puts the ripe fruits of this grape on an almost too-full display. Aromas of honey, white flowers, red apples and glazed nectarines lead to a nearly off-dry palate, with apple custard flavors leveled by lemon juice acidity, lime pith and a soft mouthfeel.
Name: Rideau 2013 Stainless Steel Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a nicely complete wine with a rich texture, subtle aromas and flavors that resemble Anjou pear and honeysuckle, and a clean, lingering, lightly fruity finish. Medium-bodied and smooth, it will be versatile before or with meals.
Name: Clif Family 2013 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Briny, with a hint of salted caramel, this is a high-toned white wine, refreshing in lemon and pear notes, with a slight suggestion of orange peel that's entirely welcoming. Focused and crisp throughout, it remains vibrant amid a creaminess to the mouthfeel, finishing with the right balance of both.
Designation: Destination Series Sustainably Farmed and Estate Grown
Name: Kunde 2013 Destination Series Sustainably Farmed and Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Rich in flavor and texture, this smells like white peach and buttered popcorn with a hint of chalky earthiness. The taste is creamy and reminiscent of honey and toasted almonds. It is medium bodied, but lush and almost thick in mouthfeel, with flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Hansen Cellars 2012 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fragrantly floral in jasmine and beeswax, this vineyard-designated Viognier offers apricot, peach and honeydew melon around a robust, full-bodied figure. Ripe and fleshy, it remains sturdy through the long finish, tinged with Tahitian vanilla.
Name: Thumbprint Cellars 2013 J & B Schmidt Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose begins with a smoked Meyer lemon element, but evolves into fleshier tropicality, with ripe kiwi, white flowers and vanilla. The palate begins with vanilla, but then shows ripe stone fruits that trend toward bubble gum, with enough acidity and tannic grip to keep it serious.
Name: Still Waters 2013 Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This aromatic wine highlights pear, white peach, melon and honeysuckle. It's rich and full bodied without ever going over the top, and also shows more acid than this variety often sees.
Name: Cinder 2013 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Made by Phillip Titus, this Viognier is sourced from Cold Creek Ranch in Carneros, a relatively cool spot as far as the Napa Valley goes, yet here it exhibits warmer characteristics of floral beeswax, honey and baked apricot. Full bodied, this wine is creamy and quite rich and tropical, barrel-fermented in neutral French oak, the alcohol on the higher side.
Name: Sonoma-Loeb 2013 Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Generous aromas of apricot and peach come with a guava accent. It's full bodied and viscous in feel, with sweet stone-fruit flavors that linger.
Name: Koenig Vineyards 2012 Williamson Vineyard Viognier

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Dark golden-honey in color, this viscous, creamy and rich dessert wine remains balanced and not overly sweet, the acidity tête-à-tête with the sugar. Orange, peach and apricot vie for attention, ultimately complementing one another around a light body and finish.
Name: Anaba 2011 Late Harvest Landa Vineyards Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
