Description: This smells at first like butter, butterscotch and buttered popcorn. It tastes the same and comes with a soft, creamy texture and full body. On the second and third sips, however, flavors become more fruity, vivid and refreshing, showcasing peach, apricot and fig. Underlying crisp acidity works through the butteriness for good balance.
Name: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This crisp, tangy and refreshing wine has lemon and green-apple aromas, bright citrus flavors, medium body and a lean texture, due mostly to the generous acidity. Raw oysters on the half shell, garlic shrimp and goat-cheese toasts come to mind as good pairings.
Name: Onesta 2013 Bokisch Vineyard Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Gleason family and winemaker Ryan Deovlet deliver a tropically inclined wine, with warm aromas of ripe melons, candied apples, pineapple and cherimoya. The flavors are also round, with Golden Delicious apples, Meyer lemon, apricot and a touch of marzipan poking out from behind a fresh citrusy veil.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2012 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lemon-lime soda scents are rounded out by pineapple and a metallic element on the nose of this wine by Christian Roguenant. It's tight and minerally on the palate, with steel and gunmetal, yet shows green herbs like dill too. It will work well with white fish.
Name: Tangent 2013 Paragon Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a blend of Ciel du Cheval, Red Willow and Olsen vineyards, this appealing wine brings notes of pear, lemon twist and mineral. It's restrained in feel with notes of stone fruit and barrel spices.
Name: Mark Ryan 2013 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from Coyote Canyon in the Horse Heaven Hills, this wine offers aromas of honeysuckle and peach along with a light vanilla accent. It's full bodied and somewhat viscous in feel with abundant apricot flavors.
Name: Trinity Vineyards 2013 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This has an unusual profile, with notes of pear, lees, peach and almond spritzed with lime. The concentration isn't all there, flattening out on the back half.
Name: Vale 2012 Viognier

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A whiff of matchstick figures prominently on the nose in this intense white, which was stainless-steel fermented and aged. Nonetheless it takes on the taste of wood and preserved lemon, finishing on a bittersweet note.
Name: Praxis 2013 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This wine offers intriguing notes of peach, mango and spice. It's lighter in style with just off-dry fruit flavors that linger.
Name: Fujishin 2012 Viognier

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Notes of ash partner with white pepper, herbs and peach. This wine is very light in style without the concentration to stand it up.
Name: Fujishin 2013 Reserve Viognier

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A lovely 100% Viognier fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak, this wine opens with come-hither aromas of night-blooming jasmine and white flowers, evolving in the glass into a bright, viscous expression of honey and almond. Concentrated yet lively, it's a beautiful wine.
Name: Pride Mountain 2013 Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless-steel fermented and not put through malolactic, this is an immaculate, fragrant and rich Viognier, a showcase of peach, pear and melon fruit with sharp citrus highlights. Splendid aromatics, ripe and balanced fruit, and impressive length make this a standout.
Name: Penner-Ash 2013 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: John Jensen sources these grapes from his neighbor Ken Gimelli's vineyard just a mile away from the Calera estate in San Benito County. In this tribute to eiswein, the grapes are picked at modest sugars then frozen before processing, resulting in aromas of honey, dried apricot and a reduction sauce of honeydew, tuberose and lemonade. There's just enough acidity and grip on the liquid honey palate. It's altogether quite delicious and never cloying.
Name: Calera 2013 Doux Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This vineyard-designated Viognier is light and lithe in focused apricot and wet stone minerality. A wisp of a wine, it's light in texture and weight yet lingers memorably on the palate, with flavors of stone fruit and soft spice that carry through to the long finish.
Name: Anaba 2012 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the region's Rhône pioneers, this winery delivers aromas of chalk, cherimoya and white flowers on this bottling. It's very clean and crisp on the palate, with a sharp mineralogy and flavors of pear cider, lemon peel and lychee.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2013 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This fairly bursts with a luscious mix of tropical fruits. Pineapple, guava, starfruit, kiwi and more occupy center stage, leading into a creamy finish with suggestions of banana cream pie.
Name: Season 2013 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bien Nacido Vineyard actually planted this grape decades ago at Craig Jaffurs' request, and his mastery shows, with aromas balancing between sharper lime zest and riper white peach. There's lots of verve on the palate, yet the steely acidity is presented with medium brushstrokes rather than jabs, with flavors of poached pears, lime glaze and nectarine.
Name: Jaffurs 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine, which is enhanced with 6% Roussanne, is quite floral on the nose, with tuberose and stargazer lily trending toward ripe tropicality. The flavors are a little more subdued, with hints of guava jam on toasted brioche.
Name: J. Lohr 2013 Gesture Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: With an Artist Series label, this ripe and full-bodied wine blends two clones from different vineyards. It's both plush and piercing, a mix of nectarine, apricot and peach fruits, with a bit of butter to smooth the finish.
Name: Merrill Cellars 2013 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This spent 18 months in neutral American oak, and has a strong woody scent and flavor. Light melon and cucumber fruit remains somewhat buried, and the mouthfeel is soft and diffuse. Drink up.
Name: Merrill Cellars 2011 Reserve Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: This perfumey white dances in intense and creamy layers of stone fruit and vanilla, remaining vibrant and balanced from start to finish. The generous fruit is grown in the relatively cooler Oak Knoll section of the Napa Valley. This should develop further over time and in the glass.
Name: Darioush 2013 Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Opening with gorgeous aromas of pear, fig and mineral-laden melon and vanilla, this substantial Viognier also manages to stay fresh, vibrant and fruity, a bite of preserved lemon lifting off the finish.
Name: Whetstone 2012 Catie's Corner Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Treading between sharp citrus and the grape's more oily tendencies, this offers aromas of Lemonhead candy, honeysuckle and browned butter. The smoky flavors lean toward marshmallow and cooked peach, but the amazingly punchy acidity gives a long, vanilla-laced finish.
Name: Adelaida 2012 Anna's Estate Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatic offering has notes of pear, peach and flowers. The apricot and other stone fruit flavors are medium bodied, simultaneously light and rich, giving the perception of sweetness leading to a lingering finish—an elegantly styled wine that walks the balance beam quite well.
Name: William Church 2013 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a mineral-driven take on the grape by Westside Paso vintner Michael Gill, with sharp wet stone and grapefruit peel aromas. The palate is tightly wound and very fresh, with flavors of lime juice and lemon zest.
Name: Tuxedo Cellars 2013 Fleur de Xel Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Okanagan Valley, British Columbia, Canada
Description: Sharp upon entry, this has a concentration of citrus rind amid penetrating flavors of grapefruit, pineapple, orange and nectarine. The buoyant acidity keeps everything in proportion, with just a hint of bitterness at the edge of the finish.
Name: Black Hills 2013 Viognier (Okanagan Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Richly aromatic, this offers notes of honeysuckle, nectarine and vanilla (18% new oak). It's full bodied with abundant stone fruit flavors and light oak accents with a touch of bitterness on the finish.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2013 Love-Struck Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A light golden color, this richly aromatic wine brings notes of papaya, pineapple and brown sugar. It coats the palate with honeyed, ripe pear, apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink up.
Name: Vortex 2011 Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The slightly oxidized nose of this wine by Michael Gill recalls dried yet tart apricot skins with a bit of white peach freshness. The palate is framed by acidity while offering apple and lime flavors.
Name: Tuxedo Cellars 2012 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Floral jasmine opens this wine aromatically, followed by a bite of sweet, softly layered vanilla custard and honey. Restrained in sweetness, the layers go increasingly soft, ending smooth and creamy,
Name: Field Stone 2013 Staten Family Reserve Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A brilliant effort, this belongs right up there with the very best New World Viogniers. White flowers, lemon curd and a lush mix of citrus aromas show immense concentration right from the start. Both precise and dense, the scents and flavors flow through into a tightly wound, mineral-soaked finish, bright with citrus and apricot fruit. The length and concentration are simply spectacular.
Name: Cayuse 2012 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Aged just three months in French oak (28% new), the wine focuses on the fruit, with rich notes of apricot, pear and tangerine. It's full-bodied with sweet fruit flavors and a long, lingering, exquisitely fruit-filled finish.
Name: Cowhorn 2013 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Surprisingly smoky and toasty upfront, but balanced by ample apricot fruit and hints of honey, pineapple and citrus zest. Despite its ripe, oaky nature, there's plenty of crisp acidity to provide structure and prolong the finish. Drink now–2016.
Name: Gilles Flacher 2011 Les Rouelles  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tropical aromas of mango, banana and honeysuckle lead the nose on what first seems like a fruity wine. But then the palate is much more restrained, clean and mineral-driven, with steely flavors surrounding the remnant ripe plantain-like tropicality.
Name: Peachy Canyon 2013 Concrete Blanc Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The winery notes that this was done in an ice wine style—cryogenically—and it was done very well indeed. Pretty aromas show concentrated lemon and honey highlights. Once tasted, they carry through with flavors of orange marmalade, maple syrup and brown sugar. Sweet but not cloying, it's a slice of lemon pie in a glass.
Name: Apolloni 2012 Dolce Vino Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on Josh Jensen's latest vintage is expertly restrained, suggesting honey- and lemon-laced chamomile tea. The flavors are even and nicely arced, with tart lime moving into pear flesh and finishing with butter-scorched lemon and custard.
Name: Calera 2013 Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Subtle floral aromas lead to lean fruit and mineral flavors in this sophisticated, somewhat reserved wine. It has just enough restraint in flavor and crispness in balance to encourage another sip, and another. And those sips reveal more layers of tasty herb, Gruyère and white pepper.
Name: Casey Flat Ranch 2013 Estate Viognier (Capay Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Ripe flavors and a plush texture have not gone out of style in this opulent and tasty Viognier. Although not technically sweet, it has all these great dessert flavors: hazelnuts, toasted almonds and poached pears. The finish lasts 30 seconds or more.
Name: The White Knight 2013 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: In only a few years, this has become one of the northern Rhône's most reliable négociants. This wine features plenty of apricot, honey and melon nuances framed by caramel and cinnamon, with a long, spicy and honeyed finish. Drink now–2016.
Name: Maison Nicolas Perrin 2011  Condrieu

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery is aimed at the sexy side of wine, and succeeds in this bottling, with restrained aromas of nectarine, gunmetal, flint and strawberry guava. Tart yellow-green flavors of apple, pear and citrus give an edge to the persistent tropicality, which wipes up with a light vanilla finish. Perfect for fish dishes.
Name: LXV 2012 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a deep and concentrated white wine, ripely adorned in honey and apricot with a streak of honeysuckle dancing on the nose throughout. Creamy and round, it is buoyed by a fresh sprinkling of orange blossom and rind.
Name: Arrowood 2012 Saralee's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is a fine example of Viognier, exuding varietal characteristics of apricot and spice, plus a thick, viscous texture. It's a bit oily and finishes with a peppery blast of watercress. Drink up before the end of 2015.
Name: Domaine de Gournier 2013 Viognier (Cévennes)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: It's easy to enjoy the ripe pear, peach, vanilla and cream flavors in this extremely smooth, mellow Viognier. The texture is nice and rich, the body is full, the flavors just short of sweet and the finish lingers a long time.
Name: McManis 2013 Viognier (River Junction)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sea-salt caramel candies, white flowers, peach sorbet and squeezed lime swirl into a very promising nose on this wine. It's lighter bodied and bouncy on the palate once sipped, with nice minerality, but the tropical lemonade fruit may be a tad too strong for some.
Name: Black Ridge 2012 Estate Grown Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: There's a faint hint of pink in the color of this bright, cheery, light and appetizing wine. It combines flashes of crisp green apple with ripe pear, golden cherry and white peach for a cornucopia of delicious fruit flavor.
Name: Bonterra 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Touches of salt and stone combine with a subdued peach character on the nose of this wine from a new estate in Paso Robles. The palate plays toward the acid side of the varietal's equation, with lemon candy and bitterness standing up to the white peach flesh.
Name: Brecon Estate 2013 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine from the recently approved El Pomar District is tropically perfumed with lychee candy and a hint of passionfruit. Bouncy acidity on the front of the palate leads into red apple fruit and citrus skin bitterness, and wipes up with a zing on the palate.
Name: Pomar Junction 2013 Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This wine displays reticent notes of acacia blossom and apricot, with bountiful white pepper. It's medium bodied and a bit viscous in texture, then develops a spicy, mouth-tingling finish. Drink through 2016.
Name: Delas Frères 2011 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very intriguing notes of candied ginger, ash tree pulp and salted apricot prove rather mesmerizing on this wine. The flavors span apple, lime and ginger-honey tea, with a slightly vanilla finish.
Name: Galante 2013 Estate Bottled Viognier (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: The aromas are a bit overpowering, with distinct ruby red grapefruit, lychee and cherimoya. The perfumed flavors are far more reserved, with guava flesh and grapefruit pith on the end.
Name: Callaway 2012 Special Selection Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A pungent perfume of peach arises from this wine, but a flinty character keeps it grounded. The energetic peach-lemonade palate straddles the tension between acidity and rather present tannins for a white wine.
Name: Robert Hall 2013 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's Riesling-like petrol to the nose of this wine, as well as aromas familiar to sparkling wines like sour yeast, nectarine and pear. It's intriguing once sipped, tending toward rubber and gas, with a touch of sour lemon.
Name: Black Ridge 2011 Estate Grown Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Made by the pro golfer, the wine comes from the small amount of Viognier in this historic vineyard. The nose promises big, with seared ginger, stone fruit and barrel-smoke aromas. But the palate is less exciting, albeit with pleasant grilled nectarine and mineral elements.
Name: Luke Donald 2012 Sanford & Benedict Single Vineyard Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A rich and perfumed honeysuckle character picks up bubblegum on the sweet-leaning nose. It slips toward flatness on the palate, with smoked peach and more bubblegum saying short hellos.
Name: Workman Ayer 2013 Ipso Facto Viognier (Central Coast)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Soft in texture and floral in aroma, this soothing wine should quiet down spicy food or make a nice, calming cocktail before dinner. It's medium bodied, with unobtrusive mixed tropical- and stone-fruit flavors.
Name: Oak Grove 2013 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose is imprecise, jumping from yellow flowers to apple juice, and requiring quite an effort to get that much. Pear skin flavors emerge on the palate, which has a decent tartness but is washed out a bit by the high alcohol. Still a nice table wine, though.
Name: Dubost 2013 Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Flat peach aromas introduce a chunky, grabby palate with flavors of baked apple, brine and walnut.
Name: DiamAndes 2013 de Uco Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Winemaker Mark McNeilly from Mark Ryan Winery makes this estate grown Viognier, and works it in the same strong, substantial, concentrated style as his own release. The mix of concrete and neutral oak fermentation brings out some nice floral highlights and a light hint of toast. The length and flavor development through the long finish are exceptional.
Name: Force Majeure 2012 Collaboration Series Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Abundant flavors combine with a plush texture to make a wine that slowly builds interest from the first sniff to the lingering aftertaste. Hints of vanilla and honeysuckle enhance the vivid apricot flavors, lasting long on the viscous palate and through the finish.
Name: Rock Wall 2013 Kristen's Cuvee Viognier (California)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nicely rounded pear aromas surround lemon-lime soda and honey in the center of the nose on this refreshing, cooler-climate Viognier, which offers very pleasant flavors of peach and citrus rind. It's light-bodied and very easy going down.
Name: Anglim 2012 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Aromas of white peach and vanilla highlight this rich-textured, rather full-bodied white wine. It's made in a generous rather than crisp style, as if it were barrel fermented, and a buttery lushness defines it more than the fairly subtle fruit flavors. Very tasty overall.
Name: Four Fields 2012 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The Black Eyed Peas' singer Fergie and renowned winemaker Joey Tensley present an in-your-face Viognier, deeply yellow, nearing brown in color, with aromas of dried apricot, honey-roasted nuts and smoky mezcal with lime. Lush flavors of burnt orange peel, smoke and Scotch whisky make for an intriguing drink, certainly not for those seeking a dainty white wine.
Name: Ferguson Crest 2010 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic wine with notes of creamsicle and orange blossom. It's medium bodied with well delineated stone fruit flavors and a lick of tart acidity that seems surprising for the variety and vintage.
Name: Milbrandt 2013 The Estates Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Dry and full-bodied, this structured version of Viognier has subtle fruit aromas of melon and peach, flavors accented by oak and vanilla, a firm texture and clean finish. A substantial white wine, it should pair well with seafood, light meat dishes and creamy sauces.
Name: Sobon Estate 2013 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Perfumed and rich, this wine gives a ripe fruit feel. Hints of green fruits marry with spice and touches of apricot, even honey. The end is crisp, clean and full.
Name: Château Routas 2013 Routas Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: Ripe and aromatic, this encapsulates the Viognier so well. Classic apricot flavors are enhanced by a smoky, wood-aging character, rich almonds and warm acidity. It's a well-composed wine, now ready to drink.
Name: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2011 Madrigal Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An aromatic offering with notes of pear, melon and ripe banana. The oak (85% French, 15% stainless steel) adds vanilla accents. It drinks close to dry with abundant melon flavors and a textured feel.
Designation: Prayer Rock Vineyards Noah's & Jezreel Bloc
Name: Reustle 2013 Prayer Rock Vineyards Noah's & Jezreel Bloc Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An intriguing wine with notes of dried apricot, lees and honeycomb. The throttle is pulled back in terms of feel while it still possesses a lot of richness to the fruit flavors and an impressively long finish.
Name: Valley View 2012 Anna Maria Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this is aromatic, with notes of ripe peach, melon and honeysuckle. It's full bodied, somewhat viscous in feel, carrying considerable alcoholic warmth.
Name: Abacela 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This smells flowery but also flabby and oily. The palate has a creamy, tropical feel to it and flavors of melon, papaya and powdered sugar. A soft, lightly bitter-tasting finish could use more pop, scour and balance.
Name: Bodega Atamisque 2013 Serbal Viognier (Tupungato)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This puff-pastry of a wine has a vivid gold color, enticing bread-dough aromas and lush texture. Ripe peach and honey flavors are layered with butterscotch and mineral notes that lead to a lingering finish. Full-boded, well-balanced and delightful.
Name: Sol Rouge 2012 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As usual, this was sourced entirely from a small block in the Dineen vineyard. Fragrant with a mélange of lemony aromas, the flavors carry the same theme—lemon gelato, lemon pie, limoncello, all buoyed with perfect acidity. It's a vivid, clean, long-lasting wine.
Name: Stevens 2013 StevensDivio Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though coming from the warm 2013 vintage, this wine still retains its balance with notes of peach, mango and crushed granite. It's light and airy in style for a Washington Viognier without sacrificing flavor or length.
Name: Gramercy 2013 Antoine Creek Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a block selection from the vineyard, fermented with wild yeast and aged sur lie for 12 months. A beguiling mix of lemon and lime, along with a light herbal impression of lemon verbena, it shows excellent depth and length, all within a perfectly ripened and balanced wine. Great style and verve.
Designation: Elephant Mountain Vineyard Block 1 Wild Yeast Fermented
Name: Ott & Murphy 2012 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Block 1 Wild Yeast Fermented Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp melons, yellow flowers, banana candy, toasty oak and honey converge for a very pleasing and inviting nose on this wine from an estate vineyard. The palate is even and lively, with citrus rind, lemon curd and peach flavors, finishing with an appealing sense of smokiness.
Name: Fess Parker 2012 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This may not be minerally or long-lived, but it represents an approach that should win Viognier more fans. It's gingery and floral on the nose, round and rich in the mouth without becoming oily, and it boasts enough pear and melon fruit to carry it through to a long, mouthwatering finish. Drink 2015.
Name: Michel Gassier 2013 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This super-smooth late harvest effort is perfectly balanced among sugar/alcohol/acid components. Lively and rich, it offers concentrated flavors of limoncello, apricot and candied peaches. Drink it chilled for best effect.
Name: Stevens 2012 StevensSweets Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Gard, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A terrific value in Viognier, this is full bodied and lushly textured while carrying the variety's hallmark tropical fruit aromas and flavors. It's flashy and bold, probably at its best now and into the first quarter of 2015.
Name: Domaine des Cantarelles 2012 Viognier (Vin de Pays du Gard)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A subtle style of Viognier, this has body and presence without overt fruit flavors. It soothes the palate with a creamy viscosity. Modest apple and mineral flavors interact with crisp acidity for a low-key, reserved and well-mannered personality.
Name: Naggiar 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: White flowers and a red apple candy reveal themselves on the nose, but the strongest aromas convey a concentrated pear-peach perfume. The palate is dominated by apple at first, but grapefruit carries the midpalate and finish, which shows good acidity and a bit of grip as well.
Name: San Simeon 2013 Sran Vineyard Estate Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Partially fermented on French oak staves, this does express itself with some toasty aromatics, but well-defined and nicely balanced. The fruit offers ripe, mixed flavors of lemon, lime and pineapple, with juicy acidity, no bitterness and impressive length.
Name: Maryhill 2013 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Vivid fruit flavors light up this extroverted Viognier, starting in the aroma and lasting through the long finish. It tastes like apricot, orange, pineapple, vanilla and cream. Good acidity keeps it lively and fresh, balancing the full body.
Name: Cedar View Winery 2013 Reserve Viognier (California)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic wine with notes of banana, dripping ripe peach and cantaloupe. Stainless-steel fermented and aged, it's fresh and flavorful with a creamy feel. It drinks drier than the residual sugar (3g/L) might indicate.
Name: Mercer 2013 Culloden Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This brings an intriguing assortment of dried fruit including pear, spiced apple and apricot. It drinks off dry, with abundant stone fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
Name: Tsillan 2013 Estate Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A clean, fresh wine, this opens with crisply varietal aromatics of citrus and orange blossom. The flavors follow suit, adding some fresh-cut pineapple as well; then the wine hits a wall and simply pulls up short.
Name: Columbia Winery 2013 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Patient sniffing allows melon and stone fruit to emerge from this relatively weak nose for the usually aromatic Viognier. More happens on the palate, with guava tropicality and pear sauce, but it's definitely a lighter style of Viognier.
Name: Fess Parker 2012 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Orange marmalade, lemon meringue and warm melon aromas open this wine from the cool Templeton Gap area southeast of Paso Robles. The flavors show off the brighter elements of the grape, with caramelized pear giving way to slate in the midpalate and a nicely bitter finish of orange peel.
Name: Sensorium 2012 MdR Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Steely, it bursts with wet stone, jasmine and lemon aromas, the body quite full yet mellowed by effervescent minerality. Highlights include layers of melon and pear. It would pair well with citrus-based salads or meats seasoned with citrus zest.
Name: Imagery 2013 Pratt Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and brigh, it comes from tSanta Barbara County grape-growing pioneer Louis Lucas. Aromas of orange juice, passionfruit and sugared grapefruit peel create a strong introduction. On the floral-laced palate, pear cider and night jasmine flavors make for a solid sipper if not particularly complex.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2013 Estate Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Floral and pretty in ripe peach and pineapple/mango, it unwinds with a finish of vanilla.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite pale, it offers fresh scents of limeade and honey on the nose, yet it is surprisingly viscous on the palate, where more honey teams with guava. A tiny bit of chalkiness stops it from being cloying. Pair with pan-fried trout or poached salmon.
Name: Tolosa 2013 Tolsosa Vineyard Estate Viognier (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, toasted almonds and lemon slushie aromas are present on the nose of this Viognier from the El Pomar district. A very smoky element on the palate is a bit overbearing alongside the caramel, vanilla and other oak-driven flavors.
Name: Still Waters 2012 Viognier (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 100% Viognier that's heady in ripe pit fruit, mostly sweet peach, and accented in nutty, floral aromas. It's full-bodied and  robust, with tannins that are soft and juicy.
Name: Novy 2013 Sunny View Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Fermented in stainless steel, this medium-bodied wine is supple in nutty pear and fig, as well as viscous in honey. Serve chilled with chicken-lemongrass banh mi.
Name: Wattle Creek 2012 Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Despite being barrel fermented and matured, this Condrieu retains a remarkable amount of varietal character in its flamboyantly floral and spicy aromas. It's full bodied, broad and richly textured, yet avoids any sense of heaviness, finishing on hints of honey and white pepper. Drink now–2020.
Name: E. Guigal 2010 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Carmel Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boasting a distinct aroma of both roasted and candied walnuts, this Viognier is probably best suited for those who love California Chardonnay. The palate is luxuriously soft, delivering peach and toasted oak on the midpalate and vanilla on the finish, but the acidity is perfectly incorporated throughout.
Name: Boekenoogen 2012 Bell Ranch Estate Viognier (Carmel Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Jaboulet's Condrieu program takes a huge step forward with this release, which artfully combines barrel fermentation and aging with just-ripe Viognier into a compelling and cohesive whole. The toast and baking-spice elements provide the right amount of restraint to the tropical fruit notes, which then finish with tremendous, mouthwatering length. Drink now–2020.
Name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2010 Domaine de Grands Amandiers  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Despite this wine's ample weight and lush texture, it doesn't come across as heavy. Instead, smooth waves of luxuriously honeyed apricot flavors glide by, accented by hints of white pepper. Drink it over the next year or two.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2011  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Despite showing a relatively dark straw hue, this wine is fresh and floral on the nose. The full-bodied palate is lushly textured, showing amply concentrated melon and apricot fruit and a dusting of white pepper. Drink it over the next year or two.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2010 Les Archevêques  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Less flamboyant than the 2010, this is still an excellent wine. It's full bodied, rich and broad on the palate, delivering layers of honeyed apricot and citrus that finish warm, with a hint of caramel. Drink it over the next couple of years.
Name: E. Guigal 2011 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This full-bodied wine packs in everything you'd expect from Condrieu. Floral aromas? Check. Apricot fruit? Check. Richness balanced by minerality? Check. The lively finish, accented by white pepper, is particularly noteworthy. Drink now–2016.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2011 Le Chambée  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Calitzdorp, South Africa
Description: Winemaker: Carel Nel. This sweet selection opens with immediately attractive aromas of apricot, peach, honeysuckle and ginger. The palate is round but not overly flabby, complemented by ripe fruit flavors and a rich orange oil note on the lingering finish. Drink now–2016.
Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Ouma Cloete Straw Wine
Name: Boplaas 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild Ouma Cloete Straw Wine Viognier (Calitzdorp)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Honeyed but otherwise not overly aromatic, this full-bodied, corpulent Condrieu still provides enjoyable drinking. The weighty notes of honeyed citrus linger on the finish, but drink up over the next six months or so.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2009 Les Archevêques  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Ciel du Cheval—one of Washington's top vineyards—now has its own wine label, and this lush Viognier is the first release. A rich array of fruit runs from orange peel and pineapple into more tropical flavors of guava and mango. It was whole-cluster pressed, and the skin flavors add grip to the finish.
Name: Côtes de Ciel 2012 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Reasonably priced for Condrieu, this full-bodied, lushly textured example reveals subtle toast, honey and spice shadings on the nose. On the palate, touches of orange marmalade or apricot preserves come through, accented by white pepper and clove and on the finish. Drink this over the next year.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2010  Condrieu

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Kicking off with a tight nose of lemongrass and limestone, this is a Viognier for fans of Sauvignon Blanc. It keeps a razor-sharp focus on the palate, with tart apple flavors and zesty acidity that wipes the flavors clean rather quickly, but it verges ever so slightly towards a hint of tropical papaya.
Name: Zaca Mesa 2012 Zaca Mesa Vineyard Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Only the faint smell of grass emerges from this wine, but the palate is another story, with fresh squeezed lime and brisk nectarine flavors. The mouthfeel starts rich and then zips up tight with nice acidity. This vibrant wine needs food that's both rich and exotic, so try Chinese or Indonesian.
Name: Rideau 2012 Reserve Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is a ripe, tropical-fruit-laden Condrieu, one that's full bodied yet not particularly rich in texture. Banana, melon and apricot preserves abound, making it a mouthfilling but not overly complex wine. It finishes with a touch of alcoholic warmth, so drink it over the next few months.
Name: M. Chapoutier 2010 Invitare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel and blended with 25% Roussanne, it's aromatically pretty with notes of honeysuckle and ripe peach. It drinks full bodied and dry, with a tart finish.
Name: Cave B 2013 Cave B Estate Vineyards Viognier (Ancient Lakes)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: In its flight, this medium-bodied wine was relatively restrained. While it delivers honeyed tropical and citrus fruits on the nose, the flavors are of melon and citrus, which fade quickly on the finish.
Name: M. Chapoutier 2011 Invitare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This full-bodied wine shows evidence of oak maturation in its notes of light toast and baking spices. Those elements are supported by pleasant citrus flavors, but the result isn't completely convincing.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2010 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Inviting in honeysuckle and tingling acidity, this wine is crisp, medium-bodied and complex, tasting lighter than it is. Silky in texture, it's one to enjoy on its own or with something buttery and creamy, like lobster or crab.
Name: Kobler 2013 Kobler Family Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral in honey and citrus, this highly aromatic Viognier is grown in decomposed granite soils. A delightful blend of fresh, fleshy apricot fruit and highly attuned acidity, it's light and refreshing, imparting stony characteristics. The reserve is given more time in barrel than the regular bottling, though most of it not new.
Name: Terre Rouge 2012 Reserve Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The earlier release of Terre Rouge's two Viogniers, this one, in screwcap, is clearly the friendlier and more immediately accessible. It shows a pretty, fruity personality exuberant in almond, apricot and high acidity. Crisp, like a Sauvignon Blanc, it manifests its granitic beginnings in tasty ways.
Name: Terre Rouge 2012 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Sonoma Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Whole-cluster pressed and aged in barrel and stainless steel, this is fruity in ripe apricot and pear. It's medium-bodied, meaty but not overdone, with zingy acidity. More creamy than crisp, it lingers on the tongue and makes for a good food wine.
Name: Anaba 2011 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: This has a powdery nose and melony, tropical fruit aromas. The mouthfeel is pleasant and round, with vital acidity. Flavors of baked apple, buttercup and briny apricot finish smooth, with a pinch of salt.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2013 La Joya Gran Reserva Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Tejo, Portugal
Description: Yellow fruits and fresh aromas characterize this attractive, fresh wine. With a touch of citrus to add to the bright character, it's a fruity wine that can be drunk now–2017.
Name: Casal do Conde 2013 Viognier (Tejo)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Exhaling honey-vanilla in the glass, it gives off a hint of sweetness on the quick finish. Midpalate, expect fleshy apricot and white peach flavors. Enjoy on a summer's day with spicy peanuts.
Name: Hansen Cellars 2011 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Dark golden in color, this wine offers nectarine and just-ripe apple. High in acidity, medium in body, it has a trace of sourness on the finish.
Name: Peirano 2012 The Heritage Collection Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A combination of sweet, hot and puckering, it has a pronounced aroma akin to applesauce. At 16.5% alcohol it may be honest but it's also overdone.
Name: Fleur de Lys 2011 Estate Viognier (Fair Play)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Simply sensational, this estate-grown Viognier raises the bar for everyone. It's a glorious mesh of citrus flesh and rind, elevated with spicy highlights of orange, tangerine and Meyer lemon. Outstanding concentration, focus and depth, with juicy acidity underlying an astonishing finish.
Name: Abeja 2012 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A flood of delicious, sweet/sour floral and citrus flavors sweeps across the palate, a lush compound of satsuma orange and highlights of honeysuckle, Meyer lemon and apricot. It's a tart and vivid wine, with lovely concentration and no rough edges.
Name: Novelty Hill 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This satiny, slightly waxy Viognier is a blend from Ciel du Cheval, Red Willow and Olsen fruit; for the first time, roughly 10% was fermented in a concrete egg. Aromatic with yellow apples, lemon curd, bee pollen and floral highlights, it's underscored with a lick of wet stone.
Name: Mark Ryan 2012 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are surprisingly light for the variety with notes of ripe pear and peach. It's full bodied with sweet fruit flavors and a rounded, creamy feel leading to a warm finish.
Name: Jones of Washington 2013 Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Eilandia, South Africa
Description: A rich and smoky Viognier, this opens with aromas of grilled yellow peach, melon and orange oil. The palate offers flavors of toasted brioche and almond to complement the ripe fruit core. Drink now.
Name: Bon Cap 2010 Made with Organically Grown Grapes Viognier (Eilandia)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: Soft scents of just-dried hay, yellow apple and white melon unfold with great intensity on the bright palate. Balanced and refreshing, with an attractive mango flavor on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Flagstone 2012 The Rumor Mill Viognier (Western Cape)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A vibrantly aromatic wine with notes of dried apricot and fresh flowers. It's full bodied, weighty in feel with the flavor concentration dissipating toward the warm finish.
Name: Telaya 2012 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wellington, South Africa
Description: It strikes an interesting balance between toasty notes of nuts and baking spices and earthy hints of white flowers and fresh herbs, all supporting the yellow apple and pear core. Additional tropical-fruit flavors unfold on the palate and stay through the finish. Drink up.
Name: Diemersfontein 2010 Reserve Viognier (Wellington)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: A white partner for the top Lagrezette red cuvée of Le Pigeonnier, this wine, which is made from grapes grown on chalky soils, has rich tropical, apricot and peach fruits, along with balanced wood aging flavors. It is rich and full in the mouth, making it a serious wine with a serious future. It's fruity now, but likely to develop many more complex flavors with time. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2012 Le Pigeonnier White Vision Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Coming from a single block of the winery's estate vineyard, this 100% varietal wine provides a magic trick. The sweet, full-bodied white peach, honeysuckle and vanilla aromas and flavors do not show any of the oiliness or excess alcohol that might be expected at this level of ripeness. Instead, it's all flavor, showing remarkable depth and concentration that persists through the last sip.
Name: Cowhorn 2012 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: Made from Viognier grown in the Gaillac region, this is a rich wine with tropical and yellow fruit flavors. The wood aging shows gently through the fresh fruit and attractive acidity. The wine is ready to drink, but will improve until 2018.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2012 Mas des Merveilles Viognier (Côtes du Lot)

Appellation: Tejo, Portugal
Description: A smattering of oak flavors rounds out this naturally warm and tropical fruit flavored wine. It is rich, smooth and opulent in texture, delicious already, but really needing until 2015 to age.
Name: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Falcoaria Viognier (Tejo)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Generous, sweetly perfumed aromas of melon and lemon oil lead into a wine with precision and penetration. Spicy, candied ginger complements the citrus and tropical fruit, and barrel fermentation gives it a gently buttery mouthfeel.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2012 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This limited-production Viognier reflects the ripeness of the 2012 vintage. Immediately appealing, it coats the tongue with thick, peachy/tropical fruit flavors. A hint of saline cracker comes through as well. It's front-loaded, fruit-driven, and drinking at its prime.
Name: Helix by Reininger 2012 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharply-defined flavors highlighted with citrus skin and rind introduce this wine. It's loaded with gin-like botanicals, lemon oil and orange peel, with high-toned assertiveness through the finish.
Name: DaMa 2012 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though aged in just 20% new French oak, the wood still seems out front on this otherwise enjoyable wine that brings prominent notes of vanilla along with pear and peach. It's medium bodied in feel and avoids seeming oily or overblown, with a tart, citrusy finish.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 The Estates Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Vista Flores, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Light, clean, fresh aromas of tropical fruits and lychee resemble those of a Torrontés. The palate is light and mild, while flavors of melon, lychee and citrus pith are forward but don't come with a lot of backing or complexity.
Name: Mil Piedras 2013 Viognier (Vista Flores)

Appellation: Langhe, Piedmont, Italy
Description: This 100% Viognier from Piedmont reveals fragrances of white flowers, oak and aromatic herbs. The palate is dominated by oak accompanied by notes of sage, thyme, citrus and fennel. It lacks fruit richness. Saranty Imports, Pleasure Elite.
Name: Mauro Sebaste 2012 Centobricchi Viognier (Langhe)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: A lightly aromatic wine with notes of peach, melon, and toasted grapenuts. It drinks off dry, but lacks the stitching to hold it all together.
Name: Colter's Creek 2012 Viognier

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Medium-bodied with a trace of vanilla-honey, this is a round, mouth filling white that that's viscous and rich on the palate, finishing in layers of tropical fruit.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2012 Viognier (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Tupungato, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of briny citrus and resiny oak don't blend together well. In the mouth, this oaky Viognier is grabby and resiny, with bitter green-fruit flavors. The finish is pithy with hard green notes.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2012 Reserve Viognier (Tupungato)

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: Tannins and acidity exhibit a high level of teamwork in this smooth, mouth-pleasing wine. Aromas of lemon, white pepper and vanilla give way to flavors of lemon-lime, bergamot and vanilla custard. The finish is simultaneously lingering and bright.
Name: Galil Mountain 2012 Yiron Vineyard Viognier (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Danube River Plains, Bulgaria
Description: Enticing aromas of pineapple, orange zest, just-picked apricot and freesia lead the way for clean flavors of tangerine, yellow peach and freshly sliced pineapple on the palate. It's fruit forward, with great minerality.
Name: Chateau Burgozone 2012 Viognier (Danube River Plains)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Maderized in color, this Viognier shows powdery aromas of lychee and tropical fruits. The body is round, plump and soft, while flavors of pear, almond paste, lychee and chemical turn more flat and bitter the longer this sits.
Name: Sottano 2013 Reserva 3S Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The most floral and lemony of Charles Smith's trio of Viogniers, this received extra time in barrel, yielding a more Burgundian mouthfeel—rich and creamy. Just 10% saw new oak, which seems to be exactly right, adding a hint of toast without clobbering the floral subtleties.
Name: Charles Smith 2011 Lawrence Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced entirely from the Sagemoor vineyard, this richly endowed Viognier smothers the palate in a lush mix of fat, candied citrus and tropical fruits. Honeysuckle and orange pekoe tea flavors trickle into the lingering, lip-smacking finish.
Name: Tamarack Cellars 2012 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This brings bracing minerality into the forefront, in a terroir-driven wine with excellent penetration and depth. A fresh mix of citrus and stone, this elevates Viognier into the top echelons of Washington white wines.
Name: Charles Smith 2012 Stoneridge Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Now one of three Viogniers produced by Charles Smith, this is from Art den Hoed's Yakima Valley Vineyard, and was barrel fermented in neutral French oak. Clean and pure fruit aromas lead into fresh, natural, tree fruit flavors of peach and apricot. There's a nice kick of citrus in the vibrant acidity.
Name: K Vintners 2012 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The 8% splash of Roussanne in this blend, contributes to the lovely complexity of the opening aromas. Sweet citrus, honey and tea flavors combine, while keeping the palate light and focused. Complex hints of lemon meringue, vanilla cream and toasted coconut keep it lively and interesting through to the finish.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2012 Love-Struck Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is bone dry, with a tongue-tickling minerality underscoring floral highlights. The honeyed fruit flavors focus around peaches, with good length and a clean, fresh finish with gin-like, botanical complexity.
Name: Stottle 2012 Elerding Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: At first a bit sharp and volatile, this has both substantial residual sugar (50 g/L) and significant alcohol for a late harvest wine. It's spicy and lightly honeyed, and opens nicely into a mix of candied pear and pineapple fruit, with streaks of vanilla running through.
Name: Stottle 2012 Lucille Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: While forward with stonefruit and honey, along with toasty oak and vanilla notes, this is a structured Viognier that's crisp and fresh. Drink with Thai food or buttery lobster.
Name: Miraflores 2012 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine was fermented half in stainless steel and half in neutral oak, and did not undergo malolactic fermentation. The result is a textured, rich explosion of honeysuckle, spice and lemon zest flavors that finishes with a minerally, flinty character.
Name: Stark 2012 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Dusty, smooth aromas of spiced apple are easy to like. This is sticky, with just enough acidity to maintain freshness. Flavors of peach, honey and nutmeg are sweet and spicy, while the finish is upright and feels lively.
Name: Anakena 2012 Late Harvest Viognier (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: Standard on the nose, with apple, pear and spice aromas, this is a fruity Viognier with sweet flavors of peach and nectarine in front of a finish that starts out juicy but falls off quickly. Expect lots of sweet, basic white-fruit character from this warm-vintage wine.
Name: Anakena 2012 Tama Vineyard Selection Viognier (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from Viognier, this wine has apricot and spice aromas. The palate delivers yellow peach, citrus and honey notes and has a dry, nutty finish. Pair this with lobster and mildly seasoned fish dishes.
Name: Terre di Talamo 2012 Vento Teso Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This vintage marks a welcome return of Viognier to the otherwise all-red Cayuse portfolio. It's an immaculate, elegant, complex wine, redolent of wet stone, dried herbs (thyme, rosemary), jicama, cucumber, lime, grapefruit, melon and more. It is clear and clean, precise and focused. It does not push the ripeness, or overshoot the cool vintage, and never sacrifices complexity. Fermented and aged in a concrete egg, it's seen no oak at all.
Name: Cayuse 2011 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: White flowers, honey, melon and ham aromas are true to the variety and welcoming. This feels round and generous, with a lot of ripeness to the body and flavor profile, which includes papaya, melon and spice elements. A melony, honeyed finish is bold and ready.
Name: Viu Manent 2012 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Viognier from the Stillwater Creek Vineyard, this is a firm, phenolic wine showing sharp-edged flavors of citrus skin and apricot. There's some bite to the finish, suggesting it will work best paired with meatier fish, or perhaps a spicy noodle dish.
Name: JM Cellars 2012 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is pure Viognier, finishing in a moderately sweet, dessert-friendly style. There is a candied sensation to the mouthfeel, and the fruit seems rather thin. Light flavors of orange pekoe carry into a gentle finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2012 Reserve Late Harvest Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents and flavors of toasted grain introduce this pretty wine that boasts accents of citrus blossom. Hints of peach skin carry some bite in the back of the mouth. Serve chilled and drink soon.
Name: Garofalo 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Cachapoal Valley, Chile
Description: This heavy, mostly fruitless Viognier is pithy, chunky and ultimately briny and green on the finish. And there's bitterness to deal with as well.
Name: Anakena 2011 Tama Vineyard Selection Viognier (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: An über aromatic wine with ripe peach, white flowers, and tropical notes. It's full bodied and richly flavored, with a lingering finish.
Name: Spangler 2012 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a very pure expression of Viognier—single vineyard (Del Rio) and single clone (Clone 1), aged five months in stainless steel. It's vibrantly aromatic with notes of lime leaf, ripe peach and flowers with an unctuous feel and a tart finish.
Name: Edwin Dyer 2012 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: An aromatic offering with notes of pear, peach and flowers. The lack of malolactic fermentation freshens up the feel while a touch of residual sugar sweetens the finish. Drinks best slightly chilled.
Name: Cinder 2012 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This Viognier is loaded with honey, apricot and ripe fig. It's a well made, full bodied and substantial white wine, ready for buttery sauces.
Name: Cycles Gladiator 2012 Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is a deliciously easygoing Viognier bright with fresh apricot flavor, high in acidity and a finish of lemon-lime. Enjoy on its own or with spicy Thai or Vietnamese food.
Name: Bonterra 2012 Made With Organic Grapes Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Apple and nectarine aromas are generic but fruity. This Viognier is cut by firm acidity and thus is fresh in the mouth, with lime, green apple and some bitterness to the flavor profile. A chalky feeling finish is green and citrusy in flavor.
Name: La Playa 2012 Estate Series Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: California, California Other, California, US
Description: Much of the fruit for this Viognier was estate-grown, then cold-fermented in stainless steel to retain its ripe stone-fruit flavors. The undercurrent is all caramel, with a lush finish reflecting the ripeness of the grapes.
Name: McManis 2012 Viognier (California)

Appellation: Toscana, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This Viognier from Tuscany opens with enticing aromas of peach, apricot and mineral. However the palate is lean and linear and while fresh, it lacks fruit richness.
Name: Castello di Poppiano 2012 Camposegreto Viognier (Toscana)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a knife-sharp Viognier, offering precise, chiseled flavors of citrus rind, Meyer lemon and grapefruit. The piercing acidity belies a wine whose flavors are fully ripe, and deliver an extended, mineral-drenched finish.
Name: Burnt Bridge 2012 Les Collines Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This pure, single vineyard Viognier enters the mouth rather soft and silky, with well-structured flavors of cantaloupe melon, grapefruit and pineapple. It shows good concentration, focus and length, and will age nicely for another five or six years.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2011 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This is a fresh and vibrant wine, with upfront aromas of ripe peach, melon and Anjou pear all accented by hints of white florals and orange blossom. Lightweight, with an approachable, fruit-forward palate and a crisp, clean finish. Drink now.
Name: Penya 2012 Viognier (Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Opening with a pretty honeysuckle nose, this Viognier is completely in balance, with layers of lime and pineapple and restrained weight. Enjoy with Thai papaya salad or ceviche.
Name: Legendre 2012 Tumbas Vineyard Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: A widely found Viognier that's tasty and well-tempered, easy-drinking in its lovely peach and pineapple fruit tones. Flavorful and weighty, enjoy this wine with Thai food or spicy pork enchiladas.
Name: Cline 2012 Viognier (North Coast)

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This Viognier is rich in jasmine aromas, softly hued and textured, with flavors of honey and pear. Bright in acidity, this is inviting in every way.
Name: Mineral Wines 2010 Viognier (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Tejo, Portugal
Description: This floral, apricot and peach-flavored wine is ripe and full in the mouth. It has fine acidity to balance this perfumed character. Lively, fresh and ready to drink.
Name: Casal do Conde 2012 Viognier (Tejo)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The notes of peach and flowers are light and contrast with the palate's weight and oily feel. It's enjoyable but an alcoholic burn on the finish distracts.
Name: Folin Cellars 2012 Folin Vineyards Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Light to the point of being a bit dilute, this Viognier has a cotton-candy character, like spun sugar around rhubarb. The tart, not quite fully ripe fruit brings it to a quick, acidic finish.
Name: Emerson 2012 Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: DiamAndes continues to put out clunky Viogniers from the Uco Valley. This is bland and waxy on the nose, with notes of green melon and nectarine. The palate is round and full but lacks personality, while flavors of papaya and melon are heavy and finish yeasty.
Name: DiamAndes 2012 de Uco Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here's the latest in a long line of smooth, silky, fruit-laden Viogniers from Mark Ryan. Citrus and lemongrass roll into fleshier flavors of tree fruits. One month in neutral oak rounds out the mouthfeel, and the mix of vineyards—Ciel du Cheval, Red Willow and Olsen—is terrific.
Name: Mark Ryan 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is a smooth and supple Viognier, with a dynamic mix of citrus and tropical fruits. It's well-proportioned, and the phenolic edge to the skin flavors gives nice structure to the finish.
Name: àMaurice 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier remains a strong suit for William Church, and part of the consistency is the vineyard sourcing each vintage from Conner Lee and Gamache, in roughly equal proportions. Lemon and lime, peaches and apricots rule the palate, ripe but neither hot nor bitter. There's a good long finish as well, but it's the fruit that really shines.
Name: William Church 2012 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The aromas are light for a Viognier, with notes of flowers, herbs and peach. Still, it brings a lot of appeal, with broad fruit flavors accented by residual sugar (0.4%), showing a bit of heat on the finish.
Name: Season 2012 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This estate-grown Viognier was whole-cluster pressed and barrel-fermented in neutral French oak with no malolactic fermentation, giving it a fresh and fruity personality amid a creamy core of honey, pear and fig. On the finish is a layer of pineapple and lime, giving it a refreshing finish just right for a plate of butter-smeared lobster.
Name: Campovida 2011 Estate Riserva Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Named after the blending of Steelhead Run and Ox vineyard blocks, this appealing wine is fresh and varietal with notes of ripe peach and herbs. Aged six months in stainless steel and coming in at a low 12% alcohol, the fruit concentration is lighter in style but still offers enjoyment.
Name: Quady North 2011 Steel-Ox Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Cinder makes two versions of this wine each year—one dry and one off-dry. This dry wine is medium-plus bodied, with notes of lemon, white flowers and white peach accompanying an oily feel.
Name: Cinder 2011 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Mild citrus, bath oil and tropical fruit aromas set up a citrusy palate with good but pithy flavors of orange, grapefruit and lime. Unlike French Viognier, this is distinctly citric, almost like Sauvignon Blanc.
Name: Mil Piedras 2012 Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Aged in stainless steel, this single-vineyard Viognier is aromatic and appealing, with notes of fresh flowers, peach and lees. It's off-dry, medium bodied, with a textured feel and light fruit flavors.
Name: Quady North 2011 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Viognier vibrant in pear with a suggestion of coconut flake that's medium in weight and not overly wrought, Sobon's version is a good value at $16, fine, simple and fragrant in melon and orange rind, a taste of oak on the finish.
Name: Sobon Estate 2012 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: A moderately aromatic Viognier with notes of peach, citrus, and flowers. At 1% residual sugar, it's off-dry, with neutral-oak aging contributing to the rich, full feel.
Name: Cinder 2011 Off-Dry Viognier

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This yellow-tinted Viognier shows ripe aromas of peach and melon. In the mouth, it's more sharp and zesty, albeit a touch oily. Flavors of briny citrus and green fruits end in a citrusy, tangy, racy finish that's acidic and lemony.
Name: Lagarde 2012 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This is a moderately aromatic Viognier, with notes of white peach, yellow apple, and flowers. It's medium bodied and clean, with a textured feel but doesn't quite have the fruit concentration to match.
Name: Koenig Vineyards 2011 Williamson Vineyard Viognier

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Dark gold in color, this Viognier tastes of ripe apple compote and vanilla custard with a generous texture of tropical fruits.
Name: LangeTwins 2011 Estate Grown Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This warm-weather Viognier is fleshy and chunky on the bouquet, with generic white-fruit aromas that suggest gardenias. A plump palate is low on acid and heavy in weight; flavors of melon and green herbs finish soft and could turn flabby in a short time.
Name: Finca El Origen 2012 Reserva Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Aged in stainless steel, this is lightly aromatic, with notes of nectarine and overripe apple. Labeled at 14.5% alcohol, it surprisingly never shows it. Rather the fruit concentration comes off as a bit wanting.
Name: Fujishin 2011 Viognier

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This lightly aromatic offering of Viognier that doesn't appear entirely ripe, with notes of lemon curd and herbs. It's medium bodied, with a bitter streak that runs from head to tail.
Name: Indian Creek 2011 Viognier

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This tastes like a more concentrated and sweeter version of Stottle's dry Viognier from the same vintage and vineyard. Deeply concentrated, complex and creamy, it's loaded with citrus and stone fruits, honey and butterscotch, yet remains lifted by defining acidity.
Name: Stottle 2011 Lucille Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A precise, detailed and thoroughly exemplary Viognier. It's both thick and racy, loaded with ripe, rich tree fruits, with lemon drop citrus and a lick of lightly honeyed butterscotch. Luscious and lingering.
Name: Stottle 2011 Elerding Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sourced from the Dineen vineyard in the heart of the Yakima valley, this cool site in a cool vintage puts the emphasis on botanical aromatics and a  vivid, penetrating palate of citrus skin and flesh.
Name: Stevens 2011 StevensDivio Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 11% Roussanne, this high-toned effort mixes Meyer lemon and grapefruit with broader fruit flavors of pear and peach. It's got alcohol listed at 14.6%—not unusual for Viognier, but it does bring on some heat in the finish.
Name: McCrea Cellars 2010 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: The nose on this racy Viognier is mostly tropical. In the mouth, this is lifted, tangy and acidic, with citrusy flavors of lime, lemon and green appple. A tangy, fresh, zesty finish with a lemon-based flavor is refreshing but angular.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 La Joya Gran Reserva Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel fermentation and aging (20% new) puts the wood at the fore here with notes of vanilla and oak spice along with white peach. It's viscous and oily with the alcohol showing prominently.
Name: RoxyAnn 2010 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: This creamy, candied Viognier comes across hot and high in alcohol, with banana and vanilla aromas that are not very encouraging. Flavors of Animal Cracker cookies, vanilla and canned fruits end in a sweet, soft, cloying finish.
Name: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Maucho Reserva Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An incredibly well-made and well-priced Viognier, from Cedarville's very own decomposed granite-filled soils high atop Fair Play. Opening with faint floral honey, wet stone and pear aromas, the flavors follow through accordingly, and the wine just continues to please with full-integrated minerality. It's a joy to drink.
Name: Cedarville 2011 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: From rocky estate soils, Terre Rouge's Viognier opens with delicious aromas of honeysuckle, mango and guava, lightly put together with a jolt of wet stone. Rich in mouthfeel, the finish is woodsy, like the finest herb garden.
Name: Terre Rouge 2011 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An aromatic wine with notes of lavender, vanilla, and ripe peaches. The palate is rich and full bodied, showing some heat on the finish.
Name: Bunnell 2010 Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A somewhat unusual expression of Viognier with notes of lime, lime leaf, and white peach that seem more reminiscent of a Sauvignon Blanc. It's full bodied and viscous, ending with a bitter note.
Name: Valley View 2011 Anna Maria Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: One needs to lean into the glass to find the notes of vanilla, peach, and tropical fruit here. It's oily and broad in feel with the alcohol adding a bitter note to the finish.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2011 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings all of this grape's exuberance with notes of fresh flowers, peach and jasmine. Fermented and aged in stainless steel, it's broad and full bodied with the alcohol poking through on the finish.
Name: Desert Wind 2011 Desert Wind Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though relatively young, this has already taken on a rich golden hue, and the flavors are quite mature. Lightly buttery with flavors of nut oil more than fruit, this is a wine to drink up quickly.
Name: Sigillo Cellars 2010 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Light lemon and melon aromas lead the nose, but the wine slips in the mouth, becoming creamy and flabby in constitution, with only mild citrus, papaya and bitterness for flavors.
Name: DiamAndes 2011 de Uco Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Viognier is easily Maison Bleue's best yet, and it sets a high standard for every Viognier in the state. It's superrich and concentrated without being fat, jammy, bitter or hot. The explosion of citrus, stone fruit and light tropical fruit flavors seems to extend indefinitely on the finish. Details of mineral, baking spice and honeysuckle add interest.
Name: Maison Bleue 2011 Notre Vie Arthur's Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the beguiling aromatics to the thrilling palate that's saturated with flavors of citrus flesh and rind, tangerine and green apple, this Viognier offers superb focus. The length and detail are noteworthy, but the taste is simply delicious.
Name: Watermill 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dusty and detailed, this pure Viognier incorporates notes of lemon-pepper; tart, fresh lemon pulp and rind; plus a hint of curry powder. This should make an interesting accompaniment to raw clams or oysters.
Name: Syncline 2011 Alder Ridge Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's a change in the 2011 blend: There's no Roussanne, and it's almost one-quarter Marsanne. It's a tight, steely wine, with bracing acidity and citrus rind flavor, which is reflective of the vintage. Grapefruit and Meyer lemon notes come into play, and it remains balanced through the finish
Name: Ott & Murphy 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Peloponnese, Greece
Description: Apricot, citrus and honey notes lead this impressive Viognier from Greece. On the palate, it shows good balance of white fruit, flower and pineapple notes. An elegant and unique selection.
Name: Skouras 2010 Cuvée Larsinos Viognier (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Upper Galilee, Israel
Description: Fresh, vibrant and attractive, this Viognier boasts forward aromas of ripe melon, lychee, honeysuckle florals and soft sweet spice. Medium weight, but clean and balanced, with medium acidity and a hint of clementine, which lifts the rich fruit flavors. The floral accents shine through on the finish.
Name: Galil Mountain 2011 Yiron Vineyard Viognier (Upper Galilee)

Appellation: Epanomi, Greece
Description: Aromas of apricot, tropical fruit and spice lead this refreshing and expressive white. On the palate, it tastes floral, with a thread of honeyed sweetness, but the acidity gives it bounce. Fun and friendly.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2010 Viognier (Epanomi)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Viognier is clearly a strong suit at Cowhorn, a biodynamic vineyard and winery in the Applegate Valley of southern Oregon. The aromatic nose is wreathed in seductive scents of flower and fruit. Flavors are a mix of citrus and stone fruits, with a taste of honey that brings added depth, but not sweetness.
Name: Cowhorn 2011 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: In contrast to the Artist Series Viognier, this is made entirely in stainless steel. It's quite soft, with ripe fruit flavors of peaches and apricots. There's a hint of vanilla spice as well.
Name: Merrill Cellars 2010 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
