Description: This young Artist Series Viognier spent seven months in once-used American oak barrels. The impression is of citrus, with a touch of sweetness and heavy barrel influence. There's a slightly burnt flavor, a hint of alcohol heat and a biting finish.
Name: Merrill Cellars 2011 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Made in the rich, ripe, over-the-top style that winemaker Mark McNeilly uses for his own Mark Ryan Viogniers, this is a superconcentrated wine with more than a passing resemblance to limoncello. Along with that comes notes of Key lime, candied pineapple and a bit of alcoholic heat. Some will find it excellent, others a little too extravagant.
Name: Force Majeure 2011 Collaboration Series Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The addition of 20% Roussanne to the blend seems to thicken the palate—which is not a bad thing at all. A scent of honeysuckle piles on top of the flavors of honey, chamomile tea, lemon, orange and pink grapefruit, creating a luscious wine with impressive length.
Name: Novelty Hill 2011 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier is a clear success story for Wilridge. This is not a flashy wine, and it goes down easily. It's deeply concentrated, with a rich core of peach, apricot and lemon drop flavors.
Name: Wilridge 2011 Rosebud Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A single-vineyard wine (though not labeled as such), this was barrel-fermented in neutral French oak and bottled after about four months. Honey and toast are delicate nuances; the minerality and pure expressions of lime and kiwi fruit are at the core. This has excellent grip and medium-term aging potential.
Name: K Vintners 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a juicy, perfect melding of citrus and light tropical fruit flavors. With impeccable balance and poise, this thrilling, entirely stainless-steel-fermented Viognier persists well onto the graceful finish.
Name: Nefarious 2011 Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented and aged in neutral oak, this mixes the richness of Chardonnay with the herbaceous tang of Sauvignon Blanc—but flavors notwithstanding, it's in fact pure Viognier. Excellent mouthfeel and structure carry the light and pretty fruit onto the finish that shows just a hint of barrel toast.
Name: Lullaby 2010 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a gorgeous Viognier that opens with gentle aromatics of subtle notes of flower and stone fruit—mostly apricot and golden plum. Clear and focused, with a crisp backbone, this contains enough weight to pair with a range of foods, especially anything roasted with apples.
Name: Holly's Hill 2011 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Young and yeasty, this seemingly off-dry Viognier rounds out in the mouth with appealing scents and flavors of lemon, lime, jasmine and honey.
Name: Cave B 2011 Estate Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Light honey, lemon and grapefruit flavors blend harmoniously. The wine has good length and texture in the mouth, with a tart, pleasantly tangy finish.
Name: Palouse 2011 Golden Pearl Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Notes of melon and citrus rind are annotated with a fresh green-herb scent. Decant this tight, compressed white wine.
Name: Gård 2011 Lawrence Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart and tasty, this is a vibrant, clean and fresh Viognier, loaded with flavors of citrus fruit and rind. Some tangerine and candied orange-peel highlights add zest to the midpalate.
Name: Martinez & Martinez 2011 Alder Ridge Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: A clean and bright wine with focused acidity, this is a mouthful of lemon and lime flavors, with a hint of peach. With a handful of Chardonnay and Muscat in the mix, this is a great party or midweek white, but it's also fit for any special occasion.
Name: The White Knight 2011 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This sharp-edged Viognier brings peach and pineapple flavors to the fore, then some hard, drying phenolic notes bring the wine into a firm, quick resolution.
Name: Thomas O'Neil Cellars 2011 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lodi, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Fragrantly viscous and deeply golden in color, this has coatings of honey and apricot amid its full body and texture.
Name: Peirano 2009 Heritage Collection Viognier (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Stylish and tart, this is a high-acid Viognier, with sharp flavors and a zippy mouthfeel. The nose hints at powdered sugar, but there is no follow-up sweetness on the palate.
Name: Vin du Lac 2011 Vie! Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Alentejano, Portugal
Description: This floral wine stongly shows Viognier's hallmark apricot flavor. As one of a series of varetal wines from Terra d'Alter, it has great fruitiness. It is nicely touched with acidity and bears a round texture. Age for a few months before drinking.
Name: Terra d'Alter 2011 Viognier (Alentejano)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: The bouquet on this is dry, fresh and lemony, with hints of sugar cookie and vanilla wafer. It feels wide, plump and oily, with white fruit flavors of peach and melon along with tropicality and mild bitterness. The finish is cleansing but still a little bitter.
Name: Casa Silva 2011 Lolol Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: This smells tropical and citrusy, with hints of acacia and wild flower. It feels round but oily, with green melon, vanilla and peach flavors. It fades to a mildly bitter note of green banana, with a tropical overtone.
Name: Casa Silva 2011 Reserva Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Superconcentrated, unctuous and lush, this mixes a note of lemon drop with a hint of ripe tropical fruit. On the palate, this shows terrific concentration, bearing hints of honey and lemon curd, with a crisp, lingering finish.
Name: àMaurice 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Smooth and silky, this lovely Viognier begins with flavors of citrus, lemongrass and fresh herb, before continuing into a well-rounded, full-flavored midpalate that hints at just a touch of residual sugar.
Name: Mark Ryan 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This much-sought-after, estate-grown Viognier is in short supply in 2011, but it's exemplary for its structure and class. Flavors of lime skin and grapefruit, wet stone and citrus abound. The cool vintage led to low yields—under two tons per acre. All neutral oak was used.
Name: Abeja 2011 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This has flavors and aromas of hazelnut, dried apricot and coconut in between layers of lush white peach. Overall, this is very pretty and well balanced. Its light-handed finish is floral and tropical, without a sign of oak.
Name: Rock Wall 2011 Kristen's Viognier, Nelson Ranch Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Viognier from the Southern Rhône can often be overripe and heavy, but while this offering from Grand Veneur is full bodied and richly textured, it remains reasonably fresh. Apricot, pineapple and passion fruit flavors mingle easily on the palate, finishing clean and long. Drink now.
Name: Alain Jaume et Fils 2010 Domaine Grand Veneur Blanc de Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A terrific value in French Viognier, this “simple” Vin de Pays displays full-on floral aromas of honeysuckle and rose pollen, fleshed out on the palate by hints of apricot and pineapple. It's medium to full in body, with a slightly creamy texture and a dusting of tannin and white pepper on the finish. Drink it over the next year or so.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2010 Viognier (Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This full-bodied, lushly textured wine is 100% Viognier. Despite being aged nearly a year and a half in French oak, it retains a peppery aroma of nasturtium blossom along with toast and honey notes. Toasted nuts figure prominently on the palate, with just enough fruit weight to support the oak, while a touch of honey lingers on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2009 Taburnum Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Silky, spicy and roundly fruity, this estate-grown Viognier brings fruit flavors of citrus, melon and a hint of pineapple. Nicely woven together, it finishes with a citrus rind edge that's softened with a suggestion of cream.
Name: Amalie Robert 2010 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: This is a smooth, orange- and peach-flavored wine, with a rich almost oily texture. It's rounded with light acidity on the finish. With its weight, this is a wine for food.
Name: Triennes 2010 Sainte-Fleur Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée, France Other, France
Description: This is a pleasantly quaffable Viognier, with restrained apricot and melon aromas and flavors. It's medium bodied, without much texture, but a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2009 Secret de Famille Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)
Region: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: This smells like applesauce and pear, feeling tight as a drum on the palate, with sharp nectarine and apricot flavors. It's tart and crimped on the finish.
Name: Dominio de Punctum 2010 Lobetia Made with Organic Grapes Viognier (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A candied citrus flavor marks this fresh, bracing, barrel-fermented Viognier from the estate vineyards. Despite low alcohol and a hint of sweetness, it retains a crisp minerality, with a finishing lick of lime rind.
Name: Jones of Washington 2011 Estate Vineyards Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: William Church has outdone itself with this new Viognier, a mix of fruit from Conner Lee and Gamache Vineyards. A leesy, yeasty, textural underpinning complements the tangy lemon, lime, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. It's superfresh and delicious.
Name: William Church 2011 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As with all Nefarious wines, balance is the key to success. Whiffs of toast, smoke and sea breeze introduce a delicate, estate-grown wine, with pretty melon, pear and apple notes. Complex and graceful.
Name: Nefarious 2010 Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pretty bouquet of honeysuckle, lime and orange peel introduces this well-made Viognier. It offers pleasing richness across the palate, with some phenolic edginess sparking the finish.
Name: Eleven 2010 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Done in a meaty, almost thickly fruity style, this vineyard-designated Viognier fills the palate with citrus and stone flavors. There's a pretty floral note to both the nose and the finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2011 Talcott Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light for a reserve, this has a yeasty, slightly beer-like scent. The aromas run from celery and jicama to tart green apple, with a hint of toasted bread—perhaps from the fermentation that took place in neutral barrels.
Designation: Reserve Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2010 Reserve Destiny Ridge Vineyards Estate Grown Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tank fermented, then aged in neutral French oak, this has a tawny cast to it and a soft, slightly woody flavor. The lemony flavor finishes with a mildly bitter fruit-skin note.
Name: Morrison Lane 2010 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lisboa, Portugal
Description: A floral, ripe and full of sweet yellow-fruit flavors, this is round, with its softness balanced by some acidity. Flavors of green plum skins and apples add tang.
Name: Parras Vinhos 2010 Quinta do Gradil Viognier (Lisboa)

Appellation: Gisborne, New Zealand
Description: A full-bodied, mouthfilling Viognier, with apricot and pineapple aromas that broaden out on the palate into more general expressions of stone fruit and citrus. It's straightforward and easy to drink, with a clean finish that shows a touch of warmth.
Name: Millton 2010 Riverpoint Vineyard Viognier (Gisborne)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A floral nose greets you at first sniff, followed by hints of light citrus. A mix of grapefruit, melon and apple flavors are light and enticing, keeping the wine delicate and balanced. The finish leaves an impression of lemon tea.
Name: Folin Cellars 2011 Estate Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel-fermented and pungent, with a whiff of glue, this has a simple mix of mint and wax aromas.
Name: Agate Ridge 2010 Estate Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's a lot of barrel influence in this acidic Viognier that finishes with a metallic taste.
Name: LangeTwins 2010 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Capay Valley, Central Valley, California, US
Description: There's a strong peach-fuzz aroma enveloping this wine. It's unoaked, tasting overly rich and oily.
Name: Capay Valley 2011 Viognier (Capay Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This southern Rhône-style blend includes 10% each Marsanne and Roussanne. It's flat out lovely and silky smooth, with scents and flavors of honey-laced flowers. Lemon, lime and grapefruit dominate the palate, with superb balance and persistence. Certainly one of the best Washington State Viogniers I have ever tasted.
Name: AntoLin Cellars 2010 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Always a strong suit from àMaurice, the 2009 Viognier has a cocktail mix of lemon drop and botanical herbs and spices. Pungent, bright and deliciously lively, this is a thrilling, high-wire wine.
Name: àMaurice 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the estate bottling, lush and round, with a Chardonnay-like mouthfeel from barrel fermentation. Flavors of citrus and apricot fruit, expressions of a cool vintage, pull it into sharp focus. A smattering of toast and butter threads through the finish.
Name: àMaurice 2010 Sparrow Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nicely done, still young and sharp, but carrying interesting scents of lemon and lime rind, orange liqueur, and peppery spice. Excellent acidity buoys it up through a satisfying finish, with just a slim suggestion of warmth. Should continue to improve with another two or three years in the bottle.
Name: Watermill 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A gorgeous effort, awash in high-toned floral aromatics, sharply penetrating, and leading to a densely-packed palate of waxy fruit, honeyed spice, Meyer lemon, citrus and stone fruit. Rich, lush, concentrated and long—what more can you ask from a Viognier?
Name: RoxyAnn 2009 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely, lemony jasmine-tea scents and flavors abound in this delicate yet penetrating wine. Clean and fresh, it adds highlights of citrus rind without a trace of bitterness. Pure elegance.
Name: Cristom 2010 Estate Viognier (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This barrel-fermented estate wine is luscious and creamy, coating the palate with generous flavors of apricot, peach and melon. The concentration is impressive, as are the barrel flavors on the finish. Vanilla, coconut, caramel and lightly buttered almonds all contribute to the nuanced detail.
Name: Cristom 2010 Germaine Vineyard Viognier (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: From a cool, inland section of Mendocino County, this Viognier opens with gorgeous aromatics—heavenly honeysuckle and grapefruit—and offers up crisp, dry, borderline bracing acidity that pulls back just at the right moment. Nicely textured, the finish lingers.
Name: Claudia Springs 2010 Lolonis Vineyard Viognier (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A pretty Viognier with oaky pear and apricot aromatics, lean, dry and crisp in style with plenty of depth on the finish that will appeal to fans of Condrieu. This wine will be available in 2013.
Name: Terre Rouge 2010 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Strong citrus fruit and citrus-rind aromas mix lemon, lime and grapefruit in a sharply-defined, relatively moderate-in-alcohol Viognier. It's acidic and firm, nicely focused and precise. Overall, it is a very good, food-friendly wine.
Name: Del Rio 2010 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Stark's Viognier is liltingly ripe, enveloped by lemon and kumquat and a circle of spice. Light and crisp upon opening it develops a depth of textures and layered flavors over time and is very pretty, retaining plenty of acidity amidst its alcohol and neutral oak. Pair it with Thai food or creamy lobster rolls.
Name: Stark 2009 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Fresh red-apple and nectarine slices abound on the nose and palate, while a lively floral character adds lift and depth to the bouquet. A touch of citrus pith and peach pit stay through the medium-length finish. Medium weight and fleshy, but vibrant and balanced.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2010 Nord Sud Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from organically grown grapes, this thick, creamy Viognier has great perfume and weight and shows an expertly handled balance between ripeness and oak.
Name: Bonterra 2010 Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This broadly fruity Viognier is full across the palate, with a ripe mix of Meyer lemon and pink grapefruit. It's bolstered by matching acidity, and the core of tangy fruit runs into a fresh and balanced finish.
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2010 Sundown Vineyard Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: This Idaho entry has been fermented in stainless steel and was not put through malolactic. It's bone dry and yeasty, with a beery flavor and tart acidity.
Name: Cinder 2010 Dry Viognier

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Attractive and fragrant aromas of yellow peach, honeysuckle and white grape juice lead, while the citrus-driven palate ends crisp and lifted. Medium weight, with balanced acidity and a tangy finish; drink now.
Name: Michel Gassier 2010 Les Piliers Viognier (Vin de France)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A toasty streak frames the overall character of this wine, resulting in aromas and flavors of wood-grilled peaches and lightly roasted walnut shells. The texture is round and fleshy, but a sweet spice and orange-oil lift help to keep the palate fresh and balanced.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2010 Réserve Spéciale Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Sweet opening aromatics suggest a box of animal crackers along with lemon peel, banana and vanilla bean. Feels full, but good acidity prevents it from seeming flabby. Flavors of vanilla, lychee and melon are interesting, while the finish turns bitter and pithy.
Name: Casa Silva 2010 Reserva Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Quite aromatic and fruit-forward, with seductive scents of ripe lychees and peaches in syrup alongside some crushed rose-petal accents. The palate shows a bit more balance, with lemon peel flavors that mingle on the slightly astringent finish.
Name: Cuvée de Peña 2010 Viognier (Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Broad across the palate, this brings flavors of orange soda and orange candy, with a grainy impression. It's fruit forward, with a quick fade.
Name: Valley View 2008 Anna Maria Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The lightly intense bouquet is laced with nuances of hard, underripe peach, yellow flower and a soft mineral streak. Medium weight but fresh and lively, with a clean, slightly tart finish reminiscent of lemon and green plum flavors.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2010 La Violette Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A hint of honey gives a lush impression to the peach and melon notes in this wine. There's a soft toastiness to the palate, helping to lift the fleshy fruit core. Drink now.
Name: Les Jamelles 2010 Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From Dwelley vineyard grapes, this barrel-fermented Viognier offers appealing toasty fruit coated in buttered nut goodness. Meyer lemon and stone fruits, dusted with cinnamon, give it a French pastry sort of finish, though it is completely dry.
Name: Stottle 2008 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: Decadent scents of buttered brioche, honeydew and crushed yellow flowers lead the nose, while flavors of grilled yellow peaches and orange oil flood the palate. The mouthfeel is round and full, but countered by medium acidity and a slightly bitter note on the close.
Name: Spice Route 2009 Viognier (Swartland)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: Delicate sweet-pea and white-flower aromas marry into forward fruit notes of fresh pear and hard apricot. A mineral streak weaves through the lush palate, and a peach pit nuttiness lingers into the finish. Accessible and enjoyable now.
Name: Spice Route 2010 Viognier (Swartland)

Appellation: Stellenbosch, South Africa
Description: Flashy notes of wood-grilled apple, brioche and apricot fill the nose. The mouth is round and the palate spicy, as flavors of ginger and cedar dominate the stone fruit.
Name: Radford Dale 2009 Viognier (Stellenbosch)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This stylish Viognier is sourced from the Dineen vineyard. A cool site in a cool vintage yields a carefully made wine with gin-like spices and penetration. Lemon, lime and raw steel give it grip and length. Fine winemaking shows the strengths of a difficult vintage.
Name: Stevens 2010 Divio Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's labeled Viognier, but the blend includes 20% Roussanne and a bit of Marsanne as well. It works terrifically, yielding a wine with a spicy mix of grapefruit, citrus rind, and Asian pear. Wonderful mouthfeel, with cut, focus and length.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A beautifully floral Viognier, its aromas tenderly inviting, with uplifting hints of apricot, pear and white fig. It's a deftly made white with lovely minerality and a fleshy mouthfeel all wrapped up in the end with a light touch of lemon.
Name: Cedarville 2010 Estate Bottled and Grown Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Milbrandts farm over 2,000 acres in the Wahluke Slope, where their Clifton Vineyard—the source of this 100% varietal Viognier—is located. Creamy and refreshing, it's a mélange of lime rind and flesh, melon and pineapple, with the crispness of a mountain spring. The flavors build and build, with an elegant flourish as it finishes just as clean and refreshing as it began.
Name: Milbrandt 2010 The Estates Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A beguiling nose erupts into scents of rose water, hard lemon candy and fresh-sliced orange peel. The palate leans toward citrus, light but lingering, with a touch of minerality.
Name: William Church 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tasted pre-release, this is a wine that should most definitely continue to improve as it knits together. The floral aromas are a bit like Gewürztraminer, though this is 100% Viognier. Flavors include rose water, citrus, and a honeyed lemon note that runs through the tart, high-acid finish.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2010 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Decadent notes of buttered brioche and baked apple add depth to the orange oil and floral bouquet of this wine. The mouthfeel is round but balanced, and ripe notes of peach and melon unfold on the palate. A tasty ginger and clove spice develops on the finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2008 Yarden Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A new release for Concannon, this smallish release for the winery has honey, sweet vanilla, citrus and apricot, supported by a light, creamy mouthfeel. Finishing slightly sweet, with a coating of lemon, too, this would make a fine introduction to California Viognier for the novice.
Name: Concannon 2010 Reserve Viognier (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Lonesome Spring Ranch Vineyard, in the eastern Yakima valley, this pure varietal offering starts sharp and then quickly softens up, with creamy apple and peach fruit flavors. It turns a little hot on the finish, but overall it's a smooth, easy-drinking style.
Name: Hard Row To Hoe 2010 Shameless Hussy Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sweet-and-sour wine that mixes sour lemon candy with honey cough-drop elements. There is also an underlying streak of baby aspirin flavor, and the different aspects of the wine are not quite pulled together.
Name: Smasne Cellars 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine opens sweet, smelling of lemon and grapefruit, and is appropriately creamy in mouthfeel, with a sliver of sweetness on the finish.
Name: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2010 Viognier (Contra Costa County)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A pungent Viognier, with aromas of oranges and apricots, and an appealing accent of English breakfast tea. The fruit flavors are almost Riesling-like, but fatter and rounder.
Name: Illahe 2010 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Floral and honeyed smelling, then lighter as it airs out. Feels smooth but also tight and bright, with forward flavors of spiced apple, green herbs and melon. Round on the finish, with lasting character and body. Good for Chilean Viognier.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2010 Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Rapel Valley, Chile
Description: Untamed and scattershot on the nose, with a strong dose of basil and other green herbs. Feels gummy and flabby, with sweet, bungled flavors that finish bitter and mealy. A wayward, unfocused wine that doesn't do much for the Viognier variety.
Name: Anakena 2010 Single Vineyard Viognier (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A Burgundian take on Viognier, barrel fermented in 30% new French oak, put through M-L, and aged 18 months in barrel. Predictably dark and smooth, with a rich mix of soft, ripe stone fruit and barrel flavors. It's a bold style, showing plenty of toast and oak, but also concentrated and peachy, with lemon verbena, Key lime and a hint of honey.
Name: Charles Smith 2009 Stoneridge Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit comes from the cool climate Den Hoed vineyard. It was barrel fermented in neutral French oak Burgundy barrels, yielding a racy, razor-sharp, spicy, detailed, delicious wine. Lovely fruit is highlighted with peppery notes, running the gamut from cucumber on through to tropical flavors. Ripe, full, lingering.
Name: K Vintners 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An incredibly fragrant Foothills Viognier pungent with jasmine/honeysuckle aromas that lead one into a world of rich lushness. This white is perfectly balanced—not too sweet, not too oily, the perfect tablemate when you're just not in the mood for Chardonnay.
Name: Miraflores 2010 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Estate-grown, barrel-fermented, and richly extracted, this young Viognier has not yet shed its sharp edges. The fruit is generous and compact, a mix of peach, apricot and pineapple, with liquorous barrel flavors dominating.
Name: Abeja 2010 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tart, cool-climate fruit opens with scents of vanilla and buttered nuts, then gracefully expands into green fruit flavors of citrus and white peach. There is a refreshing, underlying minerality, and overall elegant balance.
Name: Maison Bleue 2010 Notre Vie Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A toasty bouquet of citrus and peach showcases the fermentation in new French oak barrels. The peachy fruit carries accents of citrus and rind, with excellent penetration into a lingering finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2010 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a difficult wine to evaluate. It's a dark gold, almost tawny, and definitely oxidized. Don't look for fresh fruit, but you will find deep, spicy, lingering complexity with dry, dusty, Muscat-like flavors. Two bottles tasted; similar results.
Name: DaMa 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: A Viognier full of peach, honey and grapefruit sweetness that finishes dry. The wine is easygoing, pleasant and eye-poppingly low in alcohol, an intriguing combination of factors from this Temecula Valley-based producer.
Name: Generation 7 2009 Viognier (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tropical aromas include lychee. Feels big on the palate but bland, with banana, melon and peach flavors. Low on acidity but full of melony flavor. Shows some burn on the finish.
Name: Lagarde 2010 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Fleshy white fruit and vanilla aromas set up a fresh-feeling, sort of plump palate with spice, melon and sweet vanilla flavors. Round, soft and pleasant on the finish, with a mild pithy aftertaste.
Name: Lagarde 2010 Altas Cumbres Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Tinny and minerally on the nose, then citric and zesty in the mouth. Flavors of lemon, lime and scallion are narrow but crisp. Tangy on the finish.
Name: Mil Piedras 2010 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Idaho, US
Description: Thin and tart, sharp citrus rind scents and flavors; then an unexpectedly sugary note in the finish.
Name: Fujishin 2009 Bitner Vineyard Viognier

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A lightly golden Viognier very floral in jasmine and white peach. It's sweet at first but minerally in the finish and subtle for what can be an overbearing variety at times.
Name: Philo Ridge 2009 Nelson Ranch Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and a bit green, this has peavine and citrus flavors, the citrus a mix of flesh, rind, and sour candy. It was fermented in 100% stainless.
Name: Reustle 2010 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant and varietal, with sharp-edged scents and flavors. Lemon polish, pine needle and citrus rind give it a compelling pungency. It broadens out in the midpalate, with stone fruit flavors piling on.
Name: Novelty Hill 2009 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This estate-grown Viognier sort of sneaks up on your palate. At first quite dry and slightly bitter, it slowly brings in subtle suggestions of jasmine and gin, citrus rind and wet stone. Still, a bit severe, but interesting.
Name: Gamache 2010 Velida Estate Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A very pretty Viognier from a small estate producer in Mendocino, this wine is 100% Viognier with no oak and no malolactic fermentation employed. Medium to almost full-bodied, it has impressive texture, plush flavors of honeydew and honey and a slightly sweet finish.
Name: Rivino 2009 Estate, Schrader Ranch Viognier (Mendocino)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Perry Creek has done a nice job on this Viognier. It has a pretty, very floral nose, and its aromatics make it inviting throughout, a small percentage of Marsanne and Roussanne coming through. Medium-bodied, it just finishes a percentage too sweet to taste truly balanced.
Name: Perry Creek 2009 Altitude: 2401, Le Seducteur Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Minerally and dry smelling, with floral aromas along with the scents of white peach and apple. The palate feels good and clean, with roundness matched by nice acidity. Flavors of spiced apple and pith are supported by zestiness, while the finish is honest. Not many value-priced Viogniers can match this.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2010 Finca La Linda Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This late-harvest Viognier looks like a still wine as it comes out of the bottle, exploding with honey and wildflowers on the nose. Its fruitiness is restrained somewhat and would stand out paired with a crème brûlée—though on its own, the alcohol is overpowering.
Name: Naggiar 2009 Estate grown Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An uneasy mix of grapes and flavors. Peaches and apricots—more skin than flesh—seem to hit a hard wall and just stop. Can a Viognier have a “dumb” phase? That is what seems to be going on here.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Uco Valley, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Starts out volatile, with a burning sensation to the nose. After settling, the palate shows heat along with baked apple, melon and bitterness. Finishes solid but pithy, with some leftover heat.
Name: Finca El Origen 2010 Reserva Viognier (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Guigal's luxury cuvée from Condrieu is a great success in 2008, marrying richness and power with hints of honeysuckle, toasted nuts and apricot. It's full bodied, creamy in texture and tremendously long on the finish. Drink now–2016, and possibly beyond.
Name: E. Guigal 2008 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: In ripe vintages, T-L's whites show much less oak influence than expected, and this 2009 Condrieu is a case in point. It delivers all of Condrieu's floral aromas, plus flashes of lychee, tropical fruit and apricot. It's Condrieu at its exotic, sexy best, long-lasting and spicy on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Tardieu-Laurent 2009  Condrieu

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though this is just the first vintage from the estate vineyard's Viognier grapes, it is immensely satisfying, with juicy, rich, dense flavors of limoncello and tropical fruits. Peach and papaya, mango and pineapple, all sharply defined by just enough tangy acid.
Name: Quady North 2009 Ox Block Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: From Jaboulet's own holdings, this is a broad, mouthcoating expression of Condrieu, with pineapple, apricot and honey notes that blossom slowly given enough time in the glass. Drink now–2015.
Name: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 2009 Domaine des Grands Amandiers  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Full, round and softly pillowy in the mouth, this is a perfumed Condrieu to drink over the next couple of years for its truffle-like notes backed by orange, honey and melon. Spicy and long on the finish.
Name: E. Guigal 2008  Condrieu

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A pretty, fruity, forward Viognier, with appealing orange blossom, citrus and light tropical fruit. Nicely balanced, with just the right amount of acidity, a full midpalate and excellent concentration through the finish.
Name: Melrose 2010 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Seems already mature, with truffle and mushroom notes creeping in among the apricot and orange marmalade fruit. Soft and lush, with just enough tannin and spice in support for near-term drinking.
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2008  Condrieu

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent with past years, this is a vivacious, lip-smacking style of Viognier, with a mix of fruits that goes from grapefruit into papaya, and just about everything in between. Wonderful minerality, persistence, and citrus rind phenolics.
Name: Mark Ryan 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A silky-smooth Viognier with apricot and honey on the nose and taste that's layered in flavors and textures and has an awesomely lingering finish without any of Viognier's prediliction for oiliness. A fine example of Shenandoah Valley's abilities for Rhône whites.
Name: Terre Rouge 2009 Viognier (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Fiddletown, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: With a sweet jasmine nose and steely acidity, this Viognier from Fiddletown, slightly east of the Shenandoah Valley, is a touch sweeter on the palate though completely in balance, with a long finish and great structure.
Name: Terre Rouge 2009 Viognier (Fiddletown)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Good fruit from the expansive estate vineyards is the story here. The wine is solid, straight-ahead, with plenty of citrus and melon and peach-powered flavor. Big and round and tasty, with a lick of toast in the back of the throat.
Name: Jones of Washington 2010 Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A light, easy Viognier　that's not oily like some versions of this variety, but pleasingly tropical, smelling of pineapple and guava with ripe melon on the finish.
Name: Jaxon Keys 2009 Estate Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A Sierra Foothills Viognier full of peach fuzz and honeysuckle with layered textures of honey and a medium finish.
Name: Holly's Hill 2010 Viognier (El Dorado)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: An austere Viognier with diesel and graphite aromas that delve into more pleasing apricot midpalate, then drops off a bit on the finish.
Name: Naggiar 2009 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: With overpowering pineapple and almost a flinty quality to its aroma, this wine is simply sweet.
Name: Rock Wall 2009 Viognier (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though the alcohol lists at 14.3%, this seems thin and flat. There's little depth to the one-dimensional, green fruit flavors, a hint of plastic and some burn in the finish.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2008 Reserve Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lovely wine, rendered with panache. Bright fruit flavors mix citrus, apricot, peach and pear. There's a winning smoothness across the palate, and a lively kick to the finish. Hints of lemon, tea, honey and candied orange all run right on into the finish.
Name: Tertulia 2009 Lonesome Spring Ranch Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Fragrant of apple blossoms, sweet cream butter and just a whiff of fresh popcorn, Keswick's Estate Reserve is an elegant wine with excellent structure and balance. Dry and full bodied in style, it opens on a lush sweet cream note that shifts seamlessly into a burst of fresh apple flavors. A delicate smoke and toasted wood note lingers through the long finish. Drink now.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2009 Estate Reserve Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp and slightly bitter upon entry, this young Viognier has varietal flavors of lemon/lime rind, along with unusual accents such as clove. It was whole cluster pressed and barrel fermented, retaining plenty of acidity. Should show best with food.
Name: Vortex 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: St. David's Bench, Ontario, Canada
Description: Pleasantly savory on the nose with fresh apple scents draped in smoke and lightly toasted wood, this Ontario Viognier would be a perfect companion for grilled fish or fowl on a warm summer evening. Dry and medium bodied with a nicely integrated palate of fresh pineapple and apple flavors, it's an elegant wine flecked with smoke and a brisk, lemony acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château des Charmes 2007 St. David's Bench Vineyard Viognier (St. David's Bench)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Subtle on the nose with hints of pineapples, toast and vanilla, this dry, full-bodied Viognier is surprisingly refreshing on the palate with a wonderful core of fresh apple and pineapple flavors. Brisk lemony acidity and pleasant lemon pith astringency balance out the 13.8% abv. Drink now.
Name: Annefield Vineyards 2009 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Forward and enticing with ripe scents of stone fruit and melon alongside a soft sweet grass accent. Medium weight with a balanced richness to the mouth and a clean, softly spiced finish.
Name: Domaines Astruc 2010 dA Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Monticello, Virginia, US
Description: Pale gold in color, Keswick's standard label Viognier smells sweetly of honeysuckle and pineapple with notes of smoke and toasted wood. Dry and full bodied in style, there's a pleasant concentration of pineapple and quince flavors, along with hints of sweet cream and butter on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Keswick Vineyards 2009 Viognier (Monticello)

Appellation: America, US
Description: The nose on this dry, full-bodied Viognier is pleasant with notes of pineapples and a high-toned citrus scent. The palate, however, verges between watery and flat with tones of overripe fruit and a hot, searing finish.
Name: Bogati NV Viognier (America)

Appellation: Paarl, South Africa
Description: Here's a gorgeous Viognier that is showing very well. Soft toasted brioche topped with baked red apple, ginger and orange clove spice aromas transition into flavors of spiced peach and orange oil in the full mouth. Well balanced with a long, spicy finish.
Name: Ridgeback 2008 Viognier (Paarl)

Appellation: Epanomi, Greece
Description: Floral, fresh and fragrant on the nose, this white offers elegant flavors of honey, apricot and tropical fruit. Good acidity and a crisp overall quality are balanced by the luscious fruit. A unique, pretty wine with diverse food pairing options…try it with Asian or Indian cuisine.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2009 Viognier (Epanomi)

Appellation: Clarksburg, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Full of minerality on the nose, this tropical Viognier from Clarksburg grapes is dry and acidic, well balanced and not over the top in alcohol (13.5%), a spicy, citrus-laden California Viognier worth trying.
Name: The White Knight 2008 Viognier (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Peloponnese, Greece
Description: A nose of peach, nutmeg, toasted nut and honey leads this Viognier from Splitsa. On the palate, smooth waves of white fruit, orange blossom and honey are expressive but refreshing, thanks to the balanced acidity. A fun wine with class.
Name: Skouras 2009 Eclectique Spilitsa Viognier (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Peloponnese, Greece
Description: This Viognier is a combination of peach and honeyed spice on the nose and palate. Refreshing but with a round, fragrant curve, the wine has a velvety texture and finishes with a spin of peach and tropical fruit.
Name: Skouras 2009 Cuvée Larsinos Viognier (Peloponnese)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A rich Amador County estate-grown Viognier with a touch of diesel on the nose balanced out by honey and peach, this wine spent time barrel fermenting in French and American oak and would go well seafood or, as the winery suggests, pepper steak.
Name: Sobon Estate 2009 Viognier (Amador County)

Appellation: Elgin, South Africa
Description: Fresh and light with ripe fruit notes of red apple and apricot spiced with hints of white florals and lime zest. The medium weight mouth is juicy and clean, the ripe stone fruit flavors carrying through to the close. Drink now.
Name: Elgin Vintners 2009 Viognier (Elgin)

Appellation: Wellington, South Africa
Description: Ripe and fruit forward with lush notes of melon, banana and sweet tropical fruit citrus throughout. Medium weight, the finish is loaded with juicy fresh peach flavors. Drink now.
Name: Eventide Cellar 2009 Viognier (Wellington)

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Very aromatic, to the point of being flowery. The palate is sweet and dense, with a heavy, round mouthfeel and candied mango, melon and applesauce flavors. Finishes just pure enough, with weight and pith entering the fray. Don't wait long to drink.
Name: Los Molles 2010 Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Barely noticeable lime and orange aromas sit mute on the nose, which is reduced and artificial smelling. The palate has a hard feel and generic flavors of white fruits. Amid sweetness there's a chemical bitterness. Not one of this winery's better products.
Name: Viu Manent 2010 Secreto de Viu Manent Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Heavy and soupy in its current state. This is one chunked-out white wine that is barely hanging on with flavors of papaya and dried-out peach. Has lost whatever freshness it may have had.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2008 La Joya Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Overly perfumed, with burnt notes, wayward sulfur and acridness at the wine's core. The palate is fleshy and low in acidity, with bitterness to the white fruit flavors that are none too clean. Offers very little that's redeeming.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2010 Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Wrattonbully, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba's mastery of Viognier extends even to this botrytis-affected dessert style, which offers scents and flavors of honey, dried apricots and orange marmalade. It's not overly complex, but wonderfully concentrated yet balanced, with a long, honeyed finish. Drink it over the next few years.
Name: Yalumba 2009 FSW8B Botrytis - 375 ml Viognier (Wrattonbully)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Shows all the beautiful Viognier notes you could ask for: flowers, spice, apricot and melon, carried by a succulent mouthfeel that remains fresh and vibrant from start to lingeringly spicy finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2009 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: Made in a crisper, fresher style than many Viogniers, without the extreme aromatics of some, but possessing fine, complex pear and pineapple fruit alongside smoky-minerally notes. It's medium-bodied and admirably focused, with a long, refreshing finish.
Name: De Bortoli 2008 Estate Grown Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure varietal, this beguiles instantly with a floral and citrus rind nose that shouts Viognier. Orange peel, lime, acacia flowers, even a touch of honey flow from the glass; smooth and seamless, it coats the back of the throat and rolls into a harmonious finish.
Name: Dusted Valley 2009 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh and beautifully defined, this textbook Viognier marries citrus fruit, peaches and honeysuckle to light tannins that suggest lemony tea. Persistent and balanced, with the alcohol at 14.3%, it is really a lovely sipping wine, just right for spring.
Name: William Church 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: This represents a top value among Viogniers, which often carry a price tag loftier than their quality deserves. Not so in this case; the variety's floral aromas are well displayed, backed by hints of melon, apricot and gingery spice. It's fairly full bodied, with a slightly viscous texture that extends the warm finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2010 Made with Organic Grapes Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: According to the winery, this spent only six months in neutral French oak, but there's an indisputable toastiness to this wine, which serves to accent hints of flowers and spice on the nose. Despite the toasty nuttiness, there's plenty of fresh fruit in evidence as well, making it quite attractive.
Name: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2009 Viognier (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yalumba's flagship Viognier is a broad, powerful wine, with pineapple and apricot flavors marked by hints of floral perfume and spice. Not quite as aromatically expressive as the Eden Valley bottling, it may be a touch denser and more concentrated, with potential to evolve through 2014 or so.
Name: Yalumba 2009 Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Hugh Hamilton proves that Yalumba's success with this tricky variety isn't a fluke, offering genuine Viognier expression at a realistic price. Ripe muskmelon and apricot notes leave a round, full-bodied impression on the palate, finishing with musky spice. Drink now.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2009 The Loose Cannon Viognier (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Even toward the lower end of the range, Yalumba's Viogniers retain the variety's hallmark overt floral and spice aromatics. This is less conentrated and intense than some of the winery's other bottlings, but it's still a fresh, nicely balanced wine that's a good introduction to Viognier. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2010 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Yes, it is possible to find real Viognier character for $10 per bottle (conceivably $6 by the glass). Featuring ample fruit balanced by crisp acids, this is very drinkable stuff. This wine's modest pear and apricot aromas lack some of the flamboyance of top examples, but this is still a very good effort.
Name: Oxford Landing 2009 Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Western Australia, Western Australia, Australia
Description: This is a rather thick and viscous rendering of Viognier, with pear and pineapple fruit that makes a powerful statement while at the same time lacking a little bit of complexity. Finishes tart.
Name: West Cape Howe 2008 Viognier (Western Australia)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Coteaux de L'Ardeche, France Other, France
Description: Full-bodied and round, this is a hefty Viognier that is aged an average of 12 months in barrel on the lees. Grilled peach, roasted nuts and buttercream abound on the nose and mouth and remain through the lengthy close. With its weight and density, try with cream-based seafood entrées like lobster newburg.
Name: Château de la Selve 2008 Madame de Viognier (Vin de Pays des Coteaux de L'Ardeche)
Region: Vin de Pays des Coteaux de L'Ardeche

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Honeysuckle and fresh grass mingle with aromas of nectarine and apricot pit on the bouquet, while the mouth offers vibrant flavors of sweet citrus and juicy fresh peach slices. Balanced and easy to drink with a kiss of toast on the close. Drink now.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2009 Nord Sud Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Ripe and rich without being overdone, this is a well-balanced Viognier with stone fruit and Anjou pear flavors lifted by accents of peony and orange rind. Vibrant acidity keeps things lively in the mouth, with a refreshingly crisp finish.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2009 Réserve Spéciale Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This straightforward wine is tasty and approachable, with flavors of red apple, hard peach and orange acidity. Round and satisfying in the mouth; drink up.
Name: Château de la Tuilerie 2009 Celebration Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Langhorne Creek, South Australia, Australia
Description: This South Australia Viognier comes across as restrained on the nose, offering up little more than some vaguely smoky or flinty notes, then delivers melon, pear and spice notes via a full-bodied, slightly oily-textured palate. Turns crisp and citrusy on the finish.
Designation: Lady of the Lake Single Site
Name: Zonte's Footstep 2009 Lady of the Lake Single Site Viognier (Langhorne Creek)

Appellation: Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Here's a delicate white that's a nice poolside sipper, with soft suggestions of white florals, tropical fruit and sweet citrus. The palate is clean and balanced with pineapple-flavored acidity keeping things vibrant in the mouth.
Name: Tortoise Creek 2009 Le Verger Viognier (Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Description: A different take on Viognier, with modest melon and pear notes and none of the variety's flamboyant aromatics or spice. It's crisp and lean instead of lush or opulent.
Name: D'Arenberg 2009 The Last Ditch Viognier (McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Pyrenees, Victoria, Australia
Description: The wine looks a touch amber-like at the rim, with aromas of butterscotch and cracked pepper. The flavors carry a bruised-fruit character, and the wine seems a bit flabby on the palate. Not up to this project's usual high standards.
Name: Domaine Terlato & Chapoutier 2009 Lieu Dit Malakoff Viognier (Pyrenees)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sugary, with a chemical aroma and a sharp, volatile finish.
Name: Mount Baker 2007 Late Harvest Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: An attractive nose of fresh apricot, peach, honeysuckle and lime pith follows through to the medium-weight mouth. Easy to drink with good balance and vibrant acidity. A glimmer of toast adds length to the close. Drink now.
Name: Galil Mountain 2009 Kosher Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Galilee, Israel
Description: Peach, clove-spiked Anjou pear, orange rind and honeysuckle fill the overall character of this fresh white. Medium weight with a good toasty richness that lingers through the finish. Drink now.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2007 Yarden Kosher Viognier (Galilee)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This small, family-owned, biodynamically farmed vineyard and winery is quickly becoming a southern Oregon cult producer. Certainly one of the finest Viogniers produced anywhere in the Northwest, this extraordinarily aromatic wine showers the palate with luscious and tangy lemon, pineapple, Satsuma orange and pear fruit flavors. Then the spices pile on, lending an exotic twist to a lengthy midpalate, and leading into a lightly toasty finish.
Name: Cowhorn 2009 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fragrant and sharp edged, with citrus rind flavors, and a hint of bitterness around the tight fruit flavors. As it breathes, pretty, concentrated fruit flavors emerge, suggesting marmalade and apricot preserves. It finishes with a light touch, tart and bracing.
Name: Amalie Robert 2009 Our Muse Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Firm and sappy, with varietally true peach and apricot fruit flavor. Turns a little syrupy in the follow through, giving it a canned peaches impression in the aftertaste.
Name: Del Rio 2009 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All den Hoed grapes—barrel fermented, neutral oak, no malolactic. Very rich, deep and racy, with glorious fruit. Full-bodied and lush without being heavy; it keeps the freshness and minerality, along with a full range of fruits from citrus to stone fruits to melon. Finishes with a lick of white pepper.
Name: K Vintners 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Tejo, Portugal
Description: Wood-fermented, lees-stirred, superrich wine. It is complex, the acidity adding to the nectarine and pineapple flavors. With the wood element carefully judged, it does have power but never oversteps the mark. A real success, and worth aging.
Name: Vale d'Algares 2009 Branco Viognier (Tejo)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though varietally labeled, this intriguing white Rhône includes 12% each Marsanne and Grenache Blanc. Rich and satisfying, it brings the buttery density of a ripe Chardonnay, but mixes the fruits for more drama—cantaloupe, apricot, banana, and a bit of papaya. A total yum-fest.
Name: McCrea Cellars 2009 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A complex and compelling mix of citrus rind, pineapple, apple and pear, both in the nose and in the mouth. This gathers strength in the mouth, kicking flavors into a higher gear with juicy acidity. A long, tailing finish has a hint of mint and pepper.
Name: Barnard Griffin 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: On the nose, this charming wine is aromatic, with pretty lemon and orange blossoms mingled with darkly toasted oak and butter notes. Dry and full bodied with a rich, creamy mouthfeel, floral notes and a soft salinity on the finish keep the broad palate from verging toward flabbiness.
Name: Barrel Oak 2008 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Comes across like a straightforward warm-climate Viognier, meaning it's full and waxy, with peach and nectarine aromas and flavors, a touch of searing heat, and pithiness to the back palate and finish. It's also juicy and zesty due to plenty of acids.
Name: Cono Sur 2009 Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: A tad cloying on the nose with pungent orange-flavored tea, bruised apple and billowing florals, this bright lemon yellow Viognier is broad and full bodied with lots of fresh orange and lemon peel notes and a hint of spice.
Name: North Gate 2008 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Veramar's Estate Club Viognier has a high-toned apple scent. Fat and full bodied with lots of rich cream, butter and apple cider notes, it's fairly low in acid, but high in alcohol, contributing to a finish that feels a bit dense and hot.
Name: Veramar 2008 Estate Club Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: If a buttery, oaky, roasty, toasty Viognier is what you seek, Virginia's Tarara Vineyards has it. Toasted oak, buttered popcorn and fresh apples dominate both the nose and palate of this dry, full-bodied wine. It's a straightforward wine with fairly high alcohol, but balanced with a vibrant acidity.
Name: Tarara 2008 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lush mouthful of nuanced fruit, this single-vineyard Viognier is loaded with a rich mix of peach, apricot, papaya and guava fruit. Laced into the hefty fruit core are baking spices and cocoa powder, along with suggestions of curry and cumin. This wine should be mandatory with curry dishes.
Name: Syncline 2009 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This new vintage of Abeja's estate-grown Viognier is back to a richer mouthfeel after the high acid 2008, with generous citrus and stone fruits—peach and pear—candied lemon and pineapple, highlighted with cinnamon spice. Flat out yummy, roundly fruity, and long-lasting, with butterscotch ruling the finish.
Name: Abeja 2009 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a tight, sharp, pungent Viognier, with penetrating scents of lemon oil and pine. In the mouth it is grapefruity and slightly bitter, with a perception of almond skin as it fades away.
Name: Valley View 2008 Anna Maria Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically forward and lush, this greets you with lemon polish, beeswax, Satsuma oranges, and Key lime, backed with barrel-influenced coconut flavors. The flavors meld together in the mouth, holding firm with extra phenolic density through a lip-smacking, luscious and lingering finish.
Name: Stevens 2009 Divio Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is a lovely balance to this Viognier, and a sense that these cool-climate grapes were not pushed too far. The winemaker, happily, chose to make the wine that the vineyard gave her. Delicate and layered, with paper-thin suggestions of citrus rind, grapefruit and white peach. Still tightly knit, this wine very slowly unwinds long after you've swallowed that first sip or two.
Name: Nefarious 2009 Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasant and straightforward, with light fruit flavors of citrus and white peach. It's simple, slightly dilute, with an awkward resolution.
Name: Cave B 2009 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is noticeable residual sugar, giving the wine a sweet, honeyed flavor. Along with that you'll find some citrusy fruit, with a bitter edge.
Name: Martinez & Martinez 2009 Alder Ridge Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine offers exceptional richness, without heaviness. It feels loaded with thick fruit, and yet there is nothing fat, oily or bitter in play. The lush fruits include a mix of citrus, pineapple, mandarin orange and peach, with some cool-climate minerality and even a hint of tonic seeping through.
Name: Mark Ryan 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Often a highlight in the Kestrel portfolio, this 2008 version of the Viognier is right on target. Juniper, lime, grapefruit, citrus and wet stone flavors pile on, yet the wine remains elegant and fresh. Give it a good chill and it could easily become a regular go-to white.
Name: Kestrel 2008 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A complex, tasty and remarkably affordable Viognier that's sure to please. Notes of ripe apricot, honeysuckle and ginger spice mingle with the toasty sweet vanilla oak nuances throughout. Balanced and softly creamy in the mouth with flavors of ripe Anjou pear and lightly grilled peaches leading through to the long, lingering finish. Ready to drink now but should also keep well for another year.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2008 Nord Sud Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A rather delicate Viognier, still lightly yeasty and very fresh. There is an underlying minerality that suggests water over river rock, and nicely cut and defined yellow fruits. A lovely bottle to pair with a wide range of mild cheeses, or simple fish such as fresh trout.
Name: Tildio 2009 Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A nice New World Viognier with peach and apricot aromas that come across as solid and true. The palate has size and balance, while the flavors of peach and apricot properly reflect the bouquet and bring spice into play. Fades with mild heat and bitterness on the finish, which won't be a factor if you're drinking the wine with a salad or grilled seafood.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2009 Finca La Linda Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: There's a ton of ginger spice mingling nicely with the strong floral component of honeysuckle, orange blossom and dried hibiscus flowers in the nose of this wine. Ripe peach and grapefruit oil support the earthy characters and flesh out the full, flavorful mouth, closing nicely with a clean medium- length finish.
Name: Domaine de Fonfile 2008 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gold in color and heavy from the beginning, this wine is full, lusty and near its final resting place. Aromas of ham, fennel, melon and mango are sweet and full, while the palate is overweight and soft, with lychee, melon and apricot flavors. Empties out quickly on the finish, and as a whole it's blowsy and ready to drink right now.
Name: Doña Paula 2008 Naked Pulp Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: With only three months in barrel, this Viognier has such a soft toasty warmth throughout that pairs perfectly with the natural fruity characteristics of the wine. Rich guava, quince and yellow peach abound with accents of dried rosehips and orange oil in the mouth and finish. Zesty, fresh and very easy to drink; drink now.
Name: La Forge Estate 2009 Reserve Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This Viognier has a beautifully vibrant bouquet with aromas of white peach, pear, sweet pea and ginseng tea with honey. The palate is full and ripe with stone fruit flavors as well as a peach pit nuttiness lingering in the back and through to the finish. Nicely balanced and integrated; drink now to experience its true freshness.
Name: Domaines Astruc 2009 dA Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The attractive and decadent bouquet suggests aromas of toasted brioche topped with apricot preserves and orange blossom flowers. Full but not flabby in the mouth with more flavors of ripe stone fruit slices in almond milk. Tasty and well-balanced; pair with sauced dishes like orange chicken or pork chops with fruit relish.
Name: Gayda 2008 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Rich and mildly toasty with notes of wood-grilled peaches alongside hints of white florals on the nose. A bit round in the mouth with flavors of lychee, apricot and red apple flesh. Orange citrus and sweet spice add complexity to the palate while a kick of acidity livens up the finish.
Name: François Lurton 2008 Domaine des Salices Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: A touch basic but also rock solid for $10. Apricot and other proper white fruit aromas get it going, and then come apple and apricot flavors. There's a slight cidery element to it, and the acid has a sheering quality, but as a whole it's nice Viognier for the price.
Name: Casa Montes 2009 Ampakama Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This late-harvest Viognier is so dense, so lush with aromas, that it defies description. Flowers, candied fruits, caramel, vanilla, English breakfast tea, even a bit of tobacco—this is one of those wines that just keeps on going. Fascinating, rich, yet vibrant with excellent acidity, this is a wine that any dessert wine lover should experience.
Name: Abacela 2009 Blanco Dulce Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel fermented, pure Viognier with a vibrant core of juicy, lemon/lime fruit. There's pink grapefruit and sweet pineapple, all set against pleasing phenolics that provide a firm framework. The mouthfeel is lush and the finish clear and lightly mineral.
Name: àMaurice 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The second vintage from the estate vineyard, this is rich and honeyed, scented with bee pollen, candle wax, hints of pine needle. Meyer lemon, caramel, honey and more coat the palate. Still very young, but all the pieces are there.
Name: àMaurice 2009 Sparrow Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Delightfully aromatic, this evocative, low-alcohol (12.5%) Viognier sends up pungent, piney aromas of citrus peel and flesh. A mix of lemon, orange and grapefruit flavors, smooth and clean, roll into a seamless and satisfying finish.
Name: Illahe 2009 Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fine effort, lightly toasty, lightly buttery, still varietal with pleasing lime, orange marmalade and suggestions of pineapple. Excellent mouthfeel and balance, with exceptional smoothness.
Name: àMaurice 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Abacela produces a dense, mineral-driven style of Viognier, vertically layered with a mix of citrus skins and fruits, notably grapefruit and pineapple. There's even a finishing kiss of honey, though the wine is quite dry. A delight.
Name: Abacela 2009 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An interesting debut from this new producer. The blend includes 20% Roussanne, co-fermented in neutral French oak. It was aged sur lie and given monthly battonage, and no malolactic fermentation. The wine is big, with juicy tropical fruit/bubblegum flavors, skin phenolics, great texture and baking spice highlights. Impressive.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Viognier from the Dwelley Vineyard, barrel-fermented, aged on the lees in neutral oak. A light and elegant style, creamy and loaded with Key lime fruit and texture along with nectarine and light tropical fruits. Complex and lingering, with clarity and definition.
Name: Lullaby 2008 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though it is listed at 14.2% alcohol, this is a pretty wine, with feminine grace rather than masculine muscle. Floral and fresh, it smells like fresh lemons and white peaches and flavors follow right along in that same vein. Balanced and polished, it shows exemplary winemaking skills on the part of Jonathan Scott Oberlander.
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2008 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Estate-grown, vibrant, and spicy, this southern Oregon Viognier opens with a penetrating bouquet of flower, spice and citrus. The wine really comes alive in the mouth, with palate-pleasing flavors of lime, quinine and melon. You'd almost swear there was a nip of gin in the mix. Delicious chilled.
Name: Folin Cellars 2008 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Viognier, all stainless steel fermented, with more guts and concentration than the creamier barrel-fermented Viognier from this winery. Lime and pineapple fruit flavors are bracing and clean, moving into light peach and tangerine as they persist in the mouth.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2008 L'Artiste Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This new release from Melrose fills the mouth with flavor; it runs from orange blossom to Meyer lemon to candied pineapple, finally settling into a strong citrus/tropical blend of delicious fruit flavors. It seems to strike a perfect balance, staying lively and well-defined, without becoming hot or bitter.
Name: Melrose 2009 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The smooth, silky, satiny nose erupts with layers of lemon, lime, tangerine and melon. The pretty, slightly waxy mouthfeel is not unctuous but has good body, precise definition, and no jagged edges. The alcohol stays under 14%, and the finish is round and persistent.
Name: Seven Hills 2009 Talcott Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Creamy and smooth, this barrel-fermented Viognier has peach and citrus fruit, with grace notes of ginger and nutmeg. There is even a hint of honey as it gathers strength in the back of the throat, with noticeable alcohol also.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2008 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A quick sniff and you're converted to this cool, refreshing white wine. The aromas carry the promise of citrus rind and sea salt; that tangy character livens up the cool fruit flavors also. Aged in stainless and neutral oak, just enough to soften up the midpalate while retaining its crisp definition.
Name: Watermill 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though the bottle says this hits 14.8% alcohol, it does not have the weight and depth that you might expect from that number. The heat is there, but the fruit is restrained, lightly herbaceous, showing some mild lemon and tangerine flavors, and a lick of quinine.
Name: Gamache 2008 Velida Estate Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: Juicy and fresh, this light and appealing Viognier shows crisp citrus and stone fruit flavors, some pineapple and stone, and a lick of spun sugar in the finish.
Name: Springhouse Cellar 2008 Voulez-Vous Viognier (Columbia Valley (OR))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This has the sharp, citrus skin phenolics characteristic of many Viogniers, but a rather soft middle tastes like green bananas more than citrus. Those banana flavors roll into the finish, then quickly fade.
Name: Agate Ridge 2008 Barrel Fermented Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wrattonbully, South Australia, Australia
Description: Gold in color, with an ebullient nose of spiced melon and sweet flavors of candied pineapple tinged with white pepper and grapefruit. At 12.5% alcohol and 117 g/L residual sugar, it's rich and sweet without being over the top. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2008 Hand Picked Botrytis Viognier (Wrattonbully)

Appellation: Coastal Region, South Africa
Description: While this Viognier starts off rich and ripe with aromas of stone fruit, soft oaky spice and tropical citrus, the mouth is fresh and zippy with notes of tangerine citrus and apricot. Medium bodied and balanced with a long finish kissed with clove.
Name: Spice Route 2008 Viognier (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Not as compelling as some vintages of this wine have been, but still very good, the 2008 Virgilius features floral and apricot aromas married to well-ripened melon and peach flavors. Its lush, broad-textured palate leads into a soft, easy finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2008 The Virgilius Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Nice Viognier for the price, blending hints of honeyed toast and citrus with melony fruit and peppery spice. It's mouthfilling without being oily or opulent, balanced to pair with salmon or swordfish.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2008 The Loose Cannon Viognier (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Adelaide, South Australia, Australia
