Description: Melon and pineapple fruit flavors offer something a little different from other white varieties, and while the wine is full and round in the mouth, it remains focused on the finish, a touch of honey balanced by citrusy notes. Drink now.
Name: Shoofly 2008 Viognier (Adelaide)

Appellation: Paarl, South Africa
Description: A vibrant, easy-to-drink and attractively priced Viognier. Melon, pear and delicate citrus oil flesh out the creamy mouth. The finish lingers slightly but is clean and refreshing. Drink now.
Name: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2008 Goats in Villages Viognier (Paarl)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: Starts off tight on the nose, offering up only struck flint and citrusy notes, but broadens out on the palate to reveal flavors of melon and white pepper. Citrus and spice linger nicely on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Yalumba 2009 Organic Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Gisborne, New Zealand
Description: Full-bodied and slightly viscous, this has the ample weight of Viognier on display, but lacks the variety's signature floral-spicy perfume. Instead there's melon and tangerine in a likeable if slightly neutral wine.
Name: Spade Oak 2007 Heart of Gold Viognier (Gisborne)

Appellation: McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Description: Barrel fermented in older oak, but this wine is still marked by oak and lees, with a slightly toasty, custardy edge to the melon and nectarine aromas and flavors. This medium-bodied Viognier then picks up hints of coffee and chocolate on the finish. Drink now.
Name: D'Arenberg 2008 The Last Ditch Viognier (McLaren Vale-Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Showing a zesty mix of lime, citrus rind and rock in the mouth, it's dense and still a bit hard, but deep. A rich, textural, serious Viognier, there's plenty of fruit and depth for near-term drinking, but it gives the definite impression that it needs more bottle age to fully blossom.
Name: Rulo 2008 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A serviceable white, with light lemony fruit—apple and jimaca It does not have the power of some riper Viogniers, but it is persistent, well-crafted, does not try to overdo it, and would be a perfectly fine accompaniment to a wide range of poultry and seafood dishes. The finish is surprisingly long and nicely detailed.
Name: Southard 2008 Elephant Mountain Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A good effort, with clean varietal character: lemon/lime skin flavors, sharp acidity and cool, green fruit throughout.
Name: Vin du Lac 2008 Vie! Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean and varietal, with cool-site flavors of lemon and lime. Bracing acidity, and cool, green fruit throughout.
Name: Mount Baker Vineyards 2008 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Juanico, Uruguay
Description: Weighty and rich, but the melon core to this Uruguayan Viognier is solid. The palate pumps round apple with walnut shadings, and the finish goes to melon, papaya and banana. It's already aging and won't last for long; get it while it's still good.
Name: Establecimiento Juanico 2005 Don Pascual Reserve Viognier (Juanico)

Appellation: Colonia, Uruguay
Description: Buttercup and other flowery aromas give it a good start. The palate is fairly plump and creamy, with apricot, melon and nutty flavors. Toward the finish it tilts a little toward banana. Not typical Viognier, but this is Uruguay.
Name: Dante Irurtia 2005 Posada Del Virrey Reserve Viognier (Colonia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Beautifully concentrated and textural, this Viognier mixes melon, white peach, nectarine and lemon fruit with pleasing minerality. There is none of the burn or bitterness that so often affects Washington Viogniers. This is a really refreshing, palate-cleansing wine.
Name: Caterina 2008 Willard Family Vineyard Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A barrel-fermented, single-vineyard designate, this vivacious Viognier brings suggestions of summer cocktails—specifically margaritas and gin and tonics. The spicy, pear-flavored fruit seems to be edged with salt and fresh-sqeezed lime, which is not to say that it isn't a beautifully crafted wine. Fine balance and length.
Name: Bunnell 2008 Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This excellent Viognier uses fruit from Yakima's Kestrel View vineyard. Bright and spicy, it has plenty of citrus fruit flavor and phenolic grip. It's a penetrating, textural, thirst-quenching wine.
Name: Dusted Valley 2008 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lovely bottle, with rich aromas of lemon/lime and beeswax. Flavors combine ripe citrus, orange peel and English Breakfast tea. Balanced and full, with 12% Chardonnay fleshing out the midpalate.
Name: Hogue 2008 Genesis Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Guigal's luxury cuvée from Condrieu is a blend of vineyards, all vinified and agfed for eight months in new oak. The result is a big, spicy, rich wine, graced with smoky nuances but built on concentrated honey and apricots. It's long and powerful on the finish, ending with impressive spice. Drink now-2015.
Name: E. Guigal 2007 La Doriane  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Guigal is now making 40-45% of the entire Condrieu appellation, making the quality of this cuvée quite an achievement. Floral notes lead off, followed by hints of peach, apricot and honey, and the wine walks the requisite balance between round lushness and peppery, minerally spice. Drink now-2012.
Name: E. Guigal 2007  Condrieu

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Cévennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: It's said that Viognier is difficult to grow, but then how can bargains such as this continue to exist? For $10, you get truffled pear aromas rounded out by the addition of melon, decent concentration and a long, dusty-minerally finish. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Gournier 2008 Viognier (Vin de Pays des Cévennes)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cowhorn Vineyard & Winery is a new enterprise in southern Oregon's Applegate Valley. The vineyard is already certified biodynamic, and the first releases show confidence and control throughout. This elegant Viognier was fermented with native yeast and did not go through malolactic. It mixes melon, peaches, pineapple and lime, and it's rich without being heavy or hot.
Name: Cowhorn 2008 Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Epanomi, Greece
Description: The lush nose of Viognier—fresh flowers, honey and spice—leads here. On the palate, the wine has an opulent, floral character—broad and inviting. Not terribly complex, but pretty and appealing. The viscous mouthfeel means it will handle richer dishes well—think lobster, cream dishes.
Name: Gerovassiliou 2007 Viognier (Epanomi)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Comes across as slightly tarry and rubbery, which distracts from the otherwise crisp citrus and melon flavors. Still, it's a pleasant, medium-bodied quaff.
Name: Château de Campuget 2008 Cuvée Prestige de Campuget Viognier (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée, France Other, France
Description: Hard and unyielding for Viognier, with lemon and mineral elements that seem a bit out of character for the variety. Nevertheless, it's a crisp refreshing white for the summer.
Name: Domaine Juliette Avril 2007 Le Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée)
Region: Vin de Pays des Portes de Méditerranée

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and a bit volatile, this young Viognier tilts strongly to the orange side of citrus. Despite the fresh fruit flavors it feels a bit flat in the mouth, lacking vitality.
Name: Melrose 2008 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a very mineral, fresh, grapefruity style of Viognier; it's got a lot of skin phenolics, and it really livens up the palate. Lime, tonic, citrus fruits and botanicals abound.
Name: McCrea 2008 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This barrel-fermented effort was not put through malolactic. It retains a very fresh, citrusy profile, a mix of rind and pulp flavors, with streaks of quinine and tonic. Good persistence, with the snap of fresh lime in the finish.
Name: Tertulia 2008 Lonesome Spring Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Lemon-lime aromas are light, floral and simple to like, while the flavors of apricot, peach and lime are basic but refreshing. More pleasant and easygoing than exact or serious, with cleansing acidity and manageable alcohol (Viognier often tops 15%). Less “varietal” than Viogniers from France or California.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2009 Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: New Mexico, New Mexico, US
Description: This poised white from New Mexico starts with delicate floral, honey and vanilla aromas, followed by pretty, mellow flavors of honey, flowers and spice. A lovely sip with desserts and soft cheeses.
Name: La Chiripada 2008 Artist Series 1 Viognier (New Mexico)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Sweet, spicy and floral aromas start this stylish Viognier from Cooper. The wine has some heft with its honeyed layers of flowers, spice and fruit. It's elegant and approachable…a sultry sip.
Name: Cooper Vineyards 2008 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: In the limited but challenged world of Argentinean Viognier, this one is pretty good. It's a touch oily and pickled, but that's a varietal trait and a reflection of warm terroir more than a fault. Flavors of citrus, pineapple and mango are solid, while the orange blossom character helps give it lift.
Name: Mil Piedras 2008 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Floral, white stone fruit aromas are sweet but generally attractive, while the lively palate is oily in feel but still fresh mostly due to youth. Lemon, apple and melon are the flavor components, while the finish is sweet almost to the point of being sugary, which is a detractor. Drink right away.
Name: Viña Las Perdices 2009 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Cochise County, Arizona, US
Description: Rich orange, lemon and citrus spices lead this Viognier from Page Springs. On the palate, it's fuller bodied, with lots of spice and citrus to balance out the honeyed fruit. Pair with cheese, fruit and spicy cuisine.
Name: Page Springs 2007 La Serrana Viognier (Cochise County)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Sweet apple aromas are probably the most defined thing coming off the innocuous nose, while the palate is forceful and citrusy, with jangly pineapple, peach and lemon flavors. Amplified white wine with a vague Viognier identity.
Name: Lagarde 2009 Altas Cumbres Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A hint of orange escapes from an otherwise acrid, oily nose, while the flavors of nectarine, peach and lychee are pithy and bitter. Can't offer a whole lot of positives about this weird Viognier.
Name: Lagarde 2008 Reserva Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Generic, mealy, bland and flat banana aromas and flavors. Not so bad that you can't drink it but impossible to get excited about.
Name: Zolo 2008 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Intense flavors jump from the glass, a head-turning swirl of papaya, mango, lime and grapefruit, etched with a little bitter rind, and showing plenty of phenolic bite. The alcohol is under 13%, and the acids really scream out for food.
Name: Quady North 2007 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure varietal, with distinctive lime and citrus rind character, this is cool climate fruit done in stainless steel, accenting the freshness and the acids. A little vitamin pill flavor comes through also.
Name: Tildio 2008 Viognier (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is clearly one of the finest Viogniers in the state, succulent and creamy, taking the varietal flavors of peach and pear and adding streaks of vanilla and caramel—not overdone, just hints that add richness to the flavors and roundness in the mouth.
Name: Novelty Hill 2007 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very fresh and juicy, this mouth-pleasing Viognier mixes peaches and grapefruit, zippy acidity, with highlights of lemon zest. It's beautifully balanced, detailed and refreshing.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2008 Crawford Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Subtle, with well-modulated fruit and a soft creamy quality from barrel aging and time on the lees, this hints at a wide panoply of fruits—apricot, peach, even papaya, but places them in a refined, silky setting that rolls out across the palate for literally minutes.
Name: Lullaby 2007 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is stainless fermented and aged on the lees in steel barrels, a nice idea that brings leesy creaminess to pretty fruit flavors of melon and citrus. It's an elegant Viognier, with the sort of fresh herbal highlights that freshen up a good cocktail, adding persistence to the mouthfeel.
Name: Sweet Valley Wines 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel fermented and sweetly spicy, this comes from the excellent Cougar Hills vineyard. Crisp citrus, pear and grapefruit weave together, while the barrel fermentation adds richness and cuts through the substantial acids.
Name: Whitman Cellars 2008 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Nice fruit flavors show yellow fruits, stone fruits, some melon and hints of apricot. The wine is 100% varietal, 13.5% alcohol, and sourced from the Upland vineyard on Snipes Mountain. Overall good balance and length.
Name: Covington 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bergevin Lane's newest Viognier seems to reflect some of the difficulties of the 2008 vintage, as noted in the winery's tasting notes. As a component of the Calico, the Viognier works wonderfully well, but here it is just a little bitter and thin. This is a young white wine that will reward decanting.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Egypt, Egypt
Description: The character of this feminine, aromatic Viognier is floral and exotic—not terribly complex but fun. The palate offers flowers and honey with a minerality and spritz. An easygoing white.
Name: Sahara Vineyards 2008 Viognier (Egypt)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A gorgeous nose lifts this bone-dry Viognier immediately from the glass. It's nicely structured and plenty ripe at just 12.7% alcohol. The Dineen vineyard grapes bring a crystalline transparency, scents reminiscent of lemon tea, and penetrating streaks of lemon and lime.
Name: Stevens Divio 2008 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Viognier is sleek and lean, with bright citrus flavors that may strike some tasters as volatile. It finishes with noticeable heat and a little citrus skin bitterness.
Name: C.R. Sandidge 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Estate-grown grapes ripened to 25 brix deliver a substantial Viognier, dense with citrus fruit, lemon zest, pineapple and mineral flavors. It's concentrated and expressive, with mouth-cleansing acids and refreshing purity.
Name: Abacela 2008 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Consistent with previous vintages, this is barrel fermented in neutral oak, and opens with crisp and pure aromas of citrus skins, grapefruit and lime. The fruit flavors follow suit, intense and persistent.
Name: K Vintners 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: McKinley Springs is showing a deft touch with its white wines. This one has absolutely lovely aromas of beeswax and honeysuckle, leading into lime and citrus on the palate. Long and refreshing, with no alcoholic burn despite its almost 15% alcohol.
Name: McKinley Springs 2007 Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Coéo bottling is a preview of the three single-vineyard Viogniers that will be released as the white wine half of the AlmaTerra project. It's a very promising beginning, juicy and citrus-laden, with lime and grapefruit, a refreshing hint of tonic water and a splash of sweet sun tea.
Name: AlmaTerra 2007 Coéo Three Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% varietal, all barrel fermented; it's sharp and spicy, with light citrus, balanced acids, and ripe melony fruit. Still quite young, it is already hinting at honey in the finish, and done in a crisp, moderate style (mid-13% alcohol).
Name: Seven Hills 2008 Talcott Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dry and tight, but with layered aromas focused on citrus rind, grapefruit and white peach. In the mouth it's firm, tightly knit, and complex; beautifully layered with wet stone underpinnings.
Name: Nefarious 2008 Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine is 100% varietal, very fresh, and loaded with lime and citrus and citrus rind—a real oyster and shellfish wine. There is discernible minerality, plenty of acid, and alcohol just touching 13%.
Name: Maison Bleue 2008 Notre Vie Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents and tastes of beeswax, light honeysuckle, white peach, and light tropical fruit give this wine breadth as well as depth. It follows with hints of cracker, a medium weight, good balance and concentration and a clean, lingering finish.
Name: Syncline 2008 Coyote Canyon Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A lovely Viognier, with juicy citrus flavors set against honeysuckle and lemon tea. Perfect balance, as the acids keep the wine in check, and the citrus rind and grapefruit flavors are complemented by floral highlights. Very refreshing and clean.
Name: William Church 2008 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Quite a tropical style, but it works. The bouquet is ethereal and light, with tangerine and mango aromas that lead to peach and mango flavors. It's fresh and lashing, but while it's candied on one hand it is entirely fruity and refreshing on the other.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Slightly oily and nutty on the nose, but mostly you get orange peel and citrus blossom. The palate is round, full-bodied and pithy, with dry, nearly oxidized flavors of peach, walnut and melon. Finishes just fresh enough, but without any of the haunting, exotic flavors that characterize Old World Viognier.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2007 Casa La Joya Reserve Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright and sharp, this assertive Viognier has strong scents of citrus rind, suggestions of stone, and cool-climate fruit flavors. It's dry and slightly volatile, without much concentration. The finish turns simple, with lime and unripe pineapple flavors.
Name: Columbia Winery 2007 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Visión has good peach, apricot and other stone fruits on a largely quiet nose, while the palate is surprisingly spry and tangy as it tastes like lemon-lime and pineapple. Finishes long and acid-washed, so overall it seems zesty and jumpy.
Name: Cono Sur 2008 Visión Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Limarí Valley, Chile
Description: Oily and sort of muddled at first, but soon it gathers its legs and focus. The body is fairly full and round, while the flavors of citrus and melon are solid but pithy. With grapefruit and orange on the finish, it slides toward citrusy while delivering more than adequate punch and kick.
Name: Viña Tabalí 2008 Reserva Viognier (Limarí Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Aromas of popcorn kernel, butter, petrol and oil don't work well, and despite the wine's flush, mostly balanced mouthfeel, it also doesn't deliver much in the way of flavor; the palate tastes burnt and bitter, with deadpan fruit. As fans of Viu Manent's wines, especially the winery's reds, we can dismiss this one as a swing and a miss.
Name: Viu Manent 2008 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Tank sample, 100% estate, May 1 '09 release. 180 cases; winery only. An unusually bright and racy style, with plenty of natural acidity, fresh lime and citrus, hints of white peach and a refreshing minerality. This is a glorious springtime white wine; you can almost taste the flowers. The impression of lime and citrus is immaculate and without any bitterness.
Name: Abeja 2008 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has retained some sweetness and is a pleasant, light take on Viognier. There are gentle notes of celery, melon and citrus, and a hint of toasted almond in the finish. A nice balance of acid and fruit keeps it on point through the finish.
Name: Barrage Cellars 2007 SWB Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Viognier/Roussanne blend is showing some heat, spice, and mix of melon and celery flavors, with a quinine/tonic finish. It seems to have a bit more concentration than previous vintages of Tertulia's Viognier, but does not show the complexity or finesse of the earlier versions.
Name: Tertulia 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Barossa Valley, South Australia, Australia
Name: Massena 2007 The Surly Muse Viognier (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Nice mix of citrus and tropical fruits in the nose, with a spicy burst on the palate. Bone dry, racy and yet still full-bodied, this excellent Viognier carries its tropical papaya flavors into a surprisingly creamy finish, laced with vanilla cream and butterscotch.
Name: RoxyAnn 2007 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Name: D'Arenberg 2007 The Last Ditch Viognier (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Name: Yalumba 2007 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Soft and peachy, with good midpalate concentration. This is a simple but fruity and flavorful wine, with just the vaguest suggestion of Meyer lemon in the finish.
Name: Valley View 2007 Anna Maria Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Name: Oxford Landing 2007 Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This smells— and remarkably it also tastes—like bubble gum, with some pineapple tossed in for good measure. Peaches and apricots? Not so much; this is definitely an atypical Viognier, but brings plenty of candied fruit to the table.
Name: Del Rio 2007 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Name: Yalumba 2007 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's lush, leesy and rich, and broadcasts a flavorful mix of grapefruit, orange peel, Meyer lemon, hints of pineapple, Key lime pie and peach, all in a very creamy style. The wine is graceful and smooth, the fruit detailed with hints of toasted almond and cracker.
Name: Mark Ryan 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatic and highly textural. The wine brings out a lot of citrus rind, tart stone fruits, and leesy texture. There's plenty of acid and hints of an underlying minerality with no hot alcohol burn. Just a little hint of stem in the tannins.
Name: Dusted Valley 2006 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel fermented in neutral French oak, with minimal lees stirring. This is very tart, lemon juice is the dominant flavor, with some sour peach/stone fruit character also. This might be a surprise winner with oysters; it's sharp and tart rather than fat or alcoholic—despite 14.7% listed alcohol. Tasting room exclusive.
Name: Hogue 2007 Terroir Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Judean Hills, Israel
Description: It seems that this wine has seen better days, and probably had a bit more life and zest when it was first released. The aromatic nose offers notes of mashed banana, overripe nectarine, lychee nectar and crushed sweet pea petals, while the mouth delivers little flavor to the palate and lies rather flat. Might pair nicely with citrus-based desserts; drink immediately.
Name: Psagot 2006 Kosher Viognier (Judean Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lemon oil and candle wax add interesting nuances to the citrusy, barrel-fermented fruit. There was no malolactic fermentation; it's bone dry and the acids are all natural and smooth. Delicate hints of toast and honeyed almonds bring still more depth and flavor interest to the juicy citrusfruit.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The newest vintage ramps up the complexity of this wine, while keeping the fruit front and center. Good concentrated flavors run through all the citrus and into the stone fruits; there is just a hint of cardboard on the end. Light toast is there if you look for it.
Name: Watermill 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This may be one of the most austere Viogniers I've ever found from Washington; it's bone dry and just a bit over 13% alcohol. That makes it a good and versatile wine for mealtime. It's light, hints at beeswax and citrus, with a soft mouthfeel and a curious mix of toasted almond, banana andbutter cookies in the finish.
Name: Wilridge 2006 Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There is a pleasing creaminess to the mouthfeel, yet the wine retains well-defined green apple and citrus fruit flavors. Where many Viogniers are bitter and hot at the finish line, this one is like sucking on a creamsicle.
Name: Zerba Cellars 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Coastal Region, South Africa
Description: Minerally slate and sultry apricot and peach start this elegant white. A waxy palate and soft, feminine flavors of honeysuckle and flowers—as well as a burst of fruit—give the wine a rich but pretty character.
Name: Brampton 2007 Viognier (Coastal Region)

Appellation: Paarl, South Africa
Description: This stylish white offers delicate peach and lemon aromas and a combination of zippy citrus and warming spice on the palate. Approachable but complex, the wine offers power and grace.
Name: Backsberg 2005 Babylons Toren Viognier (Paarl)

Appellation: Swartland, South Africa
Description: A dancing, lively nose of citrus and slate is balanced by more lush aromas of tropical fruit and peach here. Full-bodied guava and pineapple flavors have a touch of floral elegance here, and a spiced backbone. Unique and pretty.
Name: Spice Route 2007 Viognier (Swartland)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine opens pleasantly with floral scents over tangy citrus fruit, especially lime. It's tart and juicy, but it seems to close down in the back, and there is an impression of light toast, unexpected in a Viognier.
Name: Chatter Creek 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Once the SO2 blows off, there are scents of light citrus and toasted cracker. There are intriguing notes of almond and beeswax, but mainly the flavors show not quite ripe green and yellow fruits that mostly taste like unripe banana.
Name: Merry Cellars 2006 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Western Cape, South Africa
Description: This wine gives a big, ripe nose and flavors of apricot, honey and melon, with balanced fruit and acid and a clean but rounded character. Full bodied and complex with a lingering finish.
Name: Blue Cove 2007 Viognier (Western Cape)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Warm and peachy, this fruit-bomb of a Viognier will appreciate a good chill. Served at an appropriate temperature, the luscious mix of stone and tropical fruits is set up properly; otherwise it starts to feel a little soft, and there's a bit too much of a burn in the finish. There's a hint of a metallic underpinning, giving it a lingering flavor of canned peaches.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2007 Reserve Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This was picked at the same time as the regular Viognier, but fermentation was stopped, leaving it as a sweet wine (about 4.8% r.s.). The fruit is laced with honey, lime and apricot; it's delicious without being cloying.
Name: Chandler Reach 2007 Dessert Wine Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Effusively fruity, forward and luscious, this over-the-top Viognier is a bowlful of fruit salad. You name it, it's here —citrus, stone and tropical fruits in generous abundance. Backed by moderate acids, the wine is just this side of flabby, so drink up and enjoy it at its youthful best. What elevates the winemaking is the (apparent) use of new oak, which adds cinnamon, coffee and sweet spice at the back.
Name: Walter Dacon 2007 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sharp, spicy and crisply defined with citrus fruits and skins. The skin flavors really punch through and add power to the midpalate. May have some Picpoul in the blend (to cut the alcohol?).
Name: McCrea 2007 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a hot, sandy site in the heart of the Wahluke Slope, this was barrel fermented in neutral oak. The aromas are an inviting mélange of spice, clove, lime and light tropical fruits, and the wine has natural poise and balance. Green apple, lime and peach come into play, along with streaks of butterscotch.
Name: Bunnell 2007 Talcott Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: These are purchased grapes from Kestrel. The wine is bright and fresh, with crisp aromas of citrus and white peach, and flavors that follow. There is barely perceptible sweetness, more an absence of bitterness. In sum, this is a perfect patio sipping wine.
Name: Chandler Reach 2007 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An elegant Viognier, this first release from a young Lake Chelan vineyard has unusual delicacy for this often-bitter grape. At a moderate 13% alcohol, it shows lemon and lime rind, pink grapefruit and just a hint of white peach flavors. It finishes dry, and despite its lightness, it has a nice grip and persistence through the finish as well as firm acidity. Could be a gem with fresh oysters.
Name: Nefarious 2007 Defiance Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The blend is 85% Viognier and 15% Roussanne, and finishes off-dry with 1.5% residual sugar. A slight blush color and mixed fruit flavors of melon and pear carry the wine, which has a definite sugary sweetness in the mouth. There is also an impression of celery, believe it or not, making for an unusual mix that will intrigue some tasters, and confuse others.
Name: Maison Bleue 2007 Notre Vie Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Right out of the glass, this wine broadcasts classic Viognier scents of citrus blossom, citrus rind and, well, citrus fruit. It's forward and expressive, a bit on the sweet and sugary side, but that goes a long way to cut the bitterness that many Viogniers have in the finish. Drink it well chilled, preferably with hot, spicy foods.
Name: Maryhill 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the first sniff you know it's Viognier and you can't wait to splash around in it—it's just got that indefinable mix of flower, perfume, citrus rind and stone fruit that typifies the finest Washington Viogniers. The flavors are beautifully defined, racy and sharp, walking the high wire between bitter and hot with amazing grace and dexterity.
Name: Novelty Hill 2006 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An extraordinarily intense style of Viognier, whose flavors cut deep. The sharp, edgy, focused core of lime and citrus fruits seem to last forever, supported by laser-like acids and a tongue-cleaning minerality. There is nothing bitter or hot in the finish; it's just a super-dense and beautifully varietal Viognier from one of Washington's best white wine producers.
Name: Rulo 2006 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Cailloux vineyard Viognier is dense and viscous, with powerful flavors of peach and apricot. They spread out from the ripe core into details of lemon rind, beeswax, marmalade, light honey and an aftertaste of rocky minerality. The fruit flavors just keep on coming, finally leading to lightly tropical with a butterscotch chaser.
Name: Cayuse 2006 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From a single vineyard; this is fermented in neutral oak. It's wonderfully pure, fruity, and forward, with a lovely bouquet of acacia, lemon/lime and lightly tropical passionfruit. Though fresh and fruit-powered, it is not at all a simple wine; in fact, it's quite intense.
Name: K Vintners 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dineen vineyard grapes are the star here. All stainless fermentation yields a crystalline, transparent, graceful wine with subtle notes of lime, pineapple and dried apricot. It's bone dry, but the whiff of honeysuckle in the nose adds appealing sweetness to the finish.
Name: Stevens Divio 2007 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Description: Although designated as a humble table wine, this Viognier (claimed to be the only one in Austria) achieves far more. With its touch of wood aging, it shows all the apricot flavors, pepper and weight of the grape, balanced by the cool-climate edge from its terroir. Ideally, it should age for 2–3 years.
Name: Graf Hardegg 2005 V Viognier (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: From Willow Crest (Yakima Valley) fruit, this is done in a lighter style for Washington Viognier, and it shows an elegant precision to the mix of flavors and spices. Beeswax, lemon oil, hints of honeysuckle and scents and flavors of flowers flow gracefully through to the harmonious finish, without ever turning oily or hot.
Name: Stephenson Cellars 2006 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From estate grapes, this ripe (14.7% alcohol) Viognier is loaded with green apple, lime, grapefruit and pear skin flavors. The fruit is set up by firm acids, and there is a suggestion of honeycomb in the finish. Balanced and crisp, it walks the delicate line that the best Viogniers do; hinting at bitter without being unpleasant, and ripening the fruit without becoming either hot or flabby.
Name: Abeja 2007 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Lush and barrel fermented, this rich Viognier is scented with peaches, orange peel and fresh-baked brioche. The acids are soft and rich, adding depth to the toasty finish. The fruit turns into a sort of orange marmalade, yet retains a crisp, lightly bitter edge.
Name: Seven Hills 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Viognier from the Horse Heaven Hills; it's all stainless fermented and aged. Done in a light, crisp, elegant style, it tastes a bit gin-like and spicy, leaving a fresh impression all the way through the melony finish. Excellent winemaking from this young winery.
Name: Sweet Valley Wines 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Full, ripe wine from an estate owned by the Seysses family of Domaine Dujac in Burgundy. Peach and lime flavors come together in a broad brush of fruit, warm and rich.
Name: Domaine de Triennes 2006 Sainte Fleur Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Citrus rind and grapefruit fruit flavors are set against more floral highlights. It's as refreshing as a gin and tonic, and even carries a hint of quinine flavor in the finish. The wine is sturdy and consistent through the middle and finishes with a gentle fade.
Name: William Church 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: French oak fermentation and sur lie aging give this wine just a hint of toast and softness in the mouth. It is just at 14% alcohol, which keeps it from getting either too bitter or too hot in the finish. It's downright elegant, with a refreshing light touch that is all too often missing from Viognier.
Name: Watermill 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This barrel fermented Viognier delivers an intense nose mixing scents of flowers (lily of the valley), lime skin, green pineapple and a dash of papaya. Cool, crisp and utterly delicious, it is a perfect sipping wine, elegantly structured and under 14% alcohol.
Name: Viento 2006 Lonesome Spring Ranch Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A sharply defined, racy Viognier, this cuts right through with a mix of pine needle, citrus rind and pineapple. It should be served chilled and would be a fine accompaniment to grilled prawns, spicy noodles or anything with jalapeños.
Name: Valley View 2006 Anna Maria Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Picked late and fermented on native yeast, this Viognier brings some snap and spice to its scents and flavors. The lime and quinine quality recalls a good gin and tonic; it definitely leans to the herbal rather than the tropical side of Viognier, but is crisp and refreshing.
Name: Morrison Lane 2006 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Texturally it's pretty good. The acidity is there and the feel is more or less good. But the flavors are impossible to associate with Viognier; there's no flower blossom, lychee, candle wax, nothing. Instead, it's generic warm-climate white wine with a slight pickled character.
Name: Mil Piedras 2006 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Stainless-steel fermentation and picking the grapes at a relatively low brix (24.2) yields a crisp wine with lime skin, grapefruit and hints of quinine. The opening flavors extend into a mid-palate cut with tart acids and adding white peach, melon and nectarine to the fruit. It finishes bone dry, like a twist of lemon.
Name: Abacela 2007 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: New Mexico, New Mexico, US
Description: The nose on this wine is instantly exciting, with its playful, floral and fresh character. On the palate, honeyed spice stays light and lively, with a lingering finish. A good white that will pair well with spicy cuisine—think Indian, Chinese or Thai.
Name: Casa Rondeña Winery 2007 Viognier (New Mexico)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharply scented with lime and grapefruit, this aggressive wine brings some bitter phenolics front and center. Right behind you will find bright fruit flavors mixing pineapple, orange and lime, with plenty of acid. This is not one of the gentler Viogniers, but would be fine served chilled and accompanied by spicy foods.
Name: Del Rio 2006 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: This is a fresh, approachable style of Viogner, offering a combination of apple, honey and toast on the nose and balanced flavors of curvy fruit and flowers on the palate. The viscous mouthfeel and lingering finish give the wine an opulent appeal. Not terribly complex, but good overall.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2006 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: Cochise County, Arizona, US
Description: Honey and toasted spice aromas are followed by an elegant balance of curvy fruit and acid in this stylish Viognier from Arizona. The viscous mouthfeel and honeyed finish add to the package. Pair this with a good curry or spicy Chinese dish for an interesting balance.
Name: Dos Cabezas 2006 Viognier (Cochise County)

Appellation: Grand Valley, Colorado, US
Description: The nose on this Viognier is a touch off and slightly green, and on the palate, thin flavors lack the curvy allure of the variety. Still, the wine has a clean character and overall easy drinking quality that recommends it.
Name: Garfield Estates 2007 V° Viognier (Grand Valley)

Appellation: Adelaide Hills, South Australia, Australia
Description: This doesn't have the sheer breadth of many Australian Viogniers, but it offers more structure and length on the palate. Vibrant lemon-lime and pineapple aromas set the stage for flavors of tropical fruit and lemon custard. There's a slightly creamy texture and a lingering finish. Imported by Tom Eddy Wines.
Name: The Lane 2006 Estate Grown Viognier (Adelaide Hills)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: A pleasant surprise, this budget-priced Viognier shows plenty of plump fruit without getting overly big or blowsy. Citrus and pineapple flavors reflect the moderate alcohol levels, finishing on a juicy, succulent note. Drink now.
Name: Tall Poppy 2006 Reserve Viognier (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Pemberton, Western Australia, Australia
Description: This starts off a little reductive, with tarry, burnt-rubber aromas that are frankly offputting. But a aeration works wonders, and this wine opens up to reveal hints of toasted almonds, melon and citrus, all supported by a crisp finish. Imported by American Wine Distributors.
Name: Fonty's Pool 2006 Single Vineyard Viognier (Pemberton)

Appellation: South Australia, South Australia, Australia
Description: This is a full-bodied, fruit-laden wine that sells for a bargain price. Guava, citrus and peach flavors mix on the palate, which features low acidity and a dusting of tannins that adds a touch of grip to the off-dry finish. Drink now. Imported by Trinchero Vineyards.
Name: Angove's 2006 Nine Vines Viognier (South Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This has been 10% barrel fermented and aged for about two months. There's a hint of barrel toast but it's very light; the varietal character is nicely displayed. Crisp acidity and a strong citrus mix of orange blossom and lemon rind flavors define the midpalate, leading into pineapple and grapefruit as it winds through the finish. Nice bottle!
Name: Whitman Cellars 2007 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Rather broad in the mouth without being particularly weighty or rich, with restrained aromatics of apricot and spice and flavors of melon, apricot and pepper. Drink now; the 2007 tasted out of tank looks significantly more interesting. Imported by Routas USA.
Name: Château Routas 2006 Coquelicot Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Waxy but also plenty acidic, which creates some clash on the bouquet. Flavors of lemon, orange and peach meet a little bitterness on the finish, and overall this won't be confused for French Viognier. It's scattershot and unique, but it has finishing harmony and a pretty good texture.
Name: Cono Sur 2006 Visión Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Funky, big and buttery, with an oily texture. This has some traditional Viognier qualities such as gardenias and stewed peaches, but it's also lacking that exotic edge. All totaled it's heavy and bawdy, but there's enough edge to make it worth a go. Imported by Baystate Wine Co.
Name: Viu Manent 2007 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Loaded with ripe peaches and apricots, honey and jasmine, this was picked at 42 brix and is technically an ice wine though not labeled such. It's just this side of syrupy, but quite luscious and silky smooth.
Name: Syncline 2006 Late Harvest Viognier (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Creamy peach and vanilla aromas are perfectly attractive, as is the palate. There's plenty of peach, mango and citrus pith flavors to make it worthy, and the finish is long and citrusy. Surprisingly good given the paltry price and Argentina's dearth of success with Viognier.
Name: Santa Julia 2007 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This aromatic wine has a strong floral scent that opens into more typical notes of tart lime skin and pineapple. It continues with similar palate impressions, then leaves a somewhat oily aftertaste, like a swallow of perfume.
Name: Troon 2006 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This concentrated wine leads with citrus and stone fruits, and a lightly peppery mouthfeel. Leesy and creamy and textural, it's generously loaded with flavors of lime and grapefruit, stone and fresh herb. This is a subtle and very refreshing Viognier.
Name: Mark Ryan 2006 Conner Lee Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Viognier, different from the winery's varietally labeled version in that it is 100% stainless-steel fermented. The result is a less round and toasty wine, but one that, in this vintage at least, offers more focus and precision. Peach and apricot, tangerine and tropical fruits are on display, and the finish winds down gently, with none of the heat or bitterness that can affect some Viogniers.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2006 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Complex Asian pear and citrus fruit is nicely detailed with notes of orange rind, fennel and spice. The fruit is perfectly ripe, round and fleshy. The acids are natural and the alcohol has been kept to just under 14%.
Name: Mark Ryan 2006 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Vignobles de France, France Other, France
Description: A blend of fruit from the northern Rhône and Languedoc creates a deliciously spicy, fragrant Viognier with plenty of apricot and orange flavors touched with vanilla. Rich, rounded and finely balanced.
Name: Chamarré 2005 Grande Réserve Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays Vignobles de France)
Region: Vin de Pays Vignobles de France

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The wine is built around flavors of crisp citrus, white peach and green apple fruits, wrapped in a pleasing minerality. It's all quite fresh and nicely textured. Just a bit of citrus rind enlivens the lengthy finish.
Name: McCrea 2006 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is 100% Viognier, offering focus and precision. Peach and apricot, tangerine and tropical fruits are on display, and the finish winds down gently, with none of the heat or bitterness that can affect some Viogniers.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2006 L'Artiste Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Rapel Valley, Chile
Description: Not your usual warm-climate Viognier. It has typical buttercup, acacia and honeysuckle notes, but since it was only 20% barrel fermented it isn't a thick wine. Instead the focus is on apricot, white raisin and citrus flavors. Not yet in the U.S. market but hopefully it'll arrive soon.
Name: Anakena 2007 Single Vineyard Viognier (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The fruit carries considerable sweetness, although the wine is probably under 1% RS. Peach, apricot and lemon drop candy flavors fill the mouth, with supporting acidity. The reserve designation suggests a much bigger wine; this is not that, but it is balanced and has surprising concentration and length.
Name: Mount Baker 2005 Reserve Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is Viognier treated as Chardonnay, which is to say barrel fermented and put through a percentage of malolactic fermentation, then aged on the lees for eight months. The floral and citrus character is damped back, and the wine acquires an unusual softness, rounding out what can sometimes be a bitterness in the finish. The 2006 lacks the pure hedonism of the 2005.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2006 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia
Description: Broad and pleasantly textural, even if it doesn't show the brash, flamboyant Viognier aromatics you might expect. It's spicy and toasty, showing good energy and freshness on the finish.
Name: De Bortoli 2006 Estate Grown Viognier (Yarra Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Peachy, thick, almost viscous, with some lemon tea flavors adding interest. These are still young vines, but already showing good potential in this emerging wine region.
Name: Tildio 2006 Estate Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite dry and tannic, with leafy flavors and a hint of lemon. Some orange peel and spice fills out the midpalate, as the wine breathes and gathers itself. It's a wine for tea lovers, with the same mix of citrus, leaf and chalky tannin.
Name: William Church 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a light and (for Viognier) low alcohol style, with somewhat thin fruit flavors of apple and nectarine. It's finished dry and carries through to a pleasant, though rather generic finish. It's perfectly serviceable, but it does not have the snap and focus of the better Washington Viogniers.
Name: Columbia Winery 2006 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Peachy and fat, with a soft middle and some bitter phenolics in the finish.
Name: Desert Wind 2006 Desert Wind Vineyard Bare Naked Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This thin, light effort carries flavors of baby aspirin, or orange candy. It's one dimensional, bearing little varietal character.
Name: Bridgeview 2006 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This meaty, substantial wine was barrel fermented in neutral oak and hints at oxidation, particularly in terms of its dusty, tawny color. Clocking in at 14.9% alcohol, it definitely shows some heat on the finish. But it's a full-bodied style with immediate appeal, lush with candied fruit flavors, streaks of butter and toasted nuts. Its weight and mouthfeel are very much like a ripe Chardonnay, but with added perfume and precision.
Name: Gamache 2006 Velida Estate Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is sharply perfumed, with an edgy, tight consistency that seems to emphasize both the floral and the bitter rind aspects of the grape. Viognier can fall off a cliff rapidly, and this latest vintage, though complex and complicated, has a hot intensity that pulls in the bitterness and loses the citrus. If that's the style you like, this is a fine, concentrated and intense rendition.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An interesting blend that incorporates 12% Sémillon with the Viognier. The Bordeaux grape adds weight and smoothes out the Viognier, which tends to be hot and sharp. What you end up with is a slightly buttery white blend that could go well with a variety of spicy dishes.
Name: Zerba Cellars 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A pleasing rush of peaches, apricots, orange peel and lime greets the palate, as you first taste this young Viognier from the Milbrandt Vineyards in Washington's hot climate Wahluke Slope AVA. This wine has been deftly handled, accenting the lushness of the fruit, minimizing the phenolics, and giving weight and nuance to the midpalate. There's a hint of honey and toast as well, and the 14.2% alcohol feels just right.
Name: Seven Hills 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is quite delicious, bright and tasting of fresh-squeezed oranges and tangerines. Fruity, forward and lush, it's really quite charming. The aromas convey light hints of rose petals, jasmine and honey; the fruit an intriguing mix of ripe pear, papaya and apricot.
Name: Walter Dacon 2006 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Kestrel has Viognier dialed in, and this excellent follow-up to the 2005 is right up the same alley, vibrant with citrus oil, gin and tonic, lime and grapefruit. It's racy and slick, and it slides down quite easily with a finishing kick that invites the next glass.
Name: Kestrel 2006 Estate Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Scents of beeswax and lemon tea open into a pretty, lemon-drop flavor set. Winemaker Steve Lessard has softened the sometimes bitter phenolics of the grape, so the fruit flavors, though not quite tropical, are ripe and smooth as they open up. Hints of pineapple, lemon and grapefruit mingle to create a user-friendly, approachable wine.
Name: Whitman Cellars 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: McLaren Vale, South Australia, Australia
Description: Hamilton calls Viognier, “the most difficult grape to grow,” but this is a very good New World version. It's floral and citric upfront, with hints of peppery spice, then builds on the palate to add flavors of peach and melon. Drink now. Multiple U.S. importers.
Name: Hugh Hamilton 2006 The Loose Cannon Viognier (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The emphasis here is squarely on the fruit, which is fresh and varietal, carrying flavors of apricot, peach and apple. Pleasing aromas support the impression of ripe stone fruit, with moderate alcohol and none of the bitterness that Viognier can show in the finish.
Name: Covington 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From Clifton and Coyote Canyon vines, this tastes of quinine, lime and citrus; it's sharp, fragrant and quite young. The finish falls off into hot, acidic, slightly bitter phenolics, but improves as it breathes. It's one of those gin and tonic-style Viogniers that pack plenty of flavor but turn a little harsh at the end.
Name: Syncline 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is an interesting take on Viognier, relatively low in alcohol (13%) but quite sweet, at almost 2% residual sugar. The sweetness takes away a fair amount of the interesting citrus character of the grape, and seems to dumb it down a bit, but it might fit in well with spicy Asian dishes.
Name: Maryhill 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Suffers from the common new winery kinds of faults. Overpriced for the competition; there are odd, off scents suggesting hay, honey, and yeast. It feels awkward on the palate, disjointed and incomplete.
Name: Tertulia 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As before, the new vintage of Chatter Creek Viognier treats you immediately to bracingly fresh scents of peach, apricot and ripe melon. Tart and leesy, immaculately clean, it starts with crisp, slightly bitter notes of lime and citrus, then fans out, adding a creamy texture to the mid-palate. This is a moderate 13.5% alcohol, rare in Washington Viognier.
Name: Chatter Creek 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The cool-climate fruit provides the bracing aromas, the lively texture, the crispness without bitterness, and fruit that doesn't veer into overripe peach or apricot. It's got an edge to it, but it's very clean, stylish and polished, with a nice level of intensity that has no bitter, hot or volatile elements.
Name: K Vintners 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The winery does well with this wine, which once again seems to carry all the right stuff, a pleasing mix of lime and grapefruit, Meyer lemon and meringue, nuanced with ginger spice. Full and long-lasting, it is one of the richest Viogniers in the state.
Name: Kestrel 2005 Estate Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bergevin Lane has a fine track record with their Viogniers. This new vintage includes grapes from Willow Crest and Lonesome Spring, two excellent growers, and incorporates 11% Roussanne in the final blend. The oak influence is subtle and appropriate, lending a light streak of butterscotch to the finish. There's an elegant spicy note and overall, it's a sophisticated, understated, most enjoyable wine.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: all the RiverAerie whites, this has been made to maximize the freshness and cleansing acidity. It's crispy crunchy, limned with lime and finishes with wet stone.
Name: RiverAerie 2006 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Stainless fermented, finished in neutral barrels. Talcott is a warm site, which produces a completely different expression of the grape from the winery's other Viognier. In fact, this is more like a ripe, rich Chardonnay, buttery and round, with toast and butterscotch flavors supporting the tight, citrus (lime, grapefruit) edge.
Name: Bunnell 2006 Talcott Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This smells exactly as Viognier should: citrus peel, grapefruit and pineapple fruit, lifted with some high tones, and filling out the palate without ever becoming too soft or flabby. It does get a bit diffuse in the back half; still tasty but not quite as sharp and focused.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2006 Reserve Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp and bitter, this is an edgy version of Viognier. Citrus peel leads into a thin middle and a finish that seems tannic and hard.
Name: Del Rio 2005 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Very melony and full of pineapple: ripe is the main word used to describe this full-bodied, weighty rendition of Viognier and whatever else makes the blend. Overall it has bold, fat apricot and peach flavors along with a lip-smacking, somewhat cumbersome finish. Drink as soon as possible to preserve maximum stone-fruit character.
Name: Viu Manent 2006 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: A touch rough and oily initially, but later on you get punchbowl aromas followed by banana, lemon and melon flavors. There's both weight and acidity to the palate, but also some flatness and a lack of focus. Not a commonplace wine.
Name: Cono Sur 2006 The Southern Cone Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light, spritzy wine; it could almost qualify as frizzante. The light citrus flavors start out fine, then become rough and vegetal.
Name: Melrose 2006 Viognier (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Here and there you'll find a very well-made Argentine Viognier because the country's warmth and the grape can go together. A case in point is this plump, lush specimen that sports developed lemon and orange flavors and a long, acid-propelled finish.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2006 Finca La Linda Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Virginia, Virginia, US
Description: Château Morrisette hits the mark again with this fragrant, floral wine. Round and full on the mouth, the wine has ample acidity to keep the honeyed, tropical fruit flavors from overpowering. A lovely effort with real class.
Name: Chateau Morrisette 2005 Viognier (Virginia)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: With varietally correct aromas and nice overall balance, this ranks as a solid, fairly legitimate Argentine Viognier. Hailing from warmer San Juan province, this is a citrus- and honey-based white with size, spice and mouthfeel. For the most part it gets things right.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2006 Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Round, simple and easy to enjoy if you don't mind a lack of Viognier typicity replaced by chunky apple aromas and flavors. There's also some citrus and apricot to bulk up the flavor profile. Overall it's a full-bodied but indifferent white. Drink right away for best results.
Name: Santa Julia 2005 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Ohio, Ohio, US
Description: Typical, elegant flavors of honey, tropical fruit and apricot pervade this wine, which is lead by a full-bodied nose of white flowers. The mouthfeel is measured and not as heavy as some Viogniers, and the finish lingering.
Name: Hermes 2006 Estate Bottled Viognier (Ohio)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Guigal's Condrieu is a blend of oak- and steel-fermented lots to help preserve some of the Viognier's freshness. The 2005 is a success, featuring scents of honeysuckle and apricot and a touch of toast. It's reasonably rich on the palate, coating the mouth with ripe, peachy flavors, finishing with credible length. Drink now.
Name: E. Guigal 2005  Condrieu

Appellation: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A blend of barrel- and tank-fermented wine, this is an attractively floral and fresh Viognier intended for early drinking. There's a hint of honeyed richness to the apricot and pineapple flavors, but it finishes clean and refreshing. Drink now–2008.
Name: Michel & Stéphane Ogier 2006 La Rosine Viognier (Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes)
Region: Vin de Pays des Collines Rhodaniennes

Description: A rare find in Austria, this shows the potential of Viognier. Flavors of apricot liqueur, summer flower aromas, and concentration come together to make a rich, powerful wine. Because Viognier is not approved as a varietal in Austria, this is sold as a non-vintage table wine, but in fact this wine is from the 2004 vintage.
Name: Graf Hardegg NV V Viognier (Austria)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Spicy and packed with mixed citrus peel, tangerine, white peach, stone fruit, mineral and licorice. This really delivers the full complement of varietal flavors, in a well-structured, tartly crisp wine.
Name: Dusted Valley 2005 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This opens with a very pretty nose composed of rose petals, pear, orange peel and orange liqueur. Soft and pretty, it shows the feminine side of Viognier, avoids the bitterness and excessive alcohol that can detract from its elegance. A lovely springtime apéritif.
Name: Di Stefano 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wellington, South Africa
Description: Spicy, fresh and floral, the nose on this Viognier immediately marks it as a wine to be savored. On the palate, it's lighter and fresher than the typical Viognier, with its white peach and lemon, but still full of dimension. Balanced acids keep it dancing on the tongue. Pair with chicken or fish.
Name: Eventide Cellar 2006 Viognier (Wellington)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Hits the nose with sharp, penetrating, spicy aromas that indicate a lively and authoritative wine. It doesn't disappoint, delivering a flavorful mix of tropical and citrus fruits, highlighted with grapefruit peel and light herb.
Name: Dobbes Family Estate 2004 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though similar in style to the winery's 2005 Viognier, this edition lacks the complexity and aromatic detail. There's plenty of acid to cut through the 1.1% residual sugar, but something is lost in that equation. Rather than cutting through with Viognier's characteristic mix of floral, citrus and stone fruits, this just tastes like a basic white, peachy and slightly sweet.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2006 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Clare Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: Floral on the nose, this captures Viognier's elusive fragrance in a peachy, spiced wine that's plump but not overly heavy.
Name: Pikes 2006 Gill's Farm Viognier (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Grapes are sourced from top vineyards such as Elerding and Milbrandt, and the wine is given 100% barrel fermentation. This is a rich, ripe, almost unctuous style of Viognier, and it is impossible to resist. Lush, creamy and loaded with tropical fruits, it fills the mouth with warm, round fruit, and sails into a lingering finish of bananas and cream.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2005 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Superripe, supersaturated style with rich, thick flavors of pear, peach and papaya, enlivened with cinnamon and toasted coconut spice. This is very well made, and carries its heft with grace and a certain amount of precision. The nose is exceptionally complex, layered with tropical fruits, citrus, mint, exotic spices and more. The finish lingers sensuously.
Name: Hudson Shah 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Planted in 1999, the estate Viognier is ripening well, and Kestrel doesn't hold back on the winemaking. Barrel fermented and left sur lie for nine months, this is exceptionally rich and buttery. It skates along the edge of volatility, but the intense flavors of lemon, lime, pineapple and tropical fruits make this irresistible.
Name: Kestrel 2004 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean, fresh fruit captures crisp apples, nectarines and Meyer lemon. The wine shows more elegance and delicate floral notes than most Viognier from warmer sites, and it has none of the bitterness or heat that can spoil the finish on these wines. Bone dry, it's a lovely food wine.
Name: C.R. Sandidge 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This 100% Viognier is given a no-malo, 100% stainless steel  regimen, which produces an elegant and steely style of Viognier.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2005 L'Artiste Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Cougar Hills vineyard, this soft, fruity Viognier is done in a Chardonnay style. The fruit is tropical and broad, and there is a strong toasty, nutty finish to it, from the aging in new French oak. It's a friendly, approachable style, though not necessarily one that showcases the unique qualities of Viognier.
Name: Whitman Cellars 2005 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is solid, juicy viognier, with pleasing texture and plenty of spice. The fruit is thick and mixes pear, apple and pineapple with hints of lime. Some heat can be felt in the finish—this is not a shy wine—but the winery has done an excellent job with the fruit.
Name: Cristom 2005 Estate Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: Victoria Angove credits Yalumba with doing much of the pioneering work with this variety in Australia; this is Angove's first commercial release, coming in at 3,000 cases. It's a full, buxom version of Viognier, with full-blown stone fruit flavors bolstered by ample alcohol and touches of spice and honeysuckle. Good value.
Name: Angove's 2006 Nine Vines Viognier (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A showstopper! This intense wine sports an unusual mix of scents—wood, flower, fruit candy and menthol mint. There's a resinous quality that lifts the palate, and a honeyed toastiness wrapped into a wine of extraordinary concentration.
Name: Townshend 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thick and fleshy, with ripe flavors of fig, pear and baked apple, with exceptional balance for its weight. The spice is lightly sensed, as is the toasty influence of the barrel fermentation. It's a complex, creamy take on Viognier, and clearly the best wine this winery makes.
Name: Goose Ridge 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's 100% Viognier, a light blush/tawny color, and all neutral barrel fermented. Winemaker James Mantone calls Viognier “the white Pinot Noir” due to the difficulty of making it well, without bitterness or what he terms “muskiness.” This is round and fruity, with scents of fig and peach and apricot, and the flavors follow. It sets a consistent note that it holds through a long, clean finish.
Name: Syncline 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though barrel fermented and given eight months sur lie, this does not show excessive oak flavoring. Rather it has intense, forward fruit, emphasis on lime-driven citrus, accented with honeysuckle. It's still young and sharp, and finishes with a bit of heat but with food it settles down and works very well.
Name: à Maurice Cellars 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine goes right to the top of the heap to stand with the best Washington viogniers. The fruit is from Ciel du Cheval on Red Mountain, and winemaker Mark McNeilly has framed it in his own distinctive style. Big but not heavy, lush and textural, it's slathered in flavors of pear and caramel, with a lightly honeyed finish. Just 100 cases were produced.
Name: Mark Ryan 2005 Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A thoroughly delicious, glorious mix of melon, lime, pineapple and apple; the fruits—which were whole cluster pressed—just blend beautifully, with no trace of heat or bitterness. The finish wraps into a light butterscotch and lemon candy flavor; wonderfully satisfying.
Name: Abeja 2005 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Viognier seems much more balanced than previous vintages, and though it packs a lot of fruit power into its mid-palate, the flavor details are what elevate it into the 90-point range. Spice, rind, pear skin and even a whiff of fresh cut tobacco can be found in the lovely bouquet. The fruit suggests white peach and citrus, and the finish never becomes hot or clumsy.
Name: McCrea 2005 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Viognier (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The second vintage of Viognier for JM, it's mostly Stillwater Creek fruit, with 6% Ciel du Cheval Roussanne. A lovely spicy nose starts it off, with sweet apricot, cooked peach and cinnamon notes. It's a rich, ripe and creamy style of Viognier, spotted with spicy ginger. Unusual but well made and delicious. The gingerbread finish is quite distinctive.
Name: JM Cellars 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Produced from selected barrels of Viognier, Laurent Miquel considers this his premium white wine. It does seem to have all the exotic apricot and peach flavors of the grape, although a little less wood would have allowed them to be more expressive. But it's still a fine, full, but still elegant wine.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2005 Verité Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: The rows in Laurent Miquel's Viognier vineyard run north-south (Nord Sud), avoiding the midday sun but getting the gentler morning and evening heat. The wine has balance, with elegance and a good touch of acidity to lift full white and yellow fruit flavors.
Name: Laurent Miquel 2005 Nord Sud Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A highly perfumed wine, with flowery aromas. Full of pear and other ripe fruit flavors, it is a fat, food-friendly wine with just a touch of acidity. Great value for a Viognier.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2005 La Violette Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is very tart, no frills, for acid lovers. Bracing, tooth-cleaning lime and grapefruit. Viognier can get hot and overripe; this is much more on the lean, cool, green side.
Name: Willow Crest 2005 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A spicy herbal wine, with a touch of fennel and lemon, along with white fruits. Fresh and ripe but with a definite spicy wood element.
Name: J. & F. Lurton 2005 Les Salices Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Full-bodied in style, this is an example of a Viognier that needs food. Its structure and acidity move away from the white fruits and perfumes, and more to coolness and dryness. There's just a touch of wood, but the fruit dominates.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2005 Viognier Collection Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This is a fresh, lightly perfumed, crisp wine featuring red apple and kiwi fruit flavors. It is poised, elegant, with just a hint of Viognier weight and richness. Not imported.
Name: Sainte-Croix 2005 La Bergerie Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Heady, perfumed aromas give this wine an exotic character. The fruit is rich, well concentrated, touched by apricots but perfumed and soft.
Name: Les Vignerons de Cases de Péne 2005 Ninet de Peña Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
Winery: Les Vignerons de Cases de Péne

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Fresh but lightweight, this wine has pleasant green fruits and crisp acidity. There is some structure, but it seems as if  the fruit wasn't ripe enough.
Name: Patriarche Père et Fils 2005 Viognier Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Whoa! Welcome to Hawaii! This is like a mouthful of the tropics, with everything from coconut oil to banana waffles. Pineapple and peach, mango and hints of honeysuckle are all in the mix, and this aromatic, evocative wine is nicely balanced at 14.1% alcohol. It finishes bone dry, like a twist of lemon.
Name: Abacela 2005 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Spangler (formerly La Garza) is in the central Oregon region that is beginning to show real potential for unusual grapes not generally associated with the state. This is a fine Viognier, cutting and clear, and fragrant with a mix of peach, grapefruit and papaya. Flavorful and restrained, with just a hint of residual sugar.
Name: Spangler Vineyards 2005 Viognier (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
