Description: There's a bit of barrique showing in this wine, but it's nicely integrated with spice and floral notes. It's also given the wine a plump midpalate that's not overdone. Finishes very elegant and long. Drink now, although it should hold a few years.
Name: Domaine Philippe Faury 2004  Condrieu

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Don't tell the appellation contrôlée police, but this is 100% Viognier (not technically permitted under the Côtes-du-Rhône Villages AC), harvested late with ridiculously low yields, then barrel-fermented and -aged. The result is like liquified buttered nuts, honey and dried apricots. Or maybe it's melted orange marmalade, without the sugar. Only made in occasional vintages, this is a treat.
Name: Château Saint Esteve d'Uchaux 1999 Cuvée Thérèse Viognier (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Barrel-fermented, and it shows in the richly toasty and honeyed aromas and creamy texture. It's a round, mouthfilling wine, yet doesn't seem fat or overdone in any way, weaving melon, honey and spice flavors in an ample web of flavor. Long on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Saint Cosme 2004  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A wonderful mélange of honey, orange, apricot and spice; there's a lot of complexity to this wine, all carried by a plump, mouthcoating texture and ample freshness. Delicious now, so why hold it any longer?
Name: Les Vins de Vienne 2004 La Chambée  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A bit richer and spicier than Colombo's St.-Péray, it also shows Viognier's trademark floral notes. The 2004 vintage has imparted great freshness and melon flavors to this wine, which could age another couple of years.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2004 Amour de Dieu  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Made entirely in stainless steel, so the apricot and floral scents of Viognier really stand out in this wine, adding orange and spice elements. But on the palate there's a bit of a disconnect, as the lush fruit vanishes, replaced by chalky, minerally notes.
Name: M. Chapoutier 2005 Invitare  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This 100% Viognier is fermented part in barrel and part in vat, yielding a spicy, fresh and floral bouquet that reflects its varietal character. Medium-bodied, it has a healthy sense of minerality to go with its spice and stone fruit flavors.
Name: Domaine Brusset 2005 Les Clavelles Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône Villages, Rhône Valley, France
Description: As the regulations for Côtes-du-Rhône Villages require a blend of varieties, this is 99% Viognier, says owner Marc Français. It's floral, honeysuckle-scented stuff, with a rich, weighty mouthfeel but still adequate acidity for balance. A slight pithy bitterness creeps in on the finish, but this is still a very good wine.
Name: Château Saint Esteve d'Uchaux 2004 Vionysos Viognier (Côtes du Rhône Villages)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This floral, spice-filled white is Viognier; it just can't advertise that fact on the bottle. It's plump and medium-bodied, with ample peach and melon fruit to support its flowery aromatics. Mouthwatering on the finish, where the slightest touch of pleasant bitterness creeps in.
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2004 Blanc Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This 100% Viognier is a slightly floral, easy-to-drink apéritif. Pear and spice notes dominate, and there's plenty of body, but the acidity is still quite fresh. Drink now.
Name: Château Saint Esteve d'Uchaux 2005 Jeunes Vignes Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This 100% Viognier can't tout that fact on the label, nor does it flaunt it on the nose, which shows apricot and pear notes but not the bold, floral aromas of the variety. On the palate, it's medium-bodied, with warm stone fruit flavors and a touch of spice on the finish.
Name: Domaine Fond Croze 2005 Cuvée Analys Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This blend of 95% Viognier and 5% Roussanne is fat and broad on the palate but not particularly floral or spicy. It's a big, neutral white to serve as an apéritif or with fish.
Name: Domaine Saint Amant 2004 La Borry Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Uruguay, Uruguay
Description: Light on the nose, offering touches of pear, vanilla and spice. Veers toward crisp lime and orange in the mouth, with even more citrus on the finish. Runs juicy and lean, but mostly it's clean.
Name: Dante Irurtia 2004 Posada del Virrey Reserva Viognier (Uruguay)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Smells like a tropical fruit salad, with chunky, flat pineapple in the lead. Diluted melon is the main flavor, with some grapefruit coming on late. Short on texture and depth. Imported by Winesellers Ltd.
Name: Santa Julia 2005 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant and intensely fruity, this thick and slightly hot viognier is loaded with fascinating flavors. Stone fruits galore, and then it morphs into a more buttery, chardonnay-like creature, only keeping the lime rind highlights. Long and rich.
Name: C.R. Sandidge 2004 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Another nicely made Viognier for this up-and-coming winery, the third in a row. Vivid acids define lemon drop fruit flavors. It's a clean, juicy style, with lip-smacking tartness and excellent focus in the midpalate. The finish is long and concentrated, with immaculately pure tasting fruit, and no alcoholic heat or excessive bitterness.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2005 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: As funky a white wine as you're likely to find in Chile, with lean flavors that veer toward pickles and veggies. Maybe it's already losing it because it seems lost. Mouthfeel, however, is an attribute that keeps it afloat.
Name: Viu Manent 2004 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Here is Viognier picked early enough to feature flavors of citrus rind rather than ripe peach. There is also a powerful herbal note, tasting of juniper and quinine, that lays down a spicy spine in the wine. All stainless, no malolactic; it's crisp, precise and laser-like in its focus.
Name: Rulo Winery 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: A very good effort with this tricky grape. Along with the stone-fruit flavors are sweeter streaks of cotton candy and marshmallow. But the candied fruit is lively and not cloying or artificial. The finish is long and clean, with a twist of buttered nuts and creamy vanilla.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2004 Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This limited cuvée has just a bit more plumpness and roundness than the regular 2004, with good varietal spice and the persistence of an exceptional wine. Peach, apricot, sour lemon candy and even a bit of cinnamon strike the palate, with good balance throughout.
Name: Coeur d'Alene 2004 Sarah's Cuvée Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: For some time now this wine has been the measuring stick for Argentine Viognier, and the '05 vintage is one of the best yet. Mineral, melon and peaches coat the bouquet, while the balanced palate is full of sweet melon flavors. This is a warm, ripe, slightly creamy wine that's meant to be drunk as soon as possible, before it loses steam. Imported by Pasternak Wine Imports.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2005 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: Chunky and on the verge of overripe, with soft peach and melon aromas. Additional peach and melon flavors define the overweight palate, while the finish is heavy but flavorful. Tasty stuff with merits, but its lifespan is going to be short. Imported by 57 Main Street Wine Co.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2005 Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The color seems off - an unusually deep gold - and the honeyed nose has a sweaty component. Viognier can go bitter in the finish, and this one does. Two bottles tasted, both exactly the same.
Name: Whidbey Island Winery 2003 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Simple peach flavors sum it up, with a flat, dead mouthfeel and a watery, dilute finish.
Name: Desert Wind 2005 Bare Naked Viognier (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Beautifully fragrant with citrus blossom and beeswax, lime and Meyer lemon. In the mouth it is wonderfully full with white peaches, apricot, citrus rind, hints of gooseberry, some honey and tea flavors also. Long, silky, persistent, clean and pure. In the glass it seems to gain flesh as it smoothes and rounds out; truly a wonderful, silky, voluptuous wine — as good as it gets.
Name: Cayuse 2004 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 91 Waterbrook 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley); $17. Easily one of the best viogniers of the vintage, this juicy, leesy wine is ripe with crisp, fragrant tangerine, guava and tropical fruits. Luscious, tart and snappy, it is plenty ripe without excessive alcohol or any hint of bitterness.
Name: Waterbrook 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Washington, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is fragrant and very pretty with lime/tangerine orange peel citrus scents. On the palate it is soft and smooth, without the bitterness that viognier can show. Very nice effort, a bit light in the back end, but clean and very aromatic all the way through, with flavors of rose petals and orange peel. Delightful bottle, just 13.5% alcohol.
Name: Caterina 2003 Willard Family Vineyard Viognier (Washington)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fragrant with lime, citrus, tangerine and grapefruit. The flavors are taut, tart, spiked with cilantro and anise, in a lively, fresh style. Just 12.5 percent alcohol.
Name: Chatter Creek 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Perfumed, substantial and potent, this shows the typical varietal flavors of orange peel and citrus fruits, with noticeable heat in the finish.
Name: Dusted Valley 2004 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A sweet nose of flowers, passion fruit, pears and perfume leads into a plump, floral/citrus evocation of the grape, kissed lightly with vanilla.
Name: K Vintners 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Thick and peachy, with the weight of Roussanne (19%) married to the elegance of the Viognier (81%), this barrel-fermented, oak-aged wine displays intense fruit flavors of apricot, white peach and citrus. Round and fleshy, it retains sufficient acid to prevent a flabby impression. A nice kiss of vanilla sends it on its way.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very nicely made, as was the initial vintage (2003). Sweet, lingering fruit salad flavors, emphasizing candied lemon and candied lime.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: 360 cases were made of this rich and creamy Viognier. Scents of lemon and lime and rose petals lead into flavors of Meyer lemon, with a custardy mouthfeel. The wine retains a pleasing, citrus/tangerine crispness through the finish.
Name: Syncline 2004 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clean and leesy, but seems to be a lightweight, with flavors of light citrus and a slightly bitter, citrus rind finish. The regular version is much nicer.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2004 Reserve Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This new vintage brings down the alcohol (from 15% to just under 14%) and the price of this pleasant, well-made Viognier. Citrus and apricot fill out the fruity midpalate, and it's a round, peachy wine without any of the bitterness or heat that can plague overripe Viognier. The aromatics are clean and simple; though it does not have the extra dimensions that the best Washington Viogniers can sometimes express, it does not suffer from the flaws the Washington Viogniers can sometimes express.
Name: Abacela 2004 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Floral and light, with encouraging aromas. Doesn't have the glycerol of a Rhône Viognier, but shows nice apple and peach flavors in front of a lightweight but clean finish. Fairly bright and lively, and solid on the surface. Imported by Billington Imports.
Name: Alamos 2004 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Mint and mineral notes are layered delicately over honeyed baked apple aromas in this full-bodied Viognier. Flavors of anise and honeyed stones show a touch of alcohol on the finish, but this is a solid first effort. Imported by Palm Bay Imports.
Name: Circus by L'Ostal Cazes 2004 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Colchagua Valley, Chile
Description: Sweaty on the nose, with pickle and wax bean along with peach and melon. The palate has some kick, and that supports the citrus and apple flavors. Not a lot of acid, so it feels a bit oily and rich. Probably best to drink as soon as possible; it's not made for the long haul.
Name: Viu Manent 2003 Secreto Viognier (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: San Juan, Other, Argentina
Description: Simple and doughy, with plump, sugary aromas of canned pears and applesauce. The palate features soft melon and nectarine, while the finish has punch and some lingering fruit notes. Low in acidity. Imported by 57 Main Street Wine Co.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2004 Viognier (San Juan)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: This full-bodied, muscular wine seems a bit strange for Viognier, which often has a more feminine, floral quality. This is firmly mineral, with notes of chalk and earth and only a hint of melon. Still decent wine, just not very Viognier-like to my tastes. Imported by Palm Bay Imports.
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2003 La Violette Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Maule Valley, Chile
Description: Overloaded with resiny oak, so much so that the fruit is buried. What's left is vanilla and a whole lot of banana. In fact, this wine tastes like the liquid version of Jell-O brand banana pudding.
Name: Valdivieso 2003 Reserve Viognier (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A strange wine with heavy, overripe aromas of burnt grass and melon. No real fruit to hang your hat on, and nothing much in the way of nuance, feel or finish. Made by Luigi Bosca.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2004 Finca La Linda Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From the Lonesome Spring Ranch vineyard, this is very fresh, with juicy citrus and orange peel flavors.
Name: Chatter Creek 2003 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Crisp and citric, this steely style of viognier tastes of green apples, lime and gooseberry. Some slightly bitter citrus skin flavors add interest to the finish, which is lively and hints at oak. But what's the story on the weird little cartoon character on the label?
Name: Hogue 2003 Genesis Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very pale, almost colorless, with some light scents of orange and citrus rind. Spritzy and aggressively tart, this thin wine is too sour to deliver much pleasure.
Name: Terra Blanca 2003 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Condrieu doesn't have to be overpowering, as Vernay, a master of Viognier, demonstrates in this wine. Aromas of almonds, flavors of fresh apricots and white peaches, a lively, vibrant acidity blend well into a poised, elegant wine.  It seems to last for ever in the mouth.
Name: Domaine Georges Vernay 2003 Les Terrasses de l'Empire  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: An exotic, perfumed wine, with aromas of violets and rosewater. To taste, this exoticism goes through to ripe, but elegant fruit. Along with all this, there is a freshness and fruitiness which makes the wine light, fragrant and vibrant.
Name: Domaine Georges Vernay 2002 Coteau de Vernon  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: From a small parcel of 12 acres of Condrieu on the steep slope of the Coteau de Chery, Gilbert Clusel and Brigitte Roch have made a beautifully crafted Condrieu, ripe and unctuous and with wood flavors from barrel fermentation and aging. Honey flavors dominate this delicious wine.
Name: Domaine Clusel-Roch 2003  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Lovely soft, easy fruit, show up the fresh, fragrant style of Condrieu, despite coming from the hot 2003 vintage. Spice and wood show through the flavors of apricots and honey, leaving a smooth, oily texture to finish. This would be great with Asian food.
Name: E. Guigal 2003  Condrieu

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Condrieu also comes in a rarer, sweet style, and here it is, in a wine that is both opulent and exotic. This cuvée de prestige is sweet, certainly, but it has layers of dry botrytis which give it balance. There's also acidity to give the wine a final lift.
Name: Yves Cuilleron 2002 Ayguets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is Cuilleron's top Condrieu, a voluptuous style of wine which is spiced with new wood and packed with flavors of honey, of treacle and white peaches. There is acidity, but it only plays a walk-on part in this big, fat wine.
Name: Yves Cuilleron 2003 Les Chaillets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: From a single parcel, situated just south of Condrieu, this wine takes its name from the fact the vineyard has an almost vertical slope, with a full south exposure. Full of exotic perfumes, it is ripe, with exotic fruits, a taste of violets and light acidity.
Name: Yves Cuilleron 2002 Vertige  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: A high test version at 15% alcohol, this successfully skirts the problems that can plague such wines. The high-toned, complex aromas of rose petals, spice and citrus avoid going volatile; the tropical fruit core never descends into bubble gum, and the bitter citrus rind finish manages to hold onto a sense of appropriate balance. Whew!
Name: Abacela 2003 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine opens with a very appealing bouquet of tropical and citrus scents, highlighted by tangerine and orange peel. The citrus circus continues in the mouth, mixing lemon and lime, orange and mango, with enough acid to keep it lively and the right note of a tannic edge at the borderline.
Name: Griffin Creek 2002 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From 100% estate-grown fruit, this barrel-fermented viognier proves that Oregon has real potential with the grape. This is a big, thick wine, lusciously packed with lime and citrus fruit and rind. Big, alcoholic and fruit-driven, it's definitely a drink-now style.
Name: Cristom 2003 Viognier (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A ripe, spicy wine flavored with spicy wood, honey and apricots, favoring elegance rather than opulence. It comes from a slope outside the village of Chavanay in the heart of Condrieu.
Name: Yves Cuilleron 2003 La Petite Côte  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: A ripe, soft wine, which has a pleasant touch of spicy wood. It is fat and full-bodied, with flavors of apricots and honey. Perhaps not as focused as Condrieu from a cooler vintage than 2003, it is likely to develop over 4-5 years.
Name: Delas Frères 2003 La Galopine  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Odd stuff, with vegetal notes appearing in place of the ripe floral aromas expected of Viognier. Corn, lime and green tomatoes all show up on the nose or in the mouth, along with a slightly oily mouthfeel.
Name: Brotte 2003 Domaine du Versant Doré  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a producer to watch closely, as the plans include a destination winery and inn in the heart of eastern Washington wine country, and the Destiny Ridge vineyard is already showing signs of greatness, despite its youth. Plump, thick, viscous, unctuous even, this wine is packed with ripe pear, citrus and tropical fruit, and finishes with some sweetness, but no rough edges or heat.
Name: Alexandria Nicole 2003 Destiny Ridge Vineyards Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pretty and round, showing characteristic orange peel scents without the volatility that marks so many Washington Viogniers. The fruit is sweet and ripe, with a hint of baby aspirin on the slightly candied finish.
Name: Whitman Cellars 2003 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Smells like a flower garden on a hot, humid day, when the aromas just lay there heavy and thick, like honey. It's a big, flowery wine, expressive of its variety and the warm vintage conditions. It's a trifle short on the finish, but the price makes it a steal.
Name: J. & F. Lurton 2003 Les Salices Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: A solid entry-level Viognier, with pear and ripe apple aromas leading into a full, viscous mouthfeel and ample pear and melon flavors. Finishes with a hint of spice.
Name: Gérard Bertrand 2003 Classic Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Starts with a piercing nose of citrus and pineapple, that leads into a welcome burst of fresh, round, pretty fruit flavors of peach and apricot. No rough edges here, and no heat, just a plump, smooth, pleasing wine.
Name: Dusted Valley 2003 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: South Africa, South Africa
Description: This tasty Viognier hits all the right notes, presenting very appealing honeysuckle-spice aromas and flavors. It's not heavy or sappy, and good acidity supports the fruit. Finishes long and with a very nice blend of spice and mineral notes.
Name: Backsberg 2003 Babylons Toren Viognier (South Africa)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Lively, with young legs. The bouquet blasts forth with lemon curd and ripe apple aromas, which are followed by a plump yet racy palate full of spicy apple, pear and mild mineral notes. Not meant for the long haul.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2004 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A bit of celery interferes with the otherwise clean fruit on the bouquet. Flavors of apple, lemon and lime are sweet and satisfactory. Finishes full, with a grabby feel.
Name: Altas Cumbres 2003 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A full, intense wine, with concentrated scents of perfumed citrus. The flavors are big but balanced, and the wine captures the elegance and power of the grape with perfect symmetry.
Name: Rulo Winery 2003 Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fresh, crisp and flavorful, with a pleasing elegance. The nose mixes citrus blossom and stone, and those elements follow through on the palate. The blend includes 11% Roussanne. Just 188 cases were produced.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2003 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a penetrating, ripe style. It's a nice effort with this difficult grape, big but not blowsy, with nuances of orange peel, citrus, apricot and honeysuckle.
Name: Syncline 2003 Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fairly woody, oaky style, dry and austere, with tart flavors of stone fruits. Lacks the floral character of some Viogniers, but hits the palate with solid, substantial weight and power.
Name: Goose Ridge 2002 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A young, fat, forward style of Viognier, which fills the mouth with concentrated, intense flavors of tropical mango and Juicy Fruit gum.
Name: Maryhill 2003 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Hailing from the high-altitude, rugged Tupungato subregion, this Viognier is purely Argentine in style. Yes, it has true honeysuckle aromas and pure honey flavors, but it's also rather lemony and lean, with a thin midpalate and a tight, light finish.
Name: Alamos 2003 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Fairly light and fruity as a result of only 20% barrel fermentation. Shows lemony, clean aromas and a medium-size body. With just a hint of barrel influence, it's zesty but short. Good for parties.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2003 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Although this wine has little in common with French or Californian Viognier, it's fairly solid yet bland. Toasty, nutty aromas mingle with pear and melon, while in the mouth it tastes of apples and lemon rind. Some pineapple, vanilla and banana are the lasting flavors.
Name: Santa Julia 2002 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A meaty, bold wine, with peach, custard and crushed vitamin comprising the nose. Tastes sweet and cloying, with sugary citrus flavors. A sticky, heavy finish is saturated with tropical fruit and sweet almond candy. The feeling here is that this is too ponderous.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2002 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Makes a strong case for being the best Viognier in Washington. It's not easy to hit the mark with this grape, but here it shows its best. Fragrant with fresh, racy citrus blossom and tangerine scents, lively acidity, and a nice hint of citrus rind on the persistent finish.
Name: McCrea 2001 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A step forward from previous hot, overripe efforts. This is better balanced, though still quite ripe (14.5% alcohol), and the flavors run through stone fruits and citrus, with hints of lovely floral highlights. Nice wine, but it's hard to believe that consumers will be seduced by Viognier at this price point.
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2001 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Southern Oregon fruit, quite ripe and alcoholic, puts a somewhat bitter edge on this difficult grape. Captures the fruit and tannin, but not the floral elegance.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2002 Del Rio Vineyards Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Very fresh and clean, like a drink of fresh air. There is a slight saltiness to it, a pleasing lightly bitter flavor of citrus rind; good presence, persistence, and length, all in a light, food-friendly style that has plenty of crisp, lively yeastiness.
Name: Rulo Winery 2001 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Sweet and floral, mostly because some Viognier is in the blend. The palate offers zesty citrus, ripe melon and just enough sugar and spice to make things nice. Even on the finish it holds together. A trifle sweet but quite well done. Best Buy.
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2001 Viognier (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Smoky and rustic on the bouquet, with hints of honey and mustard seed. This white combines richness with verve; the flavors are sharp but not tart, featuring lemon and green apple. As far as feel goes, it's rather creamy and substantive, with a mild base of tannins. Good for fish and salads.
Name: Domaine Miquel 2001 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Quite gold in color, with vanilla, candle wax, banana and apricot aromas. All this may make it sound more complex than it is; in reality, it's a basic wine with apple and citrus flavors and a somewhat flat, low-acid feel.
Name: Val d'Orbieu 2001 Reserve St. Martin Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Quite meaty and spicy, with mustard and cured-meat aromatics. This wine is a quick starter but a slow finisher. The banana and pear flavors charm at first but slip away quickly and without much noise. Nonetheless, it's rich and mouthfilling enough to satisfy.
Name: Château Camplazens 2001 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: France, France Other, France
Description: Heavy and waxy, with overdone varietal aromas that seem oily. Lots of pepper and cumin, but what about the fruit and acidity? Nowhere to be found.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 2001 Vin de Pays de l'Ardeche Viognier (France)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The melon, apple and pear aromas aren't as distinctively Viognier as one might expect, but the wine itself is solid and satisfying. The flavor profile is spicy and melony, and feel-wise there's lots of size. (This whopper weighs in at 14.9%, so it should seem big.)  A large, chewy yet mildly buttery finish seals the package as full bodied and rich.
Name: Elk Cove 2001 Del Rio Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: While not smelling much like typical Viognier, this southern Oregon offering is round, sweet and ripe, with honey and apple flavors. The finish is sweet and honeyed, and also quite short. A chunky, full-bodied mouthfeel is the most typical characteristic of the wine.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2001 Del Rio Vineyards Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Mendoza, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: The bouquet of flowers, honey and apples is nice, as is the palate, which is round and full of coconut, banana and other exotic fruits. Some tangerines and limes dance together on the rather big and full finish. —M.S.
Name: Santa Julia 2002 Viognier (Mendoza)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Pear and crème brûlée cover the nose prior to flavors of pears and citrus. This wine is thick, bordering on viscous, but that richness ensures that there's an ultrarich mouthfeel. Still, it seems short on subtleties and nuance.
Name: Steele 2001 Viognier (Lake County)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Sweet and honeyed in the nose, but rather indistinct. The flavors are lemon and banana, while a hint of bitterness frames the palate. Citrusy and tangy throughout due to aggressive acids. Like liquid sucking candy. —M.S.
Name: Lagarde 2002 Henry Lagarde Viognier (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Carneros, Napa-Sonoma, California, US
Description: Big and blowsy aromas of litchi and candied citrus are typical of California Viognier, yet more individual are the flavors of apple, spiced lemon rind and pepper. With no one characteristic dominating, this is a wine that spreads itself all over the map. The finish is hefty, almost fat, while healthy acidity and a citrusy core keep it lively. —M.S.
Name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2001 Signet Collection Viognier (Carneros)

Appellation: Alexander Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Hardly a cookie-cutter wine; this one features sharp aromatics of white grapefruit and pineapple as well as some thistle. The mouthfeel is heavy, as are the flavors of orange, tangerine and banana. When all is said and done it tastes much like a Tropicana juice blend, maybe more so than it should. —M.S.
Name: Wattle Creek 2000 Viognier (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine carries scents of fennel, lime and citrus blossom, elegantly expressed in pretty, tangy fruit that drives to a long, crisp finish. —P.G.
Name: Columbia Winery 2001 Red Willow Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Vin de Pays Var, Provence, France
Description: Triennes is a collaboration of two Burgundian masters—Jacques Seysses (Domaine Dujac) and Aubert de Villaine (Domaine de la Romanée-Conti)—who together purchased a run-down estate in the south of France back in 1990. The wines have steadily improved, yet the prices remain reasonable. This 100% tank-fermented Viognier shows impressive richness and texture allied to flavors of ripe apricots and peaches, plus a dash of Viognier's trademark floral aromas. Despite its weight, there's sufficient acidity to keep it lively.
Name: Triennes 2000 Sainte Fleur Viognier (Vin de Pays Var)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier is rarely so perfectly balanced, intensely flavored without becoming too sweetly perfumed, rich but not so ripe as to lose its subtle elegance.
Name: McCrea 2000 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Sweetly perfumed with citrus blossoms, this is a juicy, mouthfilling wine with ripe citrus, melon and light tropical flavors. The wine fills the palate and lingers, adding hints of anise and mineral to the delicious fruit as it winds through a long, sinuous finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2001 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is made in a very rich style, with lots of forward fruit, flavors of pears, citrus and citrus rind. Somehow the floral elegance of the variety is lost in all the ripe fruit.
Name: Wooldridge Creek 2000 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Georges Vernay is certainly the master of Condrieu. He takes Viognier to extremes and then makes drinkable wines. This evocatively named wine is ripe and creamy, flavored with delicious peaches, apricots and nectarines. The new wood gives an underlayer of spice and vanilla. This wine, from the master of Condrieu, may be low in acidity, but it is wonderfully high in richness.
Name: Domaine Georges Vernay 2000 Les Terrasses de l'Empire  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Condrieu, Rhône Valley, France
Description: This is a balanced, not over-rich Condrieu, with enticing cookedwood flavors. The big attraction, a result partly of the fresh 2000 vintage, is its refreshing acidity, which cuts through the weight and richness and makes it very drinkable.
Name: Yves Cuilleron 2000 Les Chaillets  (Condrieu)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Name: Bridgman 2000 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This is the most intensely flavored and concentrated Viognier I've ever tasted from the U.S. It opens up fragrant and sensual, a soft, seductive blend of sweet fruits, blossoms, pollen and perfume. It explodes in the glass into a rich, vivid wine highlighted with polished fruit, concentrated aromas and lipsmacking acids. Ethereal. —P.G.
Name: Claudia Springs 2000 Lolonis Vineyard Viognier (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The attack is sharp, hot, with an edge of bitter citrus rind; a bit untraditional for Viognier, which so often is floral and softly seductive. This is a big, hard, assertive wine, bracing and flavored with orange peel. Lots of tannin and extract indicate high (over 14%) alcohol. —P.G.
Name: Griffin Creek 2000 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A distinctly musky scent carries aromas of mushrooms mixed with toast and grapefruit, if you can follow that trail. Tart and fruity, it shows green fruit flavors with more of that musty, sweaty saddle undertone, carrying into a high-acid finish. —P.G.
Name: Wooldridge Creek 1999 Viognier (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Viognier can do well in Washington, but this bottle, despite its David Lake Signature Series pedigree, seems to miss the mark. The fruit is buried in new oak, which reduces its flavors to citrus and buttered popcorn, and leaves the finish hard and tannic.
Name: Columbia Winery 2000 Red Willow Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Eden Valley, South Australia, Australia
Description: The family-owned Yalumba winery has made something of a speciality of its Australian Viognier, including one of the top wines in its range, the Virgilius.  This wine, more modestly priced, has ripe peachy fruit, almost tropical, with a finely judged toasty element, leaving a fresh, creamy green taste in the mouth.
Name: Yalumba 2000 Viognier (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Oregon, Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: There's a surprising amount of tannin and a hard, almost bitter edge to this wine, rather than the floral scents and elegance one associates with Viognier. The fruit definitely carries a citrus kick, with plenty of acid, perhaps too much. But with the right food — fresh Northwest oysters spring to mind — it could be just right.
Name: Eugene Wine Cellars 1999 Viognier (Oregon)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cayuse is really on a roll, as the inspired fanatic Christophe Baron methodically plants small plots of rock-strewn Walla Walla vineyard. Cailloux (formerly Cobblestone) was his first, and the single acre of Viognier yielded just 120 cases of wine in 2000, but what a wine! Succulent, glorious, peach-scented fruit mingles with butterscotch rum and a distinct impression of the stony, mineral “terroir” that makes the vineyard exceptional. Full malolactic fermentation and aging in neutral French oak render a Condrieu-styled Washington Viognier that ranks with the best in the country.
Name: Cayuse 2000 Cailloux Vineyard Viognier (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Apricot and orange blossoms, flowers and ginger brighten up the nose, and the ripe, fruity flavors follow through in the mouth. The Columbia valley is far enough north to allow the grapes to ripen without sacrificing the acids, avoiding the flabbiness that mars some California Viogniers. Best Buy.
Name: Hogue 2000 Vineyard Selection Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Not as intensely aromatic as either the sold-out 1998 or the 2000 tasted from barrel, this is nonetheless a solid example. Peach and bitter-almond flavors are carried across the palate by a wine that's rich and full but not fat. Some nice black-pepper notes punctuate the finish.
Name: Bedell 1999 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A slightly floral nose leads into a plump wine, filled with rich melony fruit. Traces of heat and spice adorn the finish.
Name: Pindar Vineyards 1998 Viognier (Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: An absense of the variety's trademark floral and peach aromatics presages the lack of ripeness found on the palate.  An angular peppery streak of green fruit runs through the wine from start to finish, despite good palate presence.
Name: Martha Clara 1999 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Opens with mild petrol and light apricot aromas, layered with butter. But before you discard it as over-the-top, notice the fine acids and long soda-cracker finish. It does well with food and leaves a positive overall impression.
Name: Georges Duboeuf 1999 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A bright, mineral-scented wine with some nice, bready flavors behind the peachy fruit. McCrea is a pioneer with Rhône varietals in Washington and was the first (and still the best) with Viognier.
Name: McCrea 1998 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Napa Valley, Napa, California, US
Description: Bright and penetrating apricot/peach scents burst from the glass. But as with most California Viogniers, the nose is its best feature; the palate impression is one of weight and richness without finesse or elegance.
Name: Beaulieu Vineyard 1997 Signet Collection Viognier (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Although a bit more acidity would have pushed this wine into the next decile, it's still a delicious drink. Floral aromas burst from the glass, backed by pear- and melon-like fruit, plenty of glycerine and richness, and a spicy accent to the medium-length finish.
Name: Preston 1998 Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: If not for the hint of peach on the nose, you might never know this was Viognier. A barely acceptable generic white wine, with any varietal character obliterated by barrel fermentation and oak influences.
Name: Venezia 1997 Sonoma Moment Viognier (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
Description: Honeyed aromas are accompanied by an odd chemical note. Full, even fat in the mouth, with little balancing acidity. Finishes short and peppery.
Name: Rivefort de France 1997 Viognier (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
